lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí Ọmọdé jẹ́ - APA 1
lessons.oriOro: Ẹni tí gbogbo ènìyàn gbà pé ó jẹ́ ọmọdé.
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàlàyé nípa ẹni ti gbogbo ènìyàn gbà pé ó jẹ́ ọmọdé<li>láti jíròrò lórí pàtàkì gbígba ìhìnrere gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọdé<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ìwà ọmọdé tí ó dára kí àwọn Kristẹni ṣe àwòkọ́ṣe rẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: Nínú ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ sáyẹ́nsì, ọmọdé túmọ̀ sí ẹni tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bí títí di ìgbà tí ó bàlágà. Ṣùgbọ́n ní ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn amòfin, ọmọdé ni ẹnikẹ́ní tí ọjọ́ orí rẹ̀ kò bá tíì dàgbà èyí tíì tó ọdún méjìdínlógún ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè - èyí sì ni àjọ UNICEF faramọ́. Nínú Bíbélì, ìgbà tí a dárúkọ ọmọ àti àwọn ọmọdé ju ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀jọ (1500) lọ a sì lo ọ̀rọ̀ yìí fún ọmọ tí ó wà nínú oyún tàbí ẹni tí ó wà láàárín ọmọ tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ já lẹ́nu ọmú sí ọmọ tí ó bàlágà. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Jesu fi àìdùnnú Rẹ̀ hàn sí àwọn ọmọ-ẹ̀yìn Rẹ̀ tí wọ́n dá àwọn ọmọdé lẹ́kun láti wá sí ọ̀dọ̀ Rẹ̀ Ó sì fi ìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé àwọn àti àwọn tí ó bá lè gba ìhìnrere bíi ti ọmọdé ni ìjọba Òun wà fún. Nínú ìtàn àròsọ, a máa ń tọ́ka sí ìhùwàsí àti ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọdé nínú ipa tí ó kó àti láti ṣàfihàn gbogbo ìwà tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ti ọmọdé, àwọn bí ìwà àìmọ̀kan, ìrẹ̀lẹ̀, àìwa-ayé-mọ́-àyà, ìwà mímọ́, ìkónimọ́ra, fífẹ́ láti di titun, ọkàn tí ó ṣófo, àìlágbára, fífẹ́ láti ní òmìnira àti sísa ipá. Èyí ni yóò ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti lè máa ṣe àfihàn àwọn ìwà ọmọdé tí ó bójúmu nínú ìgbé ayé wa ojoojúmọ́.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Láti inú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ ẹni tí gbogbo ènìyàn àti Bíbélì gbà pé ó jẹ́ ọmọdé. Gen 16: 11; Gen 21: 8<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ibi-kíkà wa àti àwọn ẹsẹ mííràn tí a tọ́ka sí, kín ni ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọdé? I Sam 1: 22-24;Owe 22: 6<li>Ní ìtọ́kasí Mark 10: 15, ṣe àlàyé ohun tí ó túmọ̀ sí kí a gba ìhìnrere gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọdé.<li>Jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí àwọn Kristẹni fi lè ṣe àwòkọ́ṣe àwọn ìwà tí ó dára nínú ayé ọmọdé láti lè fi sọ ìjọba ọ̀run di gbígbòòrò.Matiu 18: 1-5.
lessons.ipari: Ọmọdé dúró fún ẹni tí ó ní àfojúsùn láti dàgbàsókè bákan náà ni ó dúró fún ipele ìgbé ayé nínú èyí tí a ti sọ àgbàlagbà di ọ̀tun nípa gbígbé ẹ̀mí ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ wọ̀. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn ọmọdé ti ń dàgbàsókè, tí wọ́n ń ní ìwà àgbà àti tí wọ́n sì ń ní ẹ̀mí ìtẹríba fún àwọn òbí wọn, bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ ni ó ṣe yẹ kí àwọn Kristẹni máa dàgbà nínú bíbá Ọlọ́run rìn àti nínú fífi ara wọn jì fún Un.
lessons.funIronu: O ní láti dàbí ọmọ kékeré nínú ìrìn rẹ pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run.
lessons.akosori: Mark 10: 15 - "Lóòótọ́ ni mo wí fún yín, ẹnikẹ́ni tí kò bá gba ìjọba Ọlọ́run gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ kékeré, kì yóò le wọ inú rẹ̀ bí ó ti wù kí ó rí"
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: The Universal perspectives of a Child
lessons.aims: <li>to explain the universal concept of a child.<li>to discuss the importance of accepting the gospel like a child. <li>to discuss the positive attributes of a child that Christians need to emulate.
lessons.introduction: In the biological science, a child is defined as a person between birth and puberty. Whereas, in legal parlance, the term child refers to anyone below the age of majority which is 18 years in most nations - This definition is upheld by UNICEF. Biblically, Child and children are mentioned in over 1,500 times in the Bible (KJV) and the word always refers to the baby in the womb or to a person between the weaning ages to puberty. In our text, Jesus shows His displeasure at His disciples who rebuked the children from coming to Him and He affirms that His kingdom belongs to them and those who can receive the gospel like a little child. The child has always found a place in the literary imagination, both as a character in his or her own right and as a representation of all the qualities associated with childhood: innocence, humility, simplicity, purity, receptivity, freshness, emptiness, vulnerability, freedom, and potentiality. This study should quicken us to display the positive attributes of a child in our daily living.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol> <li> From the study today, analyse the universal and biblical perspectives of a Child. Gen 16: 11; Gen 21:8.<li> According to our text and other biblical passages, what are the basic rights of a child? I Sam 1: 22-24; Prov. 22:6. <li> With reference to Mark 10: 15, explain what it means to accept the gospel like a Child. <li> Discuss some of the ways Christians can emulate the positive attributes of a child to advance the kingdom of God. Matt 18: 1-5.
lessons.conclusion: The child signifies the goal of human development and also represents that stage of life in which the old person, transformed, acquires a new simplicity. As children grow, mature, and develop a sense of devotion to their parents so are Christians expected to grow unto maturity in their walk with God and be devoted unto Him.
lessons.foodForThougth: You must become as little children in your walk with God.
lessons.memoryVerse: Mark 10: 15 - “Verily I say unto you, whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí ọmọdé jẹ́ - 2
lessons.oriOro: Ẹni tí Bíbélì gbà pè ọmọdé jẹ́ (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣàlàyé nípa ohun tí Bíbélì wí nípá ọmọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ inú.<li>Láti jíròrò lórí àgbékalẹ̀ Bíbélì lórí oyún ṣíṣẹ́.<li>Láti jíròrò lórí ìtọ́jú ọmọ inú.
lessons.ifaara: Ẹ̀kọ́ tí Bíbélì kọ́ wa ni pé ìgbé ayé wa bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìgbà tí a ti wà ní inú (Ps 139: 13-16). Nítorí náà, ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì fún ọmọdé ni ẹni tí a lóyún rẹ̀ sínú (ọmọ inú) títí dé ẹni tí ó bàlágà. Nínú ibi-kíkà wa, Olúwa ṣí Rèbékà ní inú, ó sì lóyún ọmọ ìlérí méjì tí wọ́n dúró fún orílẹ̀-èdè méjì nínú rẹ̀. Ìwé Mímọ́ fi ìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé Ọlọ́run ni ó dá gbogbo ènìyàn àti ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run ni Ó dá wọn, èyí sí túmọ̀ sí pé gbogbo ọmọ inú jẹ́ iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ Ọlọ́run (Isaiah 44: 2; Oniw 11: 5). Ọmọ inú ni àmì àgbáyé fún àmúyẹ ọjọ́ iwájú; ìdí nìyí tí ó fi nílò ìtọ́jú àti ìtọ́sọ́nà pàtàkì, àti láti sinmi lé ìyá rẹ̀ fún ìdàgbàsókè àti ìwàláàyè rẹ̀. Ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí yóò jẹ́ kí a mọ pàtàkì ọmọ inú àti láti fún àwọn ọmọ inú ní ìtọ́jú tí ó péye.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ibi-kíká wa, ta ni ẹni tí Bíbélí pè ní ọmọ? Gen. 25: 23; Gen 38: 27, Isa 44: 2<li>Ǹjẹ́ ẹ̀dá alààyè ni oyún inú tàbí ohun aláìlẹ́mìí lásán? Isa. 49: 1, Jeremiah 1: 5, Luke 1: 41, Luke 1:44.<li>Kín ni àṣẹ tí Bíbélì pa nípa oyún ṣíṣẹ́? Gen. 9: 5-6, Eks 20: 13, Eks 21: 22-25,Matiu 18:14.<li>Báwo ni a ṣe lè mọ rírí ẹ̀bùn alààyè tí a lóyún rẹ̀ sínú? Onidajo 13: 12-14, Luke 1: 15, Luke 1: 42
lessons.ipari: Káàkiri inú Ìwé Mímọ́ ni Ọlọ́run ti fi ìdì pàtàkì ìgbé ayé gbogbo ènìyàn múlẹ̀ - bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti àwọn ọmọ inú títí dé orí àwọn àgbàlagbà. Nítorí náà, a gbọ́dọ̀ máa mọ rírì àwọn ọmọ inú, kì í ṣe kí a máa bà wọ́n jẹ́ nítorí tí àwọn ọmọ inú dúró fún agbára tí a kò le fi ẹnu sọ, okun, ìdàgbàsókè tí kò lẹ́gbẹ́ àti ìrètí aráyé.
lessons.funIronu: Gbogbo ọmọ inú ni ó ṣe iyebíye.
lessons.akosori: Jeremiah 1: 5 - "Kí èmi kí ó tó dá ọ ní inú, èmi ti mọ̀ ọ́, kí ìwọ kí ó sì tó ti inú jáde wá ni èmi ti sọ ọ́ di mímọ́, èmi sì yà ọ́ sọ́tọ̀ láti jẹ́ wòlíì fún àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè."
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>To explain the biblical concept of a child as a Baby in the womb. <li>To discuss the biblical injunction on abortion. <li> To discuss the care of the baby in the womb.
lessons.introduction: The biblical doctrine of life is that life begins at conception (Ps 139: 13-16) and thus the biblical meaning of a child is a human being between the stages of conception (Baby in the womb) and puberty. In our text, the Lord opened the womb of Rebecca, and she conceived two children of promise representing two nations in her womb. The scripture affirms that all human life has been created by God and in the image of God, and this means that every child in the womb is a product of God's work (Isa 44: 2, Eccl. 11: 5). The child in the womb is a universal symbol of future potentiality and that is why he/she needs special care and nurture, and utter dependence on his/her mother for growth and survival. Today's study should inspire you to value every child in the womb and to treat the child in the womb with uttermost care.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> According to our study, what is the biblical concept of a child? Gen. 25: 23, Gen 38: 27, Isa 44: 2 <li> Is the child in the womb a living being or ordinary unliving thing? Isa 49: 1, Jeremiah 1: 5, Luke 1: 41, Luke 1:44 <li> What is the biblical injunction on abortion? Gen. 9: 5-6, Exodus 20: 13, Exodus 21: 22-25, Matt. 18:14.  <li> How can we appreciate the gift of human life in the womb? Judges 13: 12-14, Luke 1: 15, Luke 1:42.
lessons.conclusion: Throughout the scripture, God affirms the value of every human life - from children in the womb to the elderly. Therefore, every human life in the womb should be appreciated and not destroyed because the child in the womb represents incredible power, vitality, persistence toward growth, and hope for the world.
lessons.foodForThougth: Every human life in the womb is of great value.
lessons.memoryVerse: Jeremiah 1: 5 - “Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí ọmọ jẹ́ - 3
lessons.oriOro: Ẹni tí Bíbélì gbà pé ọmọ jẹ́ - (2) Ọmọ-ọwọ́
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa àbùdá ọmọde nípa èyí tí ó jẹ mọ́ ohun tí wọ́n nílò.<li>láti ṣe àtẹnumọ́ lórí àwọn ohun tí ó lè ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti dàgbà.
lessons.ifaara:
Ọmọ-ọwọ́ ni ọmọ tí ó wà láàrin ọmọ òòjọ́ sí ọmọ tí ó bàlágà. Àwọn òbí Jesu lórílẹ̀ ayé pèsè ohun gbogbo tí ó nílò bí oúnjẹ aṣaralóore, ilégbèé àti aṣọ fún un láti lè mú kí ó dàgbàsókè nípa ti ara. Síwájú sí i, wọn kò kùnà láti pèsè fún un nípa ti ẹ̀mí, nípa mímú un lọ sí Jerusalẹmu fún ìsìn ti ẹ̀mí. Èyí sì mú kí Jesu dàgbàsókè àti kí ó di alágbára nínú Ẹ̀mí, ó kún fún ọgbọ́n, oore-ọ̀fẹ́ Ọlọ́run sì ń bẹ lára rẹ̀.
Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni àti òbí, a kò gbọ́dọ̀ fi àyè sílẹ̀ láti jẹ́ kí ìpènijà àkókò yìí gbé ọkàn wa kúrò nínú àfojúsùn wa fún ọ̀run nípa pípèsè fún àwọn ọmọ wa nípa ti ara àti nípa ti ẹ̀mí. Ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí yóò tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí bí a ṣe le ṣe èyí ní àṣeyọrí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li> Dárúkọ àwọn ohun tí a lè fi ojú rí tí ó fi ìyàtọ̀ hàn láàrin ìgbà èwe àti ìgbà tí ọmọ bá bàlágà. 1Ko 13: 11, 1Peteru 2: 2<li> Àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ wo ni a lè rí kọ́ nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó wà nínú Luke 2: 243-46?<li> Gẹ́gẹ́ bí onígbàgbọ́, tọ́kasí àwọn ohun tí ó lè ṣe ìdíwọ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè wa nípa ti ara àti nípa ti ẹ̀mí àti pé báwo ni a ṣe lè yẹra fún wọn? Luke 2: 40, Jakobu 3: 14-16.<li> Ànfààní wo ni ó wà nínú kí a máa fi Kristi kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa?Owe 22:6.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni, ẹ jẹ́ kí a béèrè lọ́wọ́ ara wa wí pé báwo ni a ṣe ń bẹ àwọn ọmọ wa wò ní ilé-ìwé wọn sí? A lè máa dojúkọ àwọn onírúurú ìpèníjà tí ó lè mú kí ó nira tábí kí ó má ṣe é ṣe fún wa láti bá àìní àwọn ọmọ wa pàdé, ṣùgbọ́n, ó dájú pé àdúrà, ìfaradà àti ìdúróṣinṣin wa nínú ìgbàgbọ́ yóò ràn wá lọ́wọ́.
lessons.funIronu: Kọ́ ọmọdé lónìí, òun yóò kọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè lọ́la.
lessons.akosori: Owe 22: 6, "Tọ́ ọmọdé ní ọ̀nà tí yóò tọ̀; nígbà tí ó sì dàgbà tán, kì yóò kúrò nínú rẹ̀."
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Biblical concept of a child (2) An infant
lessons.aims: <li>to study the characteristic of a child pertaining to their needs.<li>to pay more attention on things that can aids their growth
lessons.introduction: An infant is a child from birth till adolescent age. The earthly parents of Jesus provided all the amenities necessary for his physical growth such as, good food, shelter and clothing for him. Moreover, they never fail to provide for his spiritual well-being, by taking him to Jerusalem for spiritual rites. This made Jesus to grow and become strong in Spirit, filled with wisdom and the grace of God was upon him. As Christians and Parents, we need not allow the present-day challenges to shift our focus from our heavenly mandate of making provision for our Children's physical and spiritual needs. Our Study today will beam more light on how to achieve these.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Mention some physical signs that differentiate infant from adolescent stage of a child.  1Cor 13: 11; 1Pet. 2: 2<li> What lessons can we derive from the incidence in Luk 2: 43-46? <li> As believers, pinpoint those things that can jeopardize our growth both physically and spiritually and how best to avoid them. Luke 2: 40; Jam 3: 14-16<li> What is the importance of teaching Christ to our young ones? Prov. 22: 6
lessons.conclusion: As Christians, let us ask ourselves how often we visit our Children in their schools? we may face numerous challenges that made it difficult or impossible to meet our children needs, however, our prayers, perseverance and steadfastness in faith shall definitely enable us.
lessons.foodForThougth: Build a child today, he will build the nation tomorrow.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov. 22: 6, “Train up a Child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí ọmọ jẹ́ - 4
lessons.oriOro: Ẹni tí Bíbélì gbà pé ó jẹ́ ọmọdé (2) Ẹni tí ó ti di àtúnbí nínú Kristi
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa àwọn ohun tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ dídi àtúnbí nínú ìgbàgbọ́.<li>láti ṣàyẹ̀wò àwọn àmì àti èrè tí ó wà nínú dídi àtúnbí.
lessons.ifaara:
Oríṣíí àwọn mìíràn tí Bíbélì gbà pè ó jẹ́ ọmọdé ni "ẹni tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ di àtúnbí nínú Kristi". Èyí túmọ̀ sí ẹni tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jèrè ọkàn rẹ̀ fún Kristi, tí à ń pè ní "àtúnbí". Èyí túmọ̀ sí kí ènìyàn yípadà kúrò nínú ìwà àtijọ́ tàbí ọ̀nà ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tí ó ti ń tọ̀ sí ọ̀nà ìgbé ayé ìwàbíỌlọ́run.
Ẹni tí ó bá ti di àtúnbí ti di ẹni tí ó ní ìpín nínú ohun tíí ṣe ti ìjọba ọ̀run. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni, a ní láti sa gbogbo ipá wa nípa ìrànlọ́wọ́ Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ láti lè ní ìbáṣepọ̀ rere pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run kí a lè yẹ láti di ọmọ Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li> Báwo ni ẹ̀dá titun nínú Kristi ṣe yé ọ sí, ọ̀nà wo ni o sì lè gbà bá ẹni tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ di ẹ̀dá títun lò nínú Ìjọ Ọlọ́run? 1Peteru 2: 1-3; Heb.5: 12-14.<li> Dárúkọ àwọn àmì àfojúrí àti ti Ẹ̀mí tí a lè rí nínú ayé ẹni tí ó di àtúnbí nínú Kristi.  1Ko 13: 11, 1Joh 3: 9; 1Joh 4: 7; 1Joh 5:18. <li> Kín ni èrè tí à ń retí gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni tí ó ti di ojúlówó àtúnbí àti ohun tí yóò jẹ́ àtubọ̀tán kí ènìyàn má di àtúnbí? 1Joh.  5:4, Romu 8: 16-17, 2 Peteru 1:4. <li> Nínú èrò tìrẹ, kín ni àwọn ewu tí ó wà nínú jíjẹ́ "àtúnbí èkè"sí ìgbàgbọ́ Kristẹni gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti ń farahàn nínú àwọn ìjọ kan?Matiu 15: 8-9; Matt. 23: 27-28; Efe.4: 14
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ṣe rí i nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí, àwọn onígbàgbọ́ gbọ́dọ̀ yẹra fún àwọn ìgbé ayé tí ó lè fi wọ́n hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí àtúnbí èké, àti kí wọ́n fi ìfẹ́ Kristi bá àwọn tí ó bá ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ di àtúnbí lò nínú Ìjọ.
lessons.funIronu: Ṣé àtúnbí ni ọ́ tábí àtúnbí èké?
lessons.akosori: 1Peteru 2: 2 "Bí ọmọ-ọwọ́ titun, kí ẹ máa fẹ́ wàrà ti Ẹ̀mí náà èyí tí kò ní ẹ̀tàn, kí ẹ̀yin kí ó lè máa ti ipasẹ̀ rẹ̀ dàgbà sí ìgbàlà"
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Biblical concept of a child (3) Newborn in Christ
lessons.aims: <li>to study the nature of new birth in faith<li>to verify the signs and reward of new birth.
lessons.introduction: Another Biblical concept of a child is a “newborn in Christ”. It means a new convert, popularly referred to as “Born Again”. It simply means turning away from old or sinful ways of life to godly livelihood. He that is born again becomes partaker in the things of heaven. As a Christian, we must make concerted effort through the help of Holy Spirit to develop good relationship with God as to qualify as a child of God.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by a newborn in Christ and how best can we relate with a newborn in the Church? 1Pet 2: 1-3; Heb. 5: 12-14.<li> Mention the physical and spiritual signs of a new birth in Christ.  1Cor 13: 11; 1John 3: 9; 1John 4: 7; 1John 5:18<li> What do we stand to gain as genuine born-again Christians and the repercussion of not been born again? 1John 5: 4; Rom. 8: 16-17; 2Pet 1:4.  <li> In your own opinion, what are the dangers of fake “born-again” syndrome as noticed in some denomination to Christian faith? Matt 15: 8-9; Matt 23: 27-28; Eph 4:14.
lessons.conclusion: In the light of today's lesson, believers need to shun lifestyles that are capable of portraying them as fake born-again children of God, and through the love of Christ relate well with the new convert in the Church.
lessons.foodForThougth: Are you a born again or born against?
lessons.memoryVerse: 1Pet 2: 2: “As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Gbígba ọmọ sínú Ìjọ (1)
lessons.oriOro: Gba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ sì kìlọ̀ fún un ní ọ̀nà títọ́
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàfihàn ohun tí gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ túmọ̀ sí<li>láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa ìbáṣepọ̀ láàrin gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ nípa ti ara àti nípa ti ẹ̀mí.
lessons.ifaara: Gbígba ọmọ sínú agbo túmọ̀ sí ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbé ayé ẹni pẹ̀lú ẹnìkan. Gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ jẹ́ àmì ìdàgbàsókè nínú ayé ọmọdé. Ọmọdé a máa fi ọmú mímu sílẹ̀ lọ sí ipele jíjẹ àwọn oúnjẹ aṣaralóore mìíràn. Ní ipele yìí, ọmọ náà kò ní máa jẹ wàrà nìkan mọ́. Jíjẹ wàrà nìkan kò le yó o ní ipele titun tí ó wà fún ìdàgbàsókè rẹ̀ nípa ti ara. Bí a bá fi ojú ẹ̀mí wò ó, ó yẹ kí Kristẹni dàgbà dé ipele tí kò ti ní í máa jẹ "wàrà"nìkan. Ipele yìí ni yóò ti lè kọ́ni tí yóò sì ti lè gba ẹ̀kọ́ ní ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Báwo ni gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ ti yé ọ sí? <li>Kín ni Hana ṣe lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí ó gba ọmú lẹ́nu Samueli? (I Sam 1: 24-27) ẹ̀kọ́ wo ni a sì lè rí nínú èyí gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni?<li>Jíròrò lóri gbígba ẹnú lẹ́nu ọmọ nípa ti ara àti gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ nípa ti Ẹ̀mí. I Sam 2: 11-18; Luke 2: 39-40, 1Ko 13: 11; 1Ko 14: 20, Efesu 4: 14<li>Jíròrò lórí ipa gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ nípa ti Ẹ̀mí bí ó ṣe wà nínú Isa.7: 15, 1Ko 2: 6; Heb.5: 13-14.
lessons.ipari: Àwọn Kristẹni tí wọ́n jẹ́ òbí ní ojúṣe láti ṣe nípa títọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn ní ọ̀nà Ọlọ́run kí wọ́n sì máa tọ́ wọn títí tí wọn yóò fi dàgbà dé ipele mìíràn nínú ìgbésí ayé wọn. Irú ojúṣe kan náà ni à ń bèèrè lọ́wọ́ wa nípa títọ́jú àwọn ènìyàn nípa ti ẹ̀mí títí tí wọn yóò fi di àgbàlagbà nínú Kristi
lessons.funIronu: Gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ ń yọrí sí gbígba ọmọ náà là.
lessons.akosori: 1 Cor.  13: 11:"Nígbà tí mo wà ní èwe, èmi a máa sọ̀rọ̀ bí èwe, èmi a máa mòye bí èwe, èmi a máa gbèrò bí èwe: ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí mo di ọkùnrin tán, mo fi ìwà èwe sílẹ̀"
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Wean and instruct in the right manner
lessons.aims: <li>to expose the concept of weaning a child<li>to study the relationship between physical and spiritual weaning.
lessons.introduction: Initiating means to start a way of life with someone. Weaning of a child is a mark of advancement in the life of the child. The child moves from breastfeeding to other sources of nourishment. At this point, the child does not depend on milk. Living on milk alone could not sustain his new level of physical development. From the spiritual point of view, a Christian is expected to develop to the point of not living on “milk” alone. It is at this point that he can instruct and be instructed in the right manner.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is your understanding of weaning a child? <li> What did Hannah do, after weaning Samuel? I Sam 1: 24-27 and what lessons can we derive from this as Christians?<li> Discuss the relationship between physical weaning and spiritual weaning. I Sam 2: 11-18; Luk 2: 39-40; 1Co 13: 11; 1Co 14: 20; Eph 4:14.<li> Discuss the effects of spiritual weaning in the context of Isa 7: 15; 1Co 2: 6; Heb 5: 13-14.
lessons.conclusion: Christian parents have the responsibility of bringing up their children in godly ways and nurturing them until they advance to the next level of their lives. The same responsibility is required of us in nurturing people spiritually until they stand mature in Christ.
lessons.foodForThougth: Weaning a child leads to winning the child.
lessons.memoryVerse: 1 Cor. 13: 11: “When I was a child, I spoke like a child. I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child, when I became a man, I gave up childish ways.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Gbígba ọmọ sínú agbo (2)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> Láti ṣàfihàn pàtàkì ìre òbí lórí àwọn ọmọ.
lessons.ifaara: Ìsúre túmọ̀ sí ọ̀nà láti béèrè fún ìrànlọ́wọ́. Nínú ìsìn Kristẹni, ó jẹ́ àdúrà ẹ̀bẹ̀ (ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìsìn) àti kíké pe Ọlọ́run fún ìtọ́ni, ìbùkún ẹ̀mí àti ìdáláre. Pípe ìbùkún Ọlọ́run lóòrè-kóòrè jẹ́ ara ọ̀nà tí à ń gbà láti já wọn lẹẹ́nu ọmú láárín àwọn Kristẹn<li> Bí Simeoni àti Anna wòlíì obìnrin ṣe súre fún Jesu ìkókó ṣáfihàn pàtàkì sísúre fún àwọn ọmọ wa láti ìgbà tí wọ́n bá ti wà ní ọmọ-ọwọ́ nítorí tí ó wà lára ìpìlẹ̀ ìgbésí ayé ẹ̀mí wọn (Owe22: 6). Ìre àwọn òbí lórí àwọn ọmọ wọn máa ń ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti gba àgbàyọrí àdúrà ní ọjọ́ iwájú wọn.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ní èrò tìrẹ, túmọ̀ ìsúre àti ìbùkún àwọn òbí lórí àwọn ọmọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣè wà ní Luke 1: 67 & Luke 1:76.<li>Ka Gen.47: 22-26, Luke 2: 34-35 kí o sì jíròrò lórí ìre tí Jakọbu sú fún Josẹfu àti èyí tí Simeoni sú fún Jesu.<li>Báwo ni ìre Jakọbu àti Simeoni ṣe farahàn nínú ayé Josẹfu àti Jesu nígbà tí wọ́n dàgbà? Gen. 50: 15-23, Luke 2: 40,Luke 2:46-47,Luke 2:52, Mark 1: 21-22.<li>Jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí àwọn òbí lè gbà pe ìbùkún Ọlọ́run sórí àwọn ọmọ wọn. Deut. 6: 6-7, Efe.6:4.
lessons.ipari: Bí àwọn òbí bá kọ̀ láti máa pe ìbùkún Ọlọ́run sórí àwọn ọmọ wọn, wọ́n ṣetán láti sọ àwọn ọmọ wọn nù sí ọwọ́ ẹni búburú n<li> Nítorí náà, ẹ jẹ́ kí àwa gẹ́gẹ́ bí òbí mú ojúṣe yìí ní ọ̀kúnkúndún kí a lè ṣe ìmúdúró ìran tí ó ní ìbùkún tí ó sì ń gbé nínú ìbùkún Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ṣe ìbùkùn ni mo jẹ́ àbí ègún fún àwọn ọmọ mi?
lessons.akosori: Luke 1: 76,"Àti ìwọ, ọmọ wòlíì Ọ̀gá-ògo ni a ó máa pè ọ́: nítorí ìwọ ni yóò ṣáájú Olúwa láti tún ọ̀nà rẹ̀ ṣe."
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: to show the importance of parental blessings upon the children.
lessons.introduction: Invocation is the act or process of petitioning for help or support. In Christianity, it is a prayer of entreaty (as at the beginning of a service of worship) and calling on God for guidance, spiritual blessings and justification. Invoking God's blessings continually upon the children is part of the weaning process among Christians. The blessing of Simeon and Anna the Prophetess upon Baby Jesus, shows us the importance of invoking blessings upon children from their infancy because it is part of their spiritual foundation (Proverbs 22: 6 ). Parental blessings upon their children keep and sustain them in the years ahead.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> In your own term, define invocation and parental blessing in the context of Luke 1: 67 and 76<li> Read Gen. 49: 22-26; Luk 2: 34-35 and discuss the invocation of blessings of Jacob upon Joseph and that of Simeon upon Jesus.<li> How does the invocation of Jacob and Simeon manifest in the lives of Joseph and Jesus as they grew? Gen 50: 15-23; Luk 2: 40, Luk 2:46-47, Luk 2:52; Mk 1: 21-22.<li> Discuss ways through which parents can invoke God's blessings upon their children. Deut. 6: 6-7; Eph 6:4.
lessons.conclusion: Parents stand the risk of losing their children to the evil one if they don't consciously invoke God's blessings upon them. Let us therefore as Christian parents take this role seriously in order to raise a generation that will carry and sustain God's blessings.
lessons.foodForThougth: Am I a blessing or a curse to my children?
lessons.memoryVerse: Luke 1: 76: “And thou child shall be called the prophet of the Most High, for thou shall go before the Lord to prepare His ways.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Gbígba ọmọdé sínú Agbo Kristi (3).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣàlàyé baptismu ọmọ-ọwọ́,<li>Láti ṣàlàyé baptismu ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìkọla àti<li>láti ṣe atótónu lórí àwọn ẹsẹ Bíbélì tí ó gbe baptismu ọmọdé lẹ́sẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: "Baptisimu ọmọ-ọwọ́"tí a tún ń pè ní "Ìsọmọlórúkọ"nínú àwọn àṣà Kristẹni kan ni àṣà ìsàmì àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́. Baptismu àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́ ni a gbàgbọ́ pé ó jẹ́ abala kan nínú ọ̀nà tí a ń gbà ṣe ìkọlà tí Majẹ̀mú Titun gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀ nínú Májẹ̀mú Láéláé ti a ṣàlàyé rẹ̀ nínú Col 2: 11-12. Àwọn ọmọdé náà jẹ́ ara májẹ̀mú Ọlọ́run gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ṣe rí i nínú Bíbélì (ṣe àfiwé Gen. 17: 7; Deut. 29: 10-12;Ise 2: 38-39). Bákan náà ni baptismu jẹ́ èdìdì Májẹ̀mú Titun nínú Kristi, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti ń ṣe ìwẹ̀nùmọ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ àti tí ó dúró fún gbígba àwọn ọmọdé sínú agbo Kristi èyí tí ìkọlà ń tọ́ka sí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni òye rẹ nípa baptismu àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́?<li>Láti inú àwọn ibi-kíká wọ̀nyí, jíròrò lórí ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ Bíbélì fún baptismu àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́. Gen. 17: 7;Ise 16: 14-15,Ise 16:32-33 ní àsomọ́ pẹ̀lú ìkọlà; Col 2: 11-12<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni, báwo ni o ṣe lè ṣègbè lẹ́yìn baptismu àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́?Matiu 19: 13-14;Ise 2: 38-39, Ifi 20:12.<li>Ǹjẹ́ baptismu jẹ́ ọ̀nà tààrà sí ìjọba ọ̀run? Jíròrò ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú títọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa ní ọ̀nà òtítọ́ láti lè pèsè wọn fún ìjọba Ọlọ́run.Ise. 21: 8-9; 2Tim.1: 5-6
lessons.ipari: Baptismu àwọn ọmọ-ọwọ́ jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ogún tí ó dára jùlọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ìjọ Ọlọ́run. Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé òun kìí ṣe ìwé ìrìnnà sí Ìjọba Ọlọ́run, ṣùgbọ́n gbígba àwọn ọmọdé sínú agbo Kristẹni nípasẹ̀ ìjẹ́wọ́ wọn láti ẹnu àwọn onígbọ̀wọ́ wọn. Nítorí náà, a ní láti gba àwọn òbí tíí ṣe Kristẹni níyànjú láti má ṣe fi èyíkèyí ànfààní pàtàkí wọ̀nyí du àwọn ọmọ wọn láti mú wọn wọ inu agbo Kristi
lessons.funIronu: Ẹ̀sìn yòówù tí kò bá fi ààyè gba ọmọdé yóò parẹ́ láìpẹ́ ọjọ́.
lessons.akosori: Ise. 16: 33,"Ó sì mú wọn ní wákàtí náà ní òru, ó wẹ ọgbẹ́ wọn; a sì baptisi rẹ̀, àti gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn rẹ̀ lójú kan náà."
lessons.theme: The reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to explain infant baptism, <li>to relate baptism with circumcision and<li>to expatiate on some biblical bases for infant baptism
lessons.introduction: “Paedobaptism,” also called “Christening in some Christian tradition, is the practice of baptising infants. The baptism of infants is believed to be the New Testament typology of the Old Testament doctrine of circumcision as enshrined in Col. 2: 11-12. Children were part of God's Covenant as seen in the Bible (cf. Gen. 17: 7; Deut. 29: 10-12; Acts 2: 38-39). Likewise, baptism is the seal of this New Covenant in Christ, as it brings cleansing from sin and acceptance of children into Christendom which circumcision signified.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is your understanding of infant baptism?<li> From the following passages, discuss biblical basis for infant baptism. Gen 17: 7;  Acts 16: 14-15, Acts 16:32-33, and its connection to circumcision; Col. 2: 11-12 <li> As a Christian, how can you justify infant baptism? Matt 19: 13-14; Acts 2: 38-39; Rev 20:12.<li> Does baptism automatically lead to heaven?  Discuss in line with righteous upbringing in preparing our children for the kingdom of God. Acts 21: 8-9; 2Tim 1: 5-6.
lessons.conclusion: Infant baptism is one of our many rich heritages as a church. Even though it is not a license into the kingdom of God, but a reception of children into the Christian fold through confession made on their behalf by their godparents. Therefore, we must encourage Christian parents not to deny their children this all-important opportunity of having them initiated into the Body of Christ.
lessons.foodForThougth: Quick eradication awaits any religion without children
lessons.memoryVerse: Acts 16: 33: “And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their wounds, and he was baptised at once, with all his family.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àbùdá àti ìhùwàsí ọmọdé (1).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti jíròrò lórí ìrísí ìjáfáfá nínú ayé ọmọdé àti<li>Láti ṣàfihàn bí ìjáfáfá àwọn ọmọdé ti jọ eré-ìje Kristẹni wa.
lessons.ifaara: Láti jẹ́ ẹni tí ó jáfáfá gẹ́gẹ́ bí atúmọ̀-èdè ti Merriam Webster lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélukára túmọ̀ sí kí ènìyàn máa yára kánkán nínú ìgbésẹ̀ rẹ̀. Jíjẹ́ ọmọdé tí ó jáfáfá ni wọn kì í ṣe fẹ́ kí ọwọ́ àwọn dilẹ̀. Àwọn ọmọdé máa ń ní agbára nítorí tí wọ́n ń dàgbàsóké, àwọn ọmọ tí ó jẹ́ aláápọn máa ń ní ìwúrí, àfojúsùn àti àṣeyọrí púpọ̀ nínú ìdáwọ́lé wọn. Nínú ibi-kíká wa lónìí, Jesu tí í ṣe àpẹẹrẹ wa fi èrò Rẹ̀ hàn láti ṣe iṣẹ́ Baba Rẹ̀ nípa dídúró lẹ́yìn ní Jerusalẹmu (Luke 2: 43). Àwọn ibere wa yóò tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí èyí síwájú si àti bí a ṣe lè kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nínú èyí nínú eré-ìje Kristẹni wa.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Báwo ni ó ṣe lè ṣàlàyé jíjá fáfá nínú ayé ọmọdé gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà ní Luke 2: 43? Ṣàfiwé Eks 2: 4, 7-8 àti   I Sam 3:1.<li>Nínú ibi-kíkà òkè yíí, (Luke 2: 43; Eks 2: 4, 7-8 àti 1Sam.3: 1), báwo ni o ṣe lè fi ìdánilójú hàn pé ìjáfáfá ọmọdé máa ń mú àṣeyọrí wá ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà?<li>Kín ni ìjáfáfá Kristẹni túmọ̀ sí? Àǹfààní rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà ní Eks  23: 25-26; Jos 1: 8; I Sam 7: 3;Ise. 4: 33-34.<li>Báwo ni àwa, bí àwọn ọmọdé, ṣe le jẹ́ ẹni tí ó jáfáfá nínú àwọn ohun tíí ṣe tí Ọlọ́run ní irú àkókò báyìí tí iná ìtara fún iṣẹ́ ìríjú Kristẹni ń jó lọ ilẹ̀ yìí? Ps 69: 9;Matiu 6: 33; Jak.2:17.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni, ẹ jẹ́ kí a kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lára ìjáfáfá ọmọdé kí a sì jẹ́ ẹni tí ó jáfáfá nínú eré-ìje Kristẹni wa. Kí a jẹ́ onígbàgbọ́ kò tó; a ní láti jẹ́ ẹni tí ó jáfáfá nínú ìwàásù ọ̀rọ̀ náà kí a sì tún tẹ̀síwájú nínú àwọn ohun tí í ṣe ti Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Láti jáfáfá nínú àwọn ohun tí í ṣe ti Ọlọ́run ni kí Ọlọ́run náà jáfáfá lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ayé wa.
lessons.akosori: Jakobu 2: 17, "Bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ìgbàgbọ́, bí kò bá ní iṣẹ́, ó kú nínú ara."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Personality and character traits of a child (1)
lessons.aims: <li>to discuss the nature of activeness in a child and<li>to expose the relevance of Children's activeness to our Christian race.
lessons.introduction: To be active according to Merriam-Webster online dictionary means quick in physical movement. Activeness in a child is that ability in them to always wanting to do something at all times. Children are naturally energetic because they are still growing and developing. Physically, active children are motivated, focused and mostly successful in all that they do. In our text today, Jesus, our perfect example activated his intention to do His father's work by staying back in Jerusalem.  (Luke 2: 43). Our study guide shall expose us more to this and how we can learn from this in our Christian race.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> How can you explain activeness in a child in the context of Luke 2: 43? Compare Exod 2: 4,7-8; and I Sam 3:1.<li> In the contexts above, (Luke 2: 43; Exod 2: 4,7-8; and I Sam 3: 1) how can you justify that children's activeness mostly leads to success?<li> What is Christian Activeness? And the benefits in the context of Exod. 23: 25-26; Josh 1: 8; I Sam 7: 3; Acts 4: 33-34.<li> How can we, like children, be active in the things of God in a time like this, when zeal for Christian stewardship is going down? Psalm 69: 9; Matt. 6: 33; Jam 2: 17
lessons.conclusion: As Christians, let us learn from the active trait of a child and be active in our Christian race. Being a believer is not enough; we must be active in preaching the word and continuously take part in the things of God.
lessons.foodForThougth: To be active in the things of God is for God to be active in our lives.
lessons.memoryVerse: James 2: 17 “In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àbùdá àti ìhùwàsí ọmọdé
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣe atótónu lórí ẹ̀mí ìlépa nínú ayé ọmọdé àti<li>Láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ibi-kíkà nínú Ìwé Mímọ́ nípa ìlépa àti ipa tí ó ní lórí eré-ìje Kristẹni wa.
lessons.ifaara: Ìlépa túmọ́ sí níní ìpinnu ọkàn láti ṣe àṣeyọrí tàbí láti ní ohun tí ènìyàn fojú sùn. Ó jẹ́ ohun tí ó ń ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti ní ìgboyà àti láti ṣe àṣeyọrí. Ìlépa nínú ayé ọmọdé jẹ́ agbára láti ní ohun kan. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti rí i nínú ibi-kíkà wa lónìí, ìwà yìí jẹyọ nínú ayé Josẹfu nípasẹ̀ àwọn àlá rẹ̀ (Gen.35: 5-10). Dafidi, nínú 1Sam. 17: 32-50 lépa láti bá Goláyátì jà. Sísá eré-ìje Kristẹni láì ní ìlépa láti ṣe àṣeyọrí àti láti jọba pẹ̀lú Kristi lè já sí òfo. Ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì yìí wà láti túbọ̀ le jíròrò síi lórí èyí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Jíròrò lórí ìlépa àwọn ọmọdé nínú ibi-kíkà wa yìí (Gen.37: 5-10).<li>Fi tọkàntọkàn ṣe àṣàrò lórí I Sam 17: 32-50 kí o sì sọ nípa ẹ̀mí ìlépa Dafidi àti àbájáde rẹ̀.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà nínú Fil.2: 3, ǹjẹ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ni ìlépa tàbí ìwà rere tí ó yẹ kí Kristẹni máa tẹ̀lé? Báwó ni ìlépa ṣe lè jẹ́ ìwà tí ó yẹ nínú iṣẹ́ ìjèrè ọkàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà nínú Mat.28: 19-20; 1Ko 9: 16?<li>Kín ni ìtumọ̀ ṣíṣe àṣejù nínú ìlépa, báwo sì ni ó ṣe le jẹ́ ìdẹkùn fún àwa Kristẹni? 2 Sam.6: 3,6-7; Joh. 18: 10-11.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni, kì í ṣe ohun búburú fún wa láti ní àfojúsùn tàbí ìlépa, ṣùgbọ́n ìlépa wa gbọ́dọ̀ wà lọ́dọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti láti mú ìfẹ́ Rẹ̀ ṣẹ. A ní láti gbé ọkàn wa àti ẹ̀mí wa sọ́dọ̀ Kristi, kí á múra tán kí a sì ní i lọ́kàn láti tẹ̀síwájú bí Ó ti ń tọ́ wa; ní ti pé àṣeyọrí kò dúró lórí iye owó tí a ní, ṣùgbọ́n lórí àǹfààní láti ní ìfẹ́ áti látí sin àwọn ẹlòmíràn àti kí ògo lè jẹ́ ti Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Kristi ni àfojúsùn ìlépa oníwàbíỌlọ́run.
lessons.akosori: Fil. 2: 3 "Ẹ má ṣe fi ìjà tàbí ògo asán ṣe ohunkóhun, ṣùgbọ́n ní ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ ọkàn ro àwọn ẹlòmíràn sí ẹni tí ó sàn ju ìwọ fúnra rẹ̀ lọ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Personality and character traits of a child (2)
lessons.aims: <li>to expatiate on ambition in children and<li>to discuss the scriptural context of ambitious and its effect on our Christian race
lessons.introduction: Ambitiousness is a strong desire for achieving or obtaining success or specific goal. It is a driving force for courage and success. Ambitiousness in a child is the ability to achieve anything. According to our Bible passage today, this virtue was found in Joseph through his dreams (Gen. 35: 5-10). David (in 1Samuel 17: 32-50) had a very high ambition to fight Goliath. Running the Christian race without ambition to succeed and to reign with Christ can be very fruitless. Our Bible study is designed to discuss more on this.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Discuss children ambition in the context of our text (Gen. 37: 5-10)<li> Critically study   1Samuel 17: 32-50 and narrate the ambitious nature of David and its result.<li> According to Phil 2: 3, is ambitiousness a sin or a virtue for a Christian to be cultivated? And how can ambitiousness be a virtue in soul wining according to Matt. 28: 19-20; 1Cor.9: 16<li> What is over-ambitious and how can it be a bane to Christendom? II Sam 6:3,6-7; John 18: 10-11.
lessons.conclusion: As Christians, it is not wrong for any of us to have the goals and ambitions that drive us, our ambition must focus on God and fulfilling his will. We must position our heart and mind on Christ, ready and willing to move forward as he leads; knowing that success is not based on how much we get, but rather on the opportunities to love and serve others and glorify God in the process.
lessons.foodForThougth: Godly ambition is focused on Christ.
lessons.memoryVerse: Phil 2: 3 “Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit, but in humility consider others better than yourself”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ojú tí Bíbélì fi wo ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo.
lessons.oriOro: Láti ṣàfihàn àwọn ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo nínú Ìwé Mímọ́.
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣe àyẹ̀wò ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo nínú ìwé-mímọ́<li>Láti ṣàlàyé bí àwùjọ, àṣà àti àwọn òbí ti ń lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà-ipá nínú Bíbél<li>Láti jíròrò lórí ipa òdì ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo nípa mímú àpẹẹrẹ jáde láti inú Bíbélì.<li> Láti jíròrò lórí àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ Bíbélì láti lè borí àwọn ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo.<li> Láti mẹ́nuba ojúṣe Ìjọ Ọlọ́run láti mú àdínkù bá àwọn ohun tí ó ń ṣokùnfà ìwà-ipá akọ òun abo.
lessons.ifaara: Bí a bá wo ibi-kíkà wa (Gen. 34), Ṣekemu ọmọkùnrin Hamori fi ipá bá Dina ọmọbìnrin Jakọ́bú lò pọ̀, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí sì yọrí sí ogun tí ó gba ẹ̀mí gbogbo ọkùnrin ilú Ṣekemu. Eléyìí ń fi yé wa pé ìwà-ipá ti ọkùnrin òun obìnrin lè yọrí sí àwọn ìwà-ipá mìíràn tàbí ogun láàárín àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tàbí ẹ̀yà bí a kò bá kíyèsára.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ka ẹsẹ ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run wọ̀nyí, Gen. 16; Gen. 19; Onidajo 19:22-30; 2 Sam. 12; Hosea 1-3; Esek.16:23 kí o sì ṣàlàyé ohun tí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo jẹ́ ní ọ̀rọ̀ tìrẹ.<li>Jíròrò lórí àtubọ̀tán ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú Bíbélì, nípa lílo àpẹẹrẹ Dina nínú Gen. àti 2 Sam. 11: 8-14.<li>Ǹjẹ́ ipò lílò àti ìjẹgàba tí a rí nínú ayé àwọn Baba ìgbàgbọ́ nínú Májẹ̀mu Láéláé lè jẹ́ okùnfà fún lílo ìwà-ipá sí àwọn obìnrin lónìí? Ka Onidajo 19: 22-30; 2 Sam. 19: 22-44; 2 Sam. 11: 1ff; Gen. 19<li>Kín ni ìdí tí ó fi jẹ́ pé àwọn obìnrin ni ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo sábà máa ń pa lára? Ka Eks 21: 7; Eks. 22: 18; Deut.22: 22-23. Ǹjẹ́ ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo sí àwọn ọkùnrin wọ́pọ̀ ní àwùjọ wa lónìí? (Gen. 39: 6-18). Jíròrò.
lessons.ipari: A lè rí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo ní onírúurú ọ̀nà, ó sì gba kí a lo onírúurú ọ̀nà láti kápá rẹ̀. Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run ni ohun èlò tí ó dájú jùlọ láti fi kápá àwọn onírúurú ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo tí a rí lókè yìí. Ọmọdé tàbí ẹni tí kò tíì tó ṣe ìgbéyàwó ni a gbọdọ̀ mú lòdì sí ìbáṣepọ̀ tí kò tọ̀nà yìí. Ìtanijí gbọ́dọ̀ wà nípa àwọn ewu tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ìfipábánilò kí a sì máa fi àwọn ọ̀daràn náà jófin. Àwọn òbí gbọ́dọ̀ ní àkóso lórí ohun tí àwọn ọmọ wọn ń wò lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára. Yàtọ̀ sí èyí, Galatia wí fún wa pé kí a ní ẹ̀mí ìkóra-ẹni-ní-ìjánu (Gal.5: 23). Nígbà náà ni a lè kápá ìdánwò yòówù tí ayé lè mú wá sí ọ̀nà wa.
lessons.akosori: Ps. 119: 11 "Ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ ni mo pamọ́ ní ọkàn mi kí èmi má bàá ṣẹ̀ sí ọ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Biblical Perspective of Gender Based Violence
lessons.topic: Unveiling Gender Based Violence in the Scriptures
lessons.aims: <li>To explore the concept of gender-based violence using scripture<li>To explain the contributing effects of social, cultural and parental factors to GBV within the biblical context<li>To discuss the negative impact of GBV drawing examples from the Bible<li>To discuss the biblical recommendations of recovering from GBV<li>To highlight the role of the church in mitigating the factors causing GBV
lessons.introduction: Considering the text under study (Gen. 34), Dinah the daughter of Jacob was raped by Shechem the son of Hamor, and that incident led to a feud that claimed the lives of all of the males in the land of Shechem. This goes on to say that Gender-based violence could give birth to other kinds of violence or war between nations or tribes if care is not taken.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li>Read the following passages, Gen. 16; Gen. 19; Judges 19: 22-30; 2 Sam. 12; Hosea 1-3; Ezek. 16:23 and explain Gender-based violence in your own words.<li>Discuss the repercussions attached to GBV cases in the Bible, focusing on the case of Dinah Genesis 34, also 2 Sam.13: 8-14, <li>Could the patriarchal superiority and dominance seen in the OT be a factor for violence against women today? Read Judges 19: 22-30; 2 Sam.11: 1ff; Gen19<li>Why are women always at the receiving end in cases of gender-based violence? Read Exod. 21: 7; Exod. 22: 18; Deut. 22: 22-23. Is gender violence against males prevalent in our society today? (Gen. 39: 6-18). Discuss?
lessons.conclusion: Gender-based violence is seen in various forms and so requires various approaches to tackle it. The word of God remains the surest tool to handle the various Gender-based violence seen above.  Child or underage marriage should be discouraged with a strong voice. Awareness should be created of the dangers of rape and the perpetrators of such should be brought to book. There should be some sort of parental control on social media as to the kinds of content released. Besides, Galatians tells us that we have self-control (Gal. 5: 23). Thus, we can handle whatever temptation the world brings our way.
lessons.memoryVerse: Psalm 119: 11“I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ṣíṣàfihàn àwọn ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo - 2
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò ohun tí ìwà-ipá ti akọ àti abo túmọ̀ sí nípa ṣíṣe àmúlò Ìwé Mímọ́.<li>Láti ṣàlàyé bí àwùjọ, àṣà àti àwọn òbi ṣe ń lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú Bíbélí.<li>Láti jírórò lórí ipa òdì ìwà-ipá tí akọ òun abo nípa mímú àpẹẹrẹ jáde láti inú Bíbél<li>Láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà àbáyọ tí Bíbélì ṣe àlàkalẹ̀ rẹ̀ láti bọ́ nínú ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo.<li>Láti ṣe àlàkalẹ̀ ojúṣe Ìjọ Ọlọ́run láti mú àdínkú bá àwọn ohun tó ń ṣe okùnfà ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo.
lessons.ifaara: Láì sí àní-àní, Bíbélì rí gbogbo ìwà-ipá gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ sí Ọlọ́run àti ọmọniyàn. Ó rí i gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwà ìkà ó sí tún rí i gẹ́gẹ́ bí "ohun ìríra sí Olúwa"pàápàá jùlọ Bíbélì lòdì sí ìwà-ipá sí àwọn obìnrin nínú Ìwé Mímọ́. Ipa tí ìwà-ipá, ìyẹn ìbálòpọ́ lọ́nà àìtọ́ àti ìfipábánilòpọ̀ ní kọjá ìpalára tí a lè fi ojú rí, ó tún máa ń fa ọgbẹ́ ọkàn, oyún àìròtẹ́lẹ̀, ìnira ní àkókò ìbímọ àti àwpn àìsàn tí ó jẹ mọ́ ìbálòpọ̀. Bíbélì tọ́ka sí onírúúrú àpẹẹrẹ ìwà-ipá sí akọ òun abo, ní ṣíṣe àtẹnumọ́ pé gbogbo onírúurú ìwà-ipá jẹ́ ṣíṣe lòdì sí òfin Ọlọ́run. Èròngbà ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì yìí ni láti ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ojú tí Bíbélì fi wo ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo, láti wá ìtọ́sọ́nà àti láti gbàdúrà kí òpin lè dé bá gbogbo ìwà àìtọ́ yìí ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ohun tí Bíbélì ń kọ́ wa nípa ìfẹ́ àti àlàáfíà.
lessons.ibere:
1. Báwo ni Bíbélì ṣe túmọ̀ ìdájọ́ àti òdodo? Ps 106:3
  2. Àwọn ọ̀nà wo ni a lè gbà rí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo gẹ́gẹ́ bí ṣíṣe lòdí sí ìdájọ́ àti òdodo Ọlọ́run? Ps11: 7
  3. Ka ìtàn tí ó wà nínú Johanu 8: 1-11
    (a). Kín ni o rò nípa obìnrin tí wọ́n mú nínú ṣíṣe àgbèrè ṣùgbọ́n tí ó jẹ́ pé òun nìkan ni wọ́n mú tọ Jesu wá láti dálẹ́bi?
    (b). Ǹjẹ́ o lè rí àwọn àpẹẹrẹ bí irú èyí nípa ìyàtọ̀ tí ó máa ń wà nínú àgbékalẹ̀ àtí àwọn ohun ti a ń retí lọ́dọ̀ ọkùnrin àti obìnrin nínú Ìjọ Ọlọ́run àti àwùjọ lónìí?
  4. Jesu dá òfin lọ́wọ́ kọ́ nípa àìdá obìnrin tí wọ́n mú nínú ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ àgbèrè nínú ìtàn tí ó wà lókè yìí lẹ́b
  5. Àwọn ọ̀nà wo ni àwa náà ti nílò láti dá òfin lọ́wọ́ kọ́ nípa ẹ̀sìn àti àṣà láti lè mú ìdájọ́ òdodo bá akọ àti abo ní àyé tí a wà yíí? Jíròrò.
  6. Kín ni àwọn àtubọ̀tán kíkọ̀ láti tẹ̀lé àgbékalẹ̀ pàtàkì yìí? Deut. 22: 22-23,Owe 3:33.
lessons.ipari: Ìwé Mímọ́ ní Ps.11: 5 kéde ìkórìíra tí Ọlọ́run ní sí èníyàn búburú àti àwọn tí ó fẹ́ ìwà-ipá; a so ìwà-ipá pọ̀ mọ́ ìwà búburú a sì rí i gẹ́gẹ́ bí "ohun tí Olúwa kórìíra."Ìjọ Ọlọ́run gbọ́dọ̀ sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo, nípa ríronú sí ìpalára rẹ̀ èyí tí ó ń dí àlàáfíà lọ́wọ́ tí ó sì ń mú àìṣòdodo wá. Ó ṣe pàtàkì láti mú ìwà-ipá kúrò pátápátá, bákan náà ni Ìjọ Ọlọ́run kò gbọ́dọ̀ fi àyè gba ìwà-ipá láàrin àwọn Ìjọ àti agbègbè wọn ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìdájọ́ Ọlọ́run. Ìwé Mímọ́ ṣe àtẹnumọ́ nípa ṣíṣe àfihàn àti fífi òpin sí ìwà-ipá, ní ṣíṣe àtìlẹyìn fún àwọn agbófinró láti máa fi ìyà jẹ àwọn arúfin. Nípa títẹ̀lé òfin Ọlọ́run, Ìjọ Ọlọ́run ń ṣe ojúṣe rẹ̀ nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà-ipá àti ṣíṣe òdodo (Efesu 5: 11-13, Romu 13, 1Peteru 2,Ise 23: 12-22).
lessons.akosori: Ps.11: 5, "Olúwa n dán olódodo wò: ṣùgbọ́n ènìyàn búburú àti ẹni tí ó fẹ́ ìwà-ipá, ni ọkàn rẹ̀ kórìíra."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.aims: Aims:<li>To explore the concept of gender-based violence using scripture<li>To explain the contributing effects of social, cultural and parental factors to GBV within the biblical context<li>To discuss the negative impact of GBV drawing examples from the Bible<li>To discuss the biblical recommendations of recovering from GBV<li>To highlight the role of the church in mitigating the factors causing GBV
lessons.introduction: The Bible unequivocally condemns all violence as an offense against God and humanity, associating it with wickedness and deeming it "detestable to the Lord."Particularly, violence against women is explicitly condemned in scripture. The impact of violence- including rape and sexual assault; extends beyond physical harm to enduring emotional distress, unwanted pregnancies, complications during birth, and Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STIs). The Bible addresses various instances of violence against both genders, emphasizing that all forms of gender-based violence are criminal acts contrary to God's law. This Bible study aims to explore gender-based violence from a biblical perspective, seeking guidance to understand and pray for an end to this injustice in alignment with Bible ' teachings on love and peace.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li>How does the Bible define justice and righteousness? Psalm 106: 3<li>1b. In what ways can gender-based violence be seen as a violation of God's justice and righteousness? Psalm 11: 7<li>Read the story in John 8: 1-11. (a) What do you feel about the woman caught in the very act of adultery but brought alone to Jesus to be condemned? (b) Do you see such examples of different standards and unequal expectations for men and women in the church and society today? <li>Jesus subverts the status quo by not condemning the woman in the story above. In what ways might we need to subvert the religious or cultural status quo to bring about gender justice in our world? Discuss<li>What are the implications of violating this fundamental principle? In Deuteronomy 22: 22-23, Prov. 3:33.
lessons.conclusion: The scripture in Psalm 11: 5 declares God's hatred for the wicked and those who love violence, linking violence with wickedness and deeming it "detestable to the Lord."The church must address gender-based violence (GBV), considering any harm that impedes peace and possess potential for injustice. Eradicating GBV is crucial, and the church must actively discourage it among members and communities, aligning with God's justice. Scripture emphasizes exposing and stopping abuse, urging support for legal authorities to punish offenders. Embracing God-given human authorities, the church plays a role in preventing abuse and ensuring justice (Ephesians 5: 11-13, Romans 13, 1 Peter 2, Acts 23: 12-22).
lessons.memoryVerse: Psalm 11: 5 The Lord tests the righteous, but his soul hates the wicked and the one who loves violence.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ṣíṣàfihàn àwọn ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo - 2
lessons.oriOro: Àwọn ohun tó ń ṣe okùnfà ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo (Ipa tí àṣà, àwùjọ àti àwọn òbí ń kó).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Lati ṣàyẹ̀wò ohun tí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo túmọ̀ sí nípa lílo Ìwé Mímọ́.<li>Láti ṣàláyé ipa tí áwùjọ, àṣà àti àwọn òbí ń kó nínú ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo bi Bíbélì ti wí.<li>Láti jíròrò lórí ipa òdì ti ìwà-ipá nípa mímú àpẹẹrẹ láti inú Bíbélì.<li>Láti yànnànà ipa ìjọ nínú dídẹ́kun àwọn okùnfà ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo
lessons.ifaara: Ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo jẹ́ ohun tí ó tàn káàkiri láti ọ̀dọ̀ ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lọ sí gbogbo ayé. Mímọ ohun tí ó jẹ́ ìpilẹ̀sẹ̀ rẹ̀ àti àwọn okùnfà rẹ̀ ṣe pàtàkì láti lè gbógun ti ohun tí 'n fẹ́ àmójútó yìí. Ìfáàrà yìí ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò bí àṣà, àwùjọ àti àwọn òbí ṣe lọ́wọ́ sí ìtànkálẹ̀ ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo nípa ṣíṣe àwàjinlẹ̀ bí ipa wọ̀nyí ti pọ̀ tó a le ní òye tí ó jinlẹ̀ nípa wíwo ìpèníjà yìí ní oríṣìíríṣìí ọ̀nà àti kí a ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun láti lè wá ọ̀nà àbáyọ tí yóò mú dọ́gbandọ́gba wà láàrin akọ àti abo àti dídènà ìwà-ipá láàrin àwújọ.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Bí Matiu 7:17-18 ti wí, ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ bí ìtakora ìtọ́ni àwọn òbí ṣe lè jẹ́ ìdẹkùn fún ọjọ́ iwájú àwọn ọmọ wọn. Báwo ni a ṣe le kápá èyí?<li>Báwo ni ìbárẹ́ ayé - bíi sinimá wíwò, lílo ẹ̀rọ ayélujára ní ọ̀nà àìtọ́ àti lílo oògùn olóró pẹ̀lú ìmutípara ṣe mú kí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo wọ́pọ̀ láàrin àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àti àwọn àgbà ní àwùjọ wa lónìí? Gen. 19: 32-35.<li>Ṣàwárí àwọn àṣà tí ó ṣàfihàn tàbí tí ó ń gbé ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo lárugẹ. Báwo ni ẹsẹ Bíbélì wọ̀nyí ṣe lè tọ́ wa nínú ọ̀nà tí a ó gbà láti dojúkọ wọ́n gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni?Matiu 15: 3-6; Col 3: 1-3, Col 2: 20; Efe. 5: 25-28.
lessons.ipari: Ní àkótán, a le so àwọn okùnfà ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo pọ̀ mọ́ àṣà, àwùjọ àti àwọn òbí. Àwọn àgbékalẹ̀ àṣà,Ise, agbékalẹ̀ àwùjọ àti bí òbí ṣe tọ́ ọmọ ní ipa pàtàkì lórí bí ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo ṣe ń wọ́pọ̀ ní àwùjọ wa. Ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run lè mú ìgbéga bá ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún, dọ́gba-n-dọ́gba àti ìfẹ́, láti jẹ́ ìpìlẹ̀ ìgbógunti ìwà-ipá ti akọ òun abo. Ó ṣe kókó fún ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan, ìletò, àti àwọn ilé ìsìn láti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìbẹnu-àtẹ́-lu ìwà-ipá kí a sì ṣe ìgbélárugẹ ìwà-rere tí ó bá onírúurú ìwé-mímọ́ mu, kí a lo ọ̀nà gbogbo láti dojúkọ kí a sì mú ìwà-ipa akọ òun abo wá sópin.
lessons.akosori: Micah 6: 8,"A ti fi hàn ọ́, ìwọ ènìyàn, ohun tí ó dára; àti ohun tí Olúwa bèèrè lọ́wọ́ rẹ, bí kò ṣe kí o ṣe òtítọ́, kí o sì fẹ́ àánú, àti kí o rìn ní ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run rẹ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Factors influencing Gender Based Violence [Cultural, Social & Parental factors]
lessons.aims: <li>To explore the concept of gender-based violence using scripture<li>To explain the contributing effects of social, cultural and parental factors to GBV within the biblical context<li>To discuss the negative impact of GBV drawing examples from the Bible<li>To discuss the biblical recommendations of recovering from GBV<li>To highlight the role of the church in mitigating the factors causing GBV
lessons.introduction: Gender-based violence is a pervasive issue that transcends geographical boundaries and affects individuals across the globe. Understanding its root causes and contributing factors is essential in combating this pressing concern. This introduction explores how cultural, societal, and parental factors collectively influence and perpetuate gender-based violence. By delving into the intricacies of these influences, we can develop a more comprehensive understanding of the multifaceted nature of this problem and work towards effective solutions that promote gender equality and violence prevention in the society.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li>In the light of Matt.7: 17-18, analyse how conflicting parenting can be a threat to the future existence of their children. How can this be controlled?<li>How have social interactions - <li>e. watching films, surf internet and substance abuse including drunkenness contributes to GBV among the youth and elderly in our societies today? Gen.19: 32-35<li>Identify some cultural norms you know that reflect or promote GBV? How can the Bible's message guide our approach to them as Christians? Matt.15: 3-6; Col.3: 1-3; Col 2: 20, Ephesians 5: 25-28
lessons.conclusion: In conclusion, gender-based violence is intricately linked to cultural, societal, and parental factors. Cultural norms, traditions, societal power structures, and parental upbringing constitute a strong influence on the GBV prevalence. Religious perspectives can guide the promotion of respect, equality, and love, forming the foundation to combat gender-based violence. It is crucial for individuals, communities, and religious institutions to actively create an environment condemning violence and promoting values aligned with various scriptures, employing a comprehensive approach to address and eliminate gender-based violence.
lessons.memoryVerse: Micah 6: 8 He has shown you, O man, what is good; And what does the LORD require of you But to do justly, To love mercy, And to walk humbly with your God?

lessons.akoko: ỌJỌ́ ÌSINMI KẸRIN NÍ LẸ́NTI: ỌJỌ́ ÌSÌNMI ÀWỌN ÌYÁ.
lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ipa lórí ayé ọmọ (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> Láti ṣe atótónu lórí pàtàkì àwọn ìyá àti díẹ̀ lára àwọn ojúṣe wọn láti gbé àwọn ọmọ oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run dìde.
lessons.ifaara: Ìyá túmọ̀ sí òbí tí ó jẹ́ obìnrin; obìnrin tí ó bí ọmọ. Nítorí náà, ìyá oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run ni ìyá tí ó tọ́ àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ ní ọ̀nà Ọlọ́run. Nínú ibi-kíkà wa lónìí, a kà nípa bí Lóídè ṣe ní ipa lórí Eunike ọmọbìnrin rẹ̀, tí í ṣe ìyá Timotiu pẹ̀lú ìgbágbọ́ ńlá nínú Kristi àti bí Eunike ṣe kọ́ Timotiu ọmọkùnrin rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú irú ìgbàgbọ́ nlá kan náà nínú Kristi Timotiu gba ìgbàgbọ́ ó sì di Kristẹni (Ise 16: 1-3; 1Tim.1: 2). Ó di Ajíhìnrere (1Tim.4: 14) ó sì wà pẹ̀lú Pọ́ọ̀lù nínú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìrìnájò iṣẹ́ ìránṣẹ́ rẹ̀ (Ise 17: 14-15; Ise 20: 4; 1Tesa.1: 1; 2 Tesa.1: 1). A rán Ajíhìnrere mìíràn pẹ̀lú rẹ̀ lọ sí ẹkùn Makedonia (Ise 19: 22). Ó jẹ́ ọmọ rere nínú ìgbàgbọ́ fún Pọ́ọ̀lù nínú ìdè rẹ̀ (2 Tim. 4: 13) ó sì ṣe é ṣe kí a de òun náà pẹ̀lú rẹ̀ ní àkókò kan nínú ìgbé ayé rẹ̀ nítorí ìhìnrere (Fil. 1: 1; Heb.13: 23). Àṣeyọrí ńlá-ǹlà tí Timotiu ṣe nínu iṣẹ́ ìhìnrere dúró lórí ipa tí ìgbàgbọ́ ìyá rẹ̀ àti ìyá rẹ̀ àgbà ní lórí ayé rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Fún ìyá àti àwọn iṣẹ́ tí ìyá ń ṣe nínú ayé ọmọ rẹ̀ nígbà tí ó wà ní ọmọ-ọwọ́ ní oríkì.<li>Báwo ni o ṣe le ṣàpèjúwe irú ènìyàn tí Loide àti Eunike jẹ́ nínú ibi-kíkà wa lónìí?<li>Ṣe àṣàrò lóríOwe 14: 1 àti Owe 31: 10-25 kí o sì jíròrò lórí bí àwọn ìyá ṣe lè ní ipa lórí àwọn ọmọ wọn pẹ̀lú ìwà rere.<li>Láti inú ìfáàrà ti ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí, tọ́kasí àwọn ìwá rere inú ayé Timotiu èyí tí í ṣe àbáyọrí ipa ẹ̀mí tí ìyá rẹ̀ áti ìyá rẹ̀ àgbà kó lórí ayé rẹ̀.
lessons.ipari: Bí a ti ń ṣe àjọyọ̀ àwọn ìyá wa lónìí, ó ṣe pàtàkì láti rán wọn létí bí wọn ti ṣe pàtàkì tó àti ojúṣe wọn nípa ti ara àti ẹ̀mí lórí àwọn ọmọ wọn láti lè mú wọn tọ ipa ọ̀nà Ìjọba Ọlọ́run. Kí Ọlọ́run bùkún àwọn ìyá wa pẹ̀lú ìwà rere tí wọn yóò máa fi kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn ní orúkọ Jesu. Nípa oore-ọ̀fẹ́ Ọlọ́run, a ó tún pádé ní ọjọ́ kẹẹ̀ẹ́dógún oṣù kẹfà ọdún 2025 láti jíròrò lórí apá kejì ẹ̀kọ́ yìí tí í ṣe Ipa òbí lórí ọmọ (2): Bàbá oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ọmọ rere a máa fi ìwà rere ìyá rẹ̀ hàn.
lessons.akosori: Owe 14: 1,"Olúkúlùkù ọlọgbọ́n obìnrin a máa kọ́ ilé rẹ̀; ṣùgbọ́n aṣiwèrè a fi ọwọ́ ara rẹ̀ fà á lulẹ̀"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.aims: to expound the importance of mothers and some of their duties in raising a godly child.
lessons.introduction: A mother is simply defined as a female parent; a woman who gave birth to a child. A godly mother is therefore a woman who nurtures her children in the ways of God. In our Text today, we read about how Lois impacted her daughter Eunice, the mother of Timothy with a great faith in Christ and Eunice also impacted Timothy her son with the same great faith in Christ. Timothy received the Faith and was converted to Christianity. (Acts 16: 1-3; 1 Tim. 1: 2) He became an Evangelist of the gospel (1 Tim 4: 14) and accompanied Paul in most of his missionary journeys. (Acts 17: Acts 17:14, Acts 17:15, Acts 20:4; 1Thess 1: 1; 2 Thess 1: 1). He was commissioned with another evangelist to the region of Macedonia (Acts 19: 22). He was a very good godson to Paul in Prison (2 Tim 4: 13) and possibly suffered imprisonment with him at a time of his life for the sake of the gospel (Phil 1: 1; Heb. 13: 23). These evangelical feats by Timothy were based on the impact of his mother and grandmother's faith on him.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define a mother and some natural works a mother does in her child's life at infant.<li> How can you describe the personalities of Lois and Eunice in our Text today?<li> Diligently study Prov 14: 1 and Prov 31: 10-25 and discuss how mothers can impact their children with virtuous manners. <li> From the introduction of our study today, identify the virtues of Timothy which were as a result of his mother and grandmother's spiritual impact on him.
lessons.conclusion: As we celebrate our mothers today, it is very important to remind them of their importance as well as their physical and spiritual impacts on their children in other to nurture them towards the path of God's kingdom. May God bless our mother with more virtues to impact their children in Jesus' name. By God's grace we shall meet again on June 15, 2025 to discuss the Part 2 of this study which is Parental Impact on a child (2): The godly father.
lessons.foodForThougth: A good child reflects his mother's virtues.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov 14: 1 “Every wise woman buildeth her house; But the foolish plucketh it down with her own hands”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí Ọmọdé jẹ́ àti Ìhùwàsí Ọmọdé (3).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> Láti jíròrò lórí bí àpẹẹrẹ fífẹ́ láti mọ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ṣe le ràn wá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìmọ̀ Kristi àti Ìjọba Rẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: :Mo ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi, ọmọkùnrin rẹ̀ kékeré sì pàdé mi ní ẹnu ọ̀nà. Láàrin ìṣẹ́jú kan, ó ti béèrè orúkọ mí, ilé mi, ọkọ̀ mi, irú ọkọ̀ tí mò ń lò, abbl. àfi ìgbà tí bàbá rẹ̀ tó pa á lẹ́nu ma tí ó sì lé e wọ inú iyàrá rẹ̀ lọ. Àwọn ọmọdé máa ń fẹ́ láti mọ̀! Fífẹ́ láti ní ìmọ̀ túmọ̀ sí ìfẹ́-inú láti mọ̀, láti rí, láti fọwọ́kàn àti láti ní ìmọ̀lára nǹkan. Gbogbo ọmọdé ni ó ní ìwà yìí fún ìdàgbàsókè wọn. Àwọn ọmọdé tí ó bá fẹ́ láti ní ìmọ̀ kì í béèrè ìbéèrè nìkan ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n tún máa ń fẹ́ ìdáhùn. Láti inú ibi kíkà wa, Isaaki béèrè àgbò tí wọn yóò fi ṣe ìrúbọ lọ́wọ́ bàbá rẹ̀. Orí-ọ̀rọ̀ wa lónìí yóò tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí bí àpẹẹrẹ fífẹ́ láti mọ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ṣe lè ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti ní ìmọ̀ Kristi àti ìjọba Rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Túmọ̀ fífẹ́ láti mọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú ìfáàrà wa kí o sì sọ ìrírí kan.<li>Ṣe àfiwé Gen.22: 7-8 pẹ̀lú ọ̀nà tàbí àwọn ọ̀nà tí àwọn òbí kan kì í ṣe kọbiara sí bí àwọn ọmọ wọn ṣe máa ń fẹ́ láti wádìí nǹkan.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà ní Johanu 3: 1-16, jíròrò lórí bí Nikodemu ṣe fẹ́ láti mọ̀ nípa ọ̀nà sí ìjọba Ọlọ́run.<li>Ṣe àwàjinlẹ̀ lórí àpẹẹrẹ bí ọmọdé ti ń fẹ́ láti mọ̀ nípa nǹkan ṣe lè ràn wá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìmọ̀ Kristi àti Ìjọba Rẹ̀. Ps42: 1-2; Fil.3: 9-10.
lessons.ipari: Àwọn ọmọdé máa ń béèrè ìbéèrè láì bẹ̀rù. Bákan náà gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni; fífẹ́ láti mọ ohun kan kì í ṣe ìdẹkùn tí ó léwu; ó jẹ́ oore-ọ̀fẹ́ tí Ọlọ́run fún ni láti ní ìmọ̀. A ní láti máa béèrè nípa bí a ṣe le mọ̀ nípa Ọlọ́run àti nípa ọ̀ná Rẹ̀ síi kí a lè tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìmọ̀ Kristi
lessons.funIronu: Fífẹ́ láti mọ nípa ohun tíí ṣe ti Kristi ni ìpilẹ̀sẹ ìmọ̀ síi
lessons.akosori: Fil. 3: 10,"Kí èmi kí ó lè mọ Kristi àti agbára àjínde rẹ̀, àti alábàápín nínú ìyà rẹ̀, nígbà tí mo bá faramọ́ ikú rẹ̀.
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Personality and character traits of a child (3)
lessons.aims: to discuss how children's examples of curiosity can help us in the knowledge of Christ and His kingdom
lessons.introduction: I visited one of my friends and was met at the door by his little son. Within a minute, he had asked me my name, my house, my motor, the type of my motor etc until his father stopped him and sent him into his room. Children are always curious! Curiosity means the desire to know, to see, to touch and to feel. Every little child has this virtue for their development. Curious children not only ask questions, but they seek the answers. From our text, Isaac asked his father about the ram to be used for sacrifice. Today's topic will touch-light how children's example of curiosity can help us in the knowledge of Christ and His kingdom.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define curiosity in the context of our introduction and narrate an experience.<li> Compare Genesis 22: 7-8 with the way or ways some parents negatively respond to their child's curiosity.<li> According to John 3: 1-16 discuss the curiosity of Nicodemus in knowing the way to the kingdom of God.<li> Critically examine how children's example of curiosity can help us in the knowledge of Christ and His kingdom? Psa 42: 1-2; Phil 3: 9-10.
lessons.conclusion: Children ask questions innocently without prejudice. Also, as Christians, curiosity is not a dangerous trap; it is what God's grace for knowledge.  We must be curious to innocently know more of God and His way so as to continue in the knowledge of Christ.
lessons.foodForThougth: Seeking to know more of Christ is the foundation of more knowledge.
lessons.memoryVerse: Philippians 3: 10 “I want to know Christ and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of sharing in his sufferings, becoming like him in his death”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ ìhà tí àwọn ọmọdé kọ sí Jesu nínú Tẹmpili,<li>láti ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ bí a ṣe ń pa àwọn ọmọdé lẹ́nu mọ́ àti<li>láti ṣe ìdámọ̀ àwọn ọ̀nà tí a lè gbà ṣe ìwúrí fún ẹ̀bùn àwọn ọmọdé àti ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe nínú Ìjọ wa.
lessons.ifaara: Hosanna túmọ̀ sí a bẹ̀ ọ́; gbà wá là. Ọ̀rọ̀ Heberu n<li> Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìwà tàbíIsesí ọmọde ni pé wọ́n máa ń fi tọkàntọkàn ṣe nǹkan. Ó jẹ́ ìwà òtítọ́ nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé. Wọn kì í fi dúdú pe funfun. Nínú ibi tí a kà nínú Bíbélì, a rí àwọn ọmọdé tí wọ́n ń kígbe hosanna sí Jesu Kristi bí ó ṣe ń wọ inú Tẹmpil<li> Èyí túmọ̀ sí pé láì kọ́ àwọn ọmọdé náà àti nípá ìfẹ́ inú wọn, wọ́n rí Jesu Kristi gẹ́gẹ́ bí Mesiah (Olùgbàlà) ẹni tí ó wá láti inú ẹ̀yà Júdà (Isa.11:1,10). Àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí kò tí ì mọ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ẹlẹ́yamẹ̀yà, àgàbàgebè, ìlara àti ìrunú, nítorí náà, wọ́n rí Jesu gẹ́gẹ́ bí Mesiah pẹ̀lú ọkàn òtítọ́.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni "Hosanna"ti yé ọ sí àti gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà ní Luke 3: 15-16, ìdí wo ni àwọn ọmọdé fi ń ké Hosanna?<li>Jíròrò lórí Ps.8: 2 ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lóníí kí o sì dárúkọ àwọn iṣẹ́ ìyanu tí Ọlọ́run tipasẹ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ṣe pàápàá láti inú oyún títí dé ìgbà ọ̀dọ́.<li>Ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ ìhùwàsí àwọn Farisi sí àwọn ọmọdé nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí kí o sì dárúkọ onírúurú ọ̀nà tí àwọn àgbà nínú ìjọ wa ń gbà láti pa àwọn ọmọdé lẹ́nu mọ́.<li>Ṣàwárí àwọn ẹ̀bùn àti ìmọ̀-ọ́n-ṣe àwọn ọmọdé kí o sì jíròrò lórí bí a ṣe lè máa ṣe ìwúrí fún wọn nínú àwọn Ìjọ wa.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe nira láti pa àwọn ọmọdé lẹ́nu mọ́ ní ìgbà ayé Jesu, gẹ́gẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni yóò jẹ́ ohun tí ó nira púpọ̀, tí kò sì lè ṣe é ṣe láti pa ìmọ̀-ọ́n-ṣe, ẹ̀bùn àti àwọn ìwàbíỌlọ́run nínú ọmọdé kankan lẹ́nu mọ́ nínú àwọn Ìjọ wa. A bí wọn láti gbòòrò àtí láti tayọ ni
lessons.funIronu: Àwọn ọmọdé òní ni olóye ọ̀la; ẹ gbà wọ́n mọ́ra
lessons.akosori: Ps.8: 2 "Láti ẹnu àwọn ẹnu àwọn ọmọ-ọmu ni ìwọ ti ṣe ìlànà agbára, nítorí àwọn ọ̀tá rẹ, nítorí kí ìwọ kí ó lè mú ọ̀tá olùgbẹ̀san nì dákẹ́ jẹ́ẹ́"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to expound the attitude of children to Jesus in the Temple, <li>to analyse how children are silenced and <li>to identify methods of encouraging children's talents and potentials in our congregations.
lessons.introduction: Hosanna simply means we beg thee; save us. It is a Hebrew word. One of the virtues or personality traits in children is conscientiousness. It is truthful virtue in children. Their white is white and black is black. In our Bible text, we see the children crying hosanna to Jesus Christ as he entered the temple. This means that the Children naturally and by reflex, acknowledged Jesus Christ as the Messiah (Saviour) who is from the tribe of Judah. (Isa 11: 1, Isa 11:10). These children had not yet known the sins of bigotry, hypocrisy, envy and indignation; therefore, they approached Jesus Christ as the Messiah with all sincerity.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by “Hosanna” and according to Luk 3: 15-16, why were the children shouting Hosanna?<li> Discuss Psalm 8 verse 2 in relation to our study today and mention some wonders of God through children especially from conception till adolescent.<li> Analyse the attitude of the Pharisees towards the children in our text and mention various ways by which some adults in our Churches do silence the potentials of Children.<li> Identify some talents and potentials in children and discuss how to encourage them in our congregation.
lessons.conclusion: As it was difficult to silence the children of Jesus' days, so it would be very difficult and even impossible to silence the potentials, talents and godly virtues in any child of God in our Churches. They are born to thrive and excel.
lessons.foodForThougth: Today's children are genius tomorrow; embrace them.
lessons.memoryVerse: Psalm 8: 2 “Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou might still the enemy and the avenger”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àjínde ti Ẹ̀mí.
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàlàyé ikú ti ẹ̀mí, àwọn ohun tí ó ń fà á, àti<li>láti yànnàná àjíǹde ti Ẹ̀mí àti bí ó ṣe wà nínú ìsìn Kristẹni
lessons.ifaara: Ikú ti Ẹ̀mí ni pé kí ẹ̀rí-ọkàn ènìyàn kú pátápátá sí ohun tí í ṣe ẹ̀ṣẹ̀. Ẹni náà wà láàyè, ṣùgbọ́n ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ti kú pátápátá kò sì jí sí àwọn ohun tí í ṣe rere. Ọmọkùnrin àbúrò tí a ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa rẹ̀ lónìí ti di òkú pátápátá. Ó sọ ẹ̀rí-ọkàn rẹ̀ nù fún ohun tí kò wúlò, ìnákúùnàá, ó sì sọ ara rẹ̀ di ọmọ àlè. Ọjọ́ tí ó di òkú sí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ni ọjọ́ tí ó mọ̀ àṣIse rẹ̀ tí ó sí ṣe ìpinnu láti jáde kúrò nínú ikú rẹ̀ ti ẹ̀mí, nítórí náà, ó jíǹde nípa ti ẹ̀mí ó sì padà lọ láti gba ohun ìní rẹ̀ tí ó ti pàdánù (Luke 15: 17-19). Kristẹni ha lè kú tàbí jíǹde nípa ti ẹ̀mí bí? Àwọn ibere wa yóò tẹ̀síwájú láti bà wa tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí i
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé ikú ti ẹ̀mí àti àjínde ti ẹ̀mí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú ìfáàrà wa lónìí.<li>Báwo ni ènìyàn ṣe lè kú kí ó sì jínde nípa ti ẹ̀mí? Gen. 41: 9,Gen 42: 21-22; Luke 22: 56-62; Romu 6:11.<li>Ǹjẹ́ ó ṣe é ṣe fún ẹni tí ó ti kú nípa ti ẹ̀mí kí ó má lè jínde nípa ti ẹ̀mí mọ́ láéláé? Ṣàlàyé èyí láti inúMatiu 27: 3-5<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú Luke 15: 25-30, kín ni ìhùwàsí àwọn "Kristẹni"kan sí àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ tí ó ronúpìwàdà tí wọ́n sì gba ìgbé ayé Kristẹni? Báwo ni ó ṣe dára jù láti hùwà sí àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ tí a dáríjì nínú Ìjọ wa?Ise 9: 26-28.
lessons.ipari: Bí a ti ń ṣe àjọyọ̀ Àjíǹde lónìí ní ìrántí ikú àti àjíǹde Jesu Kristi Olúwa wa fún ìràpadà wa, a ní láti gbé ìfẹ́ Kristi wọ̀ láti wá àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ tí ó ṣìnà kí a wàásù Kristi sí wọn kí a kí wọn káàbọ̀ kí a sì gbà àwọn tí ó jẹ́wọ́ tí wọ́n sì kọ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wọn sílẹ̀ sínú Ìjọ wa.
lessons.funIronu: Láti wà láàyè nínú Kristi ni làti kú sí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀.
lessons.akosori: Luke 15: 32,"Ó yẹ kí a ṣe àríyá kí a sì yọ̀: nítorí àbúrò rẹ yìí ti kú, ó sì tún yè; ó ti nù, a sì rí i"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to expound spiritual death, causes and <li>to analyse spiritual resurrection and the context in Christendom.
lessons.introduction: Spiritual death is when one's conscience to sinfulness is totally dead. The person is alive, but his or her conscience is totally dead and inactive to good things. The younger child in our text today was totally dead. He lost his conscience to frivolity, extravagancy and became a vagabond. The day he died to sin was the day he realized his mistakes and took a decision to come out of his spiritual death thereby resurrecting spiritually and went back to take his lost possession (Luk 15: 17-19). Can Christians die or resurrect spiritually? Our study Guides will torchlight to us more.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain spiritual death and spiritual resurrection in the context of today's introduction.<li> How can somebody die and resurrect spiritually? Gen 41: 9; Gen 42: 21-22; Luk 22: 56-62; Rom 6:11. <li> Is it possible for someone who died spiritually never to resurrect spiritually? Expound from Matt 27: 3-5.<li> In the context of Luk 15: 25-30, what are the attitudes of some “Christians” to sinners who repented and accepted Christian livelihood? How best should we react to forgiven sinners among our congregation? Acts 9: 26-28.
lessons.conclusion: As we celebrate Easter today in commemoration of the death and resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ for our redemption, we should put on Christ's love to look for erring sinners and preach Christ to them as well as welcome and receive those who confessed and repented of their sins into our congregations.
lessons.foodForThougth: To live in Christ is to die to sin
lessons.memoryVerse: Luk 15: 32 “It was meet that we should make merry and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ẹni tí Ọmọdé jẹ́ àti Ìhùwàsí Ọmọdé (4)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>Láti ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ ìwà ìmọ́gbọ́n wá nínú ayé ọmọdé.<li>Láti jíròrò lórí ìṣpàtàkì rẹ̀ sí ìmọ̀ Kristẹni wa nípa Ìjọba náà.
lessons.ifaara: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwé atúmọ̀ èdè Merriam Webster, ìmọ́gbọ́n-wá jẹ́ ìlànà rírónú ní ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́, tí a ń lò láti ní àṣeyọrí tí ó dára. ìmọ́gbọ́n-wá jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àbùdá Ọlọ́run. À ń sin Ọlọ́run tí ó ń mú wa lọ́kàn le láti máa ronú jinlẹ̀ (Isa. 1: 18). Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìwà ọmọdé ni pé wọ́n máa ń fẹ́ mọ ìdí nǹkan: kín ni ìdí èyí? Kín ni tọ̀hún? Èyí jẹ́ àròjinlẹ̀. Láti inú ibi-kíkà wa, Jesu ń bá àwọn olùkọ́ òfin fọ̀rọ̀wérọ̀ Ó sì ń béèrè ìbéèrè lọ́wọ́ wọn (Luke 2: 41-52). Láti ṣègbè lẹ́yìn ìgbàgbọ́, Kristẹni ní láti máa ṣe àmúlò òtítọ́, àrídájú àti ríronú bí ó ti tọ́ pẹ̀lú ọkàn àdúrà. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò tẹ̀síwájú láti là ojú wá sí èyí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ní òye tìrẹ, ṣàlàyé ohun tí àròjinlẹ̀ jẹ́ kí o sì tọ́ka sí àpẹẹrẹ kan nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé pẹ̀lú ìrírí rẹ.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà ní Luke 2: 46-47 àti Isa.1: 18, báwo ni àròjinlẹ̀ ṣe le ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti jèrè ọkàn fún Kristi?<li>Báwo ni ẹ̀mí àròjinlẹ̀ nínú ayé ọmọdé ṣe lè jẹ́ ìpèníjà fún ìrònú oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run nípa ìrònúpìwàdà àti ìbálàjà? Mark 11: 29-33; Ise 2: 37-38; Ise 16: 30-31.<li>Kín ni àwọn ewu tí ó wà nínú kí ènìyàn má ní àròjinlẹ̀ ní ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́? 2 Tim. 4: 3-4; Titu 3: 9
lessons.ipari: Ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì wa lónìí ni a rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìpèníjà láti máa ní àròjinlẹ̀ tí ó tọ́ nípa ìrònúpìwàdà àti ìbálàjà pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run. Ṣíṣe àròjinlẹ̀ lọ́nà tí ó tọ́ ni láti ṣe àmúkúrò àwọn ohun tí ó lè dènà ènìyàn láti gba Jesu ní Olùgbàlà. Àmọ́ ṣá, a ní láti mọ̀ pé a kò le fi àròjinlẹ̀ dípò ìmísí tí a gbà láti ọwọ́ Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ tàbí òtítọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tí ó yè kooro.
lessons.funIronu: Níní àròjinlẹ̀ dárá, ṣùgbọ́n kí a ní ìmísí Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ ni ó dára jù.
lessons.akosori: Isa.1: 18,"Olúwa wí pé, wá nísisìnyí, kí ẹ sì jẹ́ kí a sọ àsọyé pọ̀: bí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ yín bá rí bí òdòdó, wọn ó sì fún bí òjò-dídì; bí wọ́n bá pọ́n bí àlààrì, wọn ó dàbí irun-àgùtàn"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Personality and character traits of a child (4)
lessons.aims: <li>to analyse traits of logic in children and <li>to discuss the relevance to our Christian knowledge of the kingdom.
lessons.introduction: According to Merriam-Webster dictionary, logic is the principle of proper thinking, used to arrive at a better conclusion. Logic is an attribute of God. We serve the God who encourages us to be rational (Isa 1: 18). One of the characters in a child is the ability to ask for reasons: why this?, why that?. This is logic. From our text, Jesus engaged in discussion with the teachers of the law and asking them questions (Luke 2: 41-52). To defend the faith, Christians must use truth, facts and reason appropriately and prayerfully. Our study guide will open our eyes to more of this.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> In your own understanding, explain logic and illustrate an example in children with life experience.<li> According to Luke 2: 46-47 and Isa 1: 18, how can logic be of help to us in wining souls for Christ?<li> How can the logical traits in children be a challenge to godly reasoning concerning repentance and reconciliation? Mark 11: 29-33; Acts 2: 37-38; Acts 16: 30-31.<li> What are the dangers of not using logic in a proper way?  2Tim 4: 3-4; Titus 3:9.
lessons.conclusion: The study today serves as a challenge to godly reasoning concerning repentance and reconciliation to God. The proper use of logic is to remove intellectual barriers that hinder a person from accepting Jesus as saviour.  However, we must know that logic cannot replace the inspiration gained through the prompting of the Holy Spirit, nor the clear truth of God's word.
lessons.foodForThougth: Logic is good, but to be inspired by the Holy Spirit is better..
lessons.memoryVerse: Isa 1: 18 "Come now, and let us reason together,"Says the LORD,"Though your sins are like scarlet, They shall be as white as snow; Though they are red like crimson, They shall be as wool".

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà àìtọ́ tí ó lòdì tí a lè rí nínú ayé ọmọdé (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti pe àkíyèsí wa sí ìwà ìfinràn tí ó gbilẹ̀ ní àwùjọ wa àti<li>láti ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ohun Bíbélì ń kọ́ wa lòdì sí ìfínràn.
lessons.ifaara: Ìfinràn ni a lè ṣàpèjúwe gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìkẹ́gàn, sísọ ọ̀rọ̀ àlùfàǹsá, ìdáyàfò, lílo ìwà-ipá àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú íbáṣepọ̀ wa pẹ̀lú ẹlòmíràn. Ó máa ń wáyé gẹ́gẹ́ bí èébú, ìwà ìbínú, ìfipàjẹgàba tàbí ìdáyàfon<li> Ó jẹ́ ìwà àbùkù. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Iṣmaẹli ń fi Sara àti ọmọ rẹ̀ nìràn nípa fífi wọ́n ṣẹlẹ́yà níbi ayẹyẹ gbígba ọmú lẹ́nu ọmọ tí a ṣe fún Isaak<li> Ìfinràn jẹ́ àmí pé ènìyàn kò gbọ́n, bákan náà ni ó lè dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwà àìlẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé láàrin àwọn ọmọdé. Àwọn ibere wa yóò tẹ̀síwájú nípa ṣíṣe àlàyé rẹ̀ lẹ́kùn-ún-rẹ́rẹ́.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé ohun tí ìfinràn jẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ṣe lò ó nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí. Ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe ń jẹyọ nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé.<li>Kín ni àwọn ohun tí Bíbélì kọ́ wa lòdì sí ìfinran? Romu 12: 18-19; 1Ko 13: 4-5; Efe.4:29.<li>Kín ni àwọn ipa tí ìfinràn ní lórí ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì wa lónìí àti nínú ìgbé ayé àwọn ọmọ Kristẹni? Gen.21: 10-12;Matiu 12: 36-37; Mark 13:13.<li>Báwo ni àwa Kristẹni ṣe le kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti má ṣe máa fínràn? Lef. 19: 18; Matiu 5: 12; Matt 5:44.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni, a ní láti kọ̀ láti máa fínràn nípa fífini ṣe ẹlẹ́yà, pípe ni ní orúkọ tí kò tọ́, dídàyà foni, fífi ọ̀rọ̀ kẹ́lẹ́ ba ni jẹ́, dídójútini àti sísọ ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀yìn. Bákan náà ni a gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti jìnnà sí èyí nítorí pé gbogbo èníyàn ni a dá ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ẹnikẹ́ni tí ó bá fi ọmọnìkejì rẹ̀ ṣe ẹlẹ́yà, ó fi àwòràn Ọlọ́run ṣẹ́lẹ́yà.
lessons.akosori: Gen. 21: 9,"Sara sì rí ọmọ Hagari, ará Egypti, tí ó bí fún Abrahamu, ó ń fí í rẹ́rìn-ín."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative Behaviours in Children (1)
lessons.aims: <li>to bring to our consciousness the existence of bullying in our society and <li>to reaffirm biblical teachings against bullying
lessons.introduction: Bullying is described as mocking, hurtful teasing, threat, coercion and the likes while relating with one another. It comes in form of abuse, aggression, forceful dominance or intimidation. It is a social demean. In our passage today, Ishmael bullied Sarah and his son Isaac by mocking at them at the entertainment made at Isaac's weaning; Bullying is a bad act, it is a sign of immaturity, and it could also be as a result of lack of proper home training among children. Our study guides shall expatiate more on this topic.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain bullying in the context of our study today. Analyse in Children Concept.<li> What are the Biblical teachings against bullying? Rom 12: 18-19; 1Cor 13: 4-5; Eph. 4:29.<li> What are the effects of bullying in our Bible Text today and in our Christian children's livelihood? Gen 21: 10-12; Matt 12: 36-37; Mark 13:13. <li> How should Christians teach their children to react to bullying? Lev 19: 18; Matt 5: 11-12; Matt 5:44.
lessons.conclusion: As Christians, we must be very wary of bullying through teasing, name-calling, threat, backstabbing, embarrassment and gossip. We should also teach our Children against it because all humans are created in the image of God.
lessons.foodForThougth: Whoever mocks a fellow person, mocks an image of God.
lessons.memoryVerse: Matt 21: 9 “And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, which she had born unto Abraham, mocking”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà àìtọ́ tí a lè rí nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé (2)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti sọ nípa ohun tí irọ́ pípa túmọ̀ sí<li>láti ṣàfihàn irọ́ pípa nínú ayé wa àti láti kọ́ wa láti yẹra fún irọ́ pípa àti èké ṣíṣe nínú ìgbé ayé ojoojúmọ́ wa, àti<li>láti ní òye nípa àtubọ̀tán irọ́ pípa nínú Ìwé Mímọ́.
lessons.ifaara: Ìrọ́ pípa túmọ̀ sí sísọ ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀tàn tàbí ṣíṣe lòdì sí òtítọ́. Ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú ìwà tí Ọlọ́run kórííra (Owe 6:16, Owe 6:19). Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Anania àti Safira purọ́ wọ́n sì dẹ́ṣẹ̀ sí Ọlọ́run èyí tí ó mú kí wọ́n parí ayé wọn ní àìròtẹ́lẹ̀. Irọ́ pípa ti wá di ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tí ó wọ́pọ̀ láàrin àwọn Kristẹni lónìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ kò ṣe ka irọ́ pípa sí ohun tí ó léwu. Ọlọ́run kórìíra irọ́ pípa Ó sì fẹ́ràn òtítọ́.  Ààyè kò gbọ́dọ̀ sí fún irọ́ pípa ní àyíká àwọn ènìyàn Ọlọ́run ṣùgbọ́n kí ó jẹ́ ibi tí ó kún fún àti tí wọ́n sì ti ń fi àpẹẹrẹ òtítọ́ hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jesu Olùgbàlà wa ti jẹ́ Ọ̀nà, Òtítọ́ àti Ìyè.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé bí irọ́ pípa ti yé ọ sí kí o sì ṣe àpẹẹrẹ àwọn irọ́ tí ó wọ́pọ̀ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé.<li>Láti inú àwọn ibi-kíkà wọ̀nyí, jíròrò lóri ohun tí Bíbélì fi yé wa nípa irọ́ pípa: Lef. 19: 11; Ps 101: 7;Owe 6: 16-17; Owe 19: 9;Owe 22:15.<li>Jíròrò lórí ipá tí irọ́ ní lórí ìgbé ayé Kristẹni àti àwọn ọmọdé ní ìran wa yìí. Gen.18: 15; Gen 27: 6-19; Gen 37: 31-32.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà nínú Ise. 5: 4, 11, báwó ni ohun tí ẹ̀kọ́ wa ti òní ń fi yé wa ṣe lè mú kí iṣẹ́ ìhìnrere Kristi tẹ̀síwájú ní àwùjọ wa àti láàrin àwọn ọmọdé?Matiu 5: 16, Matiu 6: 33; Mark 1: 15; Romu 14:17.
lessons.ipari: Ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ irọ́ pípa lòdì sí ìwà Ọlọ́run. Ọlọ́run kò le ṣèké (Titu 1: 3, Heb.6: 18); irọ́ pípa tako ìṣẹ̀dá Rẹ̀. Irọ́ pípa jẹ́ ohun tí ó léwu tí ó sì yẹ kí a yẹra fún nítorí ọ̀run àpáàdì ni èrè rẹ̀ (Ifi 21: 8).
lessons.funIronu: Lóòotọ́ irọ́ pípa lè dùn ṣùgbọ́n ìkorò ni ìgbẹyìn rẹ̀.
lessons.akosori: Owe 12: 22,"Ìríra lójú Olúwa ni ahọ́n èké; ṣùgbọ́n àwọn tí n ṣe rere ni dídùn-inú rẹ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative behaviours in Children (2)
lessons.aims: <li>to expound the concept of lying, <li>to expose the lying potentials in us and teach us to avoid lying and lies in our daily living<li> to understand the implications of lying in the scripture
lessons.introduction: Lying means deception in speech or a deliberate act of deviating from the truth. It is one of the seven abominations to God (Prov. 6: 16,19). In today's text, Ananias and Sapphira lied; and thereby sinned against God which ended their lives abruptly.  Lying has become a common sin among Christians today as many do not take telling lies as anything serious. God hates lies and loves the truth. The community of God's people should be a place devoid of lies but rather one that fully embrace and exemplify the truth as Jesus our Saviour is the Way, the Truth, and the Life.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain how you understand lying and give examples of lies that children easily tell.<li> From the following passages, discuss the biblical stand on lying: Lev. 19: 11; Ps. 101: 7; Prov. 6: 16-17; Prov. 19: 9; Rev. 22:15.<li> Discuss the potentials of lying in Christian and children's livelihood in our present age. Gen. 18: 15; Gen. 27: 6-19; Gen. 37: 31-32.<li> In the context of Acts 5: 4,11, how can the understanding of today's study further the course of the Gospel of Christ in our society and among the children? Matt. 5: 16; Matt 6: 33; Mark 1: 15; Rom. 14: 17;.
lessons.conclusion: The sin of lying contradicts the very character of God. God cannot lie, (Tit. 1: 3; Heb. 6: 18); it is against His very nature to advance falsehood. Lying is a serious matter and to be abhorred because the reward is eternity in hell (Rev. 21: 8).
lessons.foodForThougth: Though lying can be sweet but the end is always bitter
lessons.memoryVerse: Proverbs 12: 22 “Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD, But those who deal truthfully are His delight”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà àìtọ́ tí a lè rí nínú ayé ọmọdé (3).
