lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàfihàn ìrẹ́nijẹ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé,<li>láti ní òye ipa tí ìrẹ́nijẹ ní lórí ayé àwa Kristẹni, àti<li>láti jíròrò bí ìrẹ́nijẹ ṣe lè ní ipa lórí iṣẹ́ Ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ifaara: Ìrẹ́nijẹ ni fífi èkè àti àwọn ọ̀nà ̣ẹ̀tàn mìíràn rí àwọn ohun tí a fẹ́. Rebeka nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, kọ́ Jakọbu bí yóò ṣe rẹ́ arákùnrin rẹ̀ jẹ débí pé ó fi ara rẹ̀ gégùn-ún, gbígbà tí Jakọbu gbà sí i lẹ́nu ni ó fa ìṣọ̀tá láàrin òun àti arákùnrin rẹ̀. Ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ni ó ń tan ni jẹ lónìí nítorí àti rí nǹkan tí wọ́n ń wá, wọ́n gbàgbé pé a kò le yí ìlànà Ọlọ́run padà (Lef.  19: 35-36). Àwọn Kristẹni gbọ́dọ̀ mọ̀ pé ìrẹ́nijẹ máa ń ba ìwà bí Kristi nínú ayé wa jẹ́ ó sì máa ń mú kí ènìyàn di ọmọ èṣù (Joh. 8: 44).
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé bí ìrẹ́nijẹ ṣe yé ọ sí láàrin àwọn ọmọdé.<li>Kín ni àtubọ̀tán kí Kristẹni máa rẹ́nijẹ?Owe 12: 22;Owe 19: 1; Owe 29: 2; Amosi 8: 4-7.<li>Ipa wo ni ìrẹ́nijẹ pàápàá jùlọ láti ọ̀dọ̀ Kristẹni ní lórí ìhìnrere Kristi lónìí? Isa.59: 2; Ise 6: 1;Matiu 5: 37; Ise 19: 13-16; 1Ko 9: 12b.<li>Kín ni àṣẹ tí Bíbélì pa fún wa láti kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti lòdì sí ìrẹ́nijẹ? Lef. 19: 35-36; Deut.25: 13-16; 1Tim. 6: 6; Jakobu 4:17.
lessons.ipari: Ìrẹ́nijẹ lè mú kí ènìyàn rí nǹkan tí ó ń wá. Ṣùgbọ́n àtubọ̀tán rẹ̀ kì í dùn mọ́ ẹni tí ó rẹ́nijẹ àti ẹni tí a rẹ́ jẹ. Ó jẹ́ ìwà tí ó tọ́ fún ọmọ Ọlọ́run kọ̀ọ̀kan láti máa gbé ìgbé ayé àìnìkànjọpọ́n, òtítọ́ àti òdodo èyí tí yóò mú wa yẹra kúrò nínú ìwà ìrẹ́nijẹ sí ìgbé ayé àlàáfià ní àwùjọ̀ àti nínú Ìjọ Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ilé tí a fi itọ́ mọ, ìrì ni yóò wó o.
lessons.akosori: Ise 6: 1 "Ǹjẹ́ ní ọjọ́ wọ̀n-ọn-nì, nígbà tí iye àwọn ọmọ-ẹ̀yìn n pọ̀ sí i, ìkùnsínú wà nínú àwọn Hellene sí àwọn Heberu, nítorí tí a n ṣe ìgbàgbé àwọn opó wọn ní ìpínfúnni ojoojúmọ́."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative behaviours in Children  (3)
lessons.aims: <li>to expose the concept of cheating among children,<li>to understand the effects of cheating to our Christian life and<li>to discuss how cheating can affect the kingdom work of the Church .
lessons.introduction: Cheating is the art of getting a desired result with lies and other deceptive ways. Rebekah in our text taught Jacob how to cheat on his brother to the extent that she placed curse on herself; and Jacob's acceptance led to the enmity between him and his brother. Many people deceive today for the purpose of getting their desired results forgetting that God's standard can never be manipulated (Lev. 19: 35-36). Christians should know that cheating ruins Christ-like character in us and enlists us in the company of the devil (Joh. 8: 44).
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain how you understand cheating especially among children.<li> What are the implications of cheating by Christians? Prov 12: 22, Prov 19: 1; Prov. 29: 2, Amos 8: 4-7.<li> What effects does cheating especially by Christians have on the Gospel of Christ today? Isa 59: 2; Acts 6: 1; Matt. 5: 37; Acts 19: 13-16;  1Cor 9: 12b<li> What are the biblical injunctions to teach children against cheating? Lev. 19: 35-36; Deut. 25: 13-16;  1Ti 6: 6; James 4:17.
lessons.conclusion: Cheating might get someone what he or she desires, but the aftermath is always unpleasant to the person and the victim. It is a godly thing for every child of God to live a life of selflessness, honesty and truth that is devoid of cheating to foster peaceful co-existence in the society and the Church.
lessons.foodForThougth: A house built with saliva will be destroyed by dew.
lessons.memoryVerse: Acts 6: 1 “And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration”.

lessons.akoko: ỌJỌ́ ÌSINMI KARÙN-ÚN LẸ́YÌN ÀJÍNDE – ỌJỌ́ ÌSINMI Ẹ̀BẸ̀
lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà àìtọ́ tí a lè rí nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé (4)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣe ìdámọ̀ àmì ọ̀lẹ nínú ayé àwọn ọmọ wa.<li>láti mú ìwà ọ̀lẹ jáde nínú ayé àwọn òbí tí ó fi ààyè gba ìwà ọ̀lẹ nínú ayé àwọn ọmọ, àti<li>láti gbà wọ́n níyànjú láti múra sí iṣẹ́ kí wọ́n lè gbé ìgbé ayé ìrọ̀rùn.
lessons.ifaara: Ọjọ́ ìsinmi Ẹ̀bẹ̀ ni a yà sọ́tọ̀ láti gbàdúrà lórí iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ wa. Nítorí náà kí ètò yìí ba lè ní ìtumọ̀, a ní láti gbógunti ìwà ọ̀lẹ. Ṣíṣe ọ̀lẹ ni kí ènìyàn má nìí akitiyan tàbí kí ó má fẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ tàbí wá iṣẹ́ ṣe. Ìwà ọ̀lẹ kì í jẹ́ kí ènìyàn ní ìtẹ̀síwájú. Ọwọ́ ọ̀lẹ máa ń dilẹ̀ èyí tí ó fi ara rẹ̀ fún àìní dípò kí ó máa gbé nínú ọ̀pọ̀. Láti inú ọkàn ni ìwà ọ̀lẹ ti ń wá. Èrò Ọlọ́run fún wa láti ìgbà tí a ti ṣẹ̀dá ayé ni láti máa ṣiṣẹ́, kì í ṣe láti ṣe ọ̀lẹ (Gen.2: 15; Col 3: 25; 1Tesa.4: 10-11; 1Tim.5: 8). Ọ̀lẹ ṣíṣe máa ń mú kí ènìyàn ṣe ìmẹ́lẹ́ èyí tí ó lè mú kí ènìyàn má wúlò rárá nígbà tí jíjẹ́ aláápọn a máa mú kí ènìyàn dúró níwájú àwọn ọba kì í sì í ṣe níwájú àwọn ènìyàn lásán.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Jíròrò lórí bí a ṣe le dá ìwà ọ̀lẹ mọ̀ nínú ayé àwọn ọmọ láti inú ibi kíkà wọ̀nyí:Owe 6: 9-10; Owe 24: 33-34; 2 Tesa 3: 10-11.<li>Báwo ni àwọn òbí ṣe lè mú ìwà ọ̀lẹ kúrò nínu ayé àwọn ọmọ wọn?Owe 22: 6;Matiu 25: 14-29; Romu 12:11.<li>Kín ni ipa àti ewu tí ó wà nínú ṣíṣe ọ̀lẹ?Owe 19: 15; Owe 10: 4-5;Matiu 25: 30<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ Ọlọ́run, báwo ni a ṣe lè gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀lẹ nínú ìbáṣepọ̀ wa pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run? Oníw. 5: 2; Oniw. 8: 3; Gal.6: 9; 1Tesa.4: 11-12.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí òní ti jẹ́ Ọjọ́ Ìsinmi Ẹ̀bẹ̀, láti tọrọ ìbùkún Ọlọ́run lórí àwọn iṣẹ́ wa, a gbọ́dọ̀ gba àwọn ọmọdé níyànjú láti múra sí iṣẹ́ kí wọ́n lè gbé ìgbé ayé ìrọ̀rùn àti kí wọ́n má bàá ya ọ̀lẹ, ìmẹ́lẹ̀ àti aláíníláárí; ní fífí ọkàn, àkókò àti àwọn ohun ìní wọn ṣòfò. Ọlọ́run kò dá wa láti jẹ́ ọ̀lẹ ṣùgbọ́n Ó ń fẹ́ kí a máa ṣiṣẹ́ kí a sì tún máa mú kí ohun gbogbo ṣiṣẹ́.
lessons.funIronu: Kò sí ààyè fún ọ̀lẹ ṣíṣé nínú ìwà Ọlọ́run.
lessons.akosori: Romu 12: 11,"Ní ti iṣẹ́ ṣíṣe, ẹ má ṣe ọ̀lẹ; ẹ máa ní ìgbóná ọkàn; ẹ máa sin Olúwa."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative Behaviours in Children (4)
lessons.aims: <li>to identify early signs of laziness in our Children,<li>to bring out lazy habits in parents that influence lazy habits in Children and<li>to encourage working hard to earn judicious livelihood.
lessons.introduction: Rogation Sunday is set apart to pray for the works of our hands. Therefore, to celebrate meaningfully, we must shun laziness. Laziness is when one is not eager or willing to work or exert oneself. Laziness ultimately leads to not being productive. A lazy hand is an idle mind mostly given to frivolities instead of substance. Laziness is a product of the mind. God's intention from the creation is for man to be gainfully engaged and not being lazy (Gen. 2: 15; Col. 3: 25; 1 Thess. 4: 10 - 11; 1 Tim. 5: 8). Laziness produces indolence which is potentially capable of rendering someone useless while diligence on the other hand ensures that one stands before kings and not mere men.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Discuss how to identify laziness in children from the following passages Prov. 6: 9-10; Prov. 24: 33-34; 2Thess. 3: 10-11. <li> How can parents influence their children against lazy habits? Prove 22: 6; Matt 25: 14-29; Rom 12:11.<li> What are the effects and consequences of laziness? Prov. 12: 24; Prov. 13: 4; Prov. 19: 15; Prov.10: 4-5; Matt 25:30.<li> As children of God, how can we deal with laziness in our relationship with God? Eccl 5: 2; Eccl 8: 3; Gal 6: 9; 1Thess 4: 11-12
lessons.conclusion: As today is Rogation Sunday, to commemorate the blessing of our works, Children must be encouraged towards working judiciously to earn their living and never to be lazy, idle, and unproductive; wasting their mind, time and resources. God did not design us to be lazy but wants us to work and make things work.
lessons.foodForThougth: Laziness has no place in the character of God.
lessons.memoryVerse: Rom. 12: 11 “Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord.”

lessons.akoko: ỌJỌ́ ÌSINMI LẸ́YÌN ÌGÒKÈ RE Ọ̀RUN.
lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà àìtọ́ tí a lè rí nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé (5)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò ohun tí àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún,<li>láti ṣàfihàn àwọn ewu tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún, àti<li>láti kọ́ nípa ewu tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ àìbọ̀wọ̀ fún Ọlọ́run àti àwọn òbí.
lessons.ifaara: Àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún túmọ̀ sí kí ènìyàn má bu iyì fún ẹlòmíràn nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu tàbí nínú ìhúwàsí. Ọmọ tí kò bá ní ẹ̀mí ìbọ̀wọ̀fúnni máa ń ṣàfihàn ìwá àrífín, ìwà ìjọra-ẹni-lójú, ìgbéraga, àì-fini-pè, àìtẹ̀lé àkókò, àìtẹ̀lé àdéhùn, abbl. Ó yẹ kí àwọn ọmọdé máa bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn òbí wọn àti àwọn àgbà nípa bíbu ọlá fún wọn. Ó ṣe pátákì kí a ní òye yìí pé ó yẹ kí a máa bu ọlá fún Ọlọ́run Ẹlẹ́dàá wá.Ibi kíkà wa lónìí jẹ́ kí a ní òye pé àwọn ègún kan wà tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ àìbọ̀wọ̀. Ayé tí kò bá ní ẹ̀mí ìbọ̀wọ̀-fún wà nínú ewu ìgékúrú ẹ̀mí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún túmọ̀ sí? Báwo ni o ṣe le dá ọmọ tí kò ní ẹ̀mí ìbọ̀wọ̀-fún mọ̀? ka Onidajo 14: 3 kí o sì jíròrò lórí bí Samsoni ṣe húwà àìnítẹríba.<li>Báwo ni Kristẹni ṣe le jẹ́ alàìbọ̀wọ̀ fún Ọlọ́run Baba wa?<li>Ṣe àfiwé Onidajo 6: 2-3 pẹ̀lú Onidajo 14: 8-9 àti Onidajo 18: 30-3; bákan náà   2 Sam. 15: 10 pẹ̀lú 2 Sam. 18: 9, 14 kí o sì tọ́kasí àwọn àtubọ̀tán àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún.<li>Ṣe àpèjúwe bí ìwà àìbọ̀wọ̀-fún ṣe ń farahàn nínú àwọn Ìjọ wa lónìí.
lessons.ipari: Samsoni kú ikú àìtọ́jọ́ nítorí tí kò bọ̀wọ̀ fún òfin Ọlọ́run nípa ti ẹ̀jẹ́ Nasir<li> Ó jẹ nínú òkú kìnnìún (Onidajo 14: 8-9, ṣe àfiwé pẹ̀lú Lef. 21: 1) nígbà tí Absalomu náà kú ikú àìtọ̀jọ́ nítorí àìbọ̀wọ̀ fún baba rẹ̀. Àwọn òbí gbọ́dọ̀ máa gbìyànjú láti máa tọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn ní ọ̀nà tí wọn yóò fi ní ìwà ìbọ̀wọ̀fúnni èyí tí yóò mú kí wọ́n fẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ nínú Ọlọ́run bí wọ́n ṣe ń dàgbàsókè.
lessons.funIronu: Ẹni tí kò bá ní ẹ̀mí ìbọ̀wọ̀fúnni wà nínú ewu.
lessons.akosori: Owe 30: 17,"Ojú tí ó gan baba rẹ̀ tí ó kọ àti gbọ́ ti ìyá rẹ̀, kannakánná ẹ̀bá odò ni yóò yọ ọ́ jáde, ọmọ idì a sì mú u jẹ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative Behaviours in Children (5)
lessons.aims: <li>to expatiate on the concept of disrespect,<li>to expose consequences of being disrespectful and<li>to study the consequences of disrespectful to God and to parents
lessons.introduction: Disrespect is to show lack of respect in the way that one speak or behave to someone. A disrespectful child shows attitudes of rudeness, being impolite, being offensive, not keeping to terms, not keeping to time, not honouring agreements, etc. Children are expected to respect their parents and elders by giving them special honour. It is very pertinent that we know that God our maker also deserves our respect.The scriptural texts today made us understand that there are curses attached to being disrespectful. A life that disrespects is in danger of being short-lived.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What does it mean to be disrespectful? How do you identify a disrespectful child? Read Judges 14: 1-3 and discuss on how Samson behaved in a disrespectful manner.<li> How can a Christian be disrespectful to God our Father? Exo. 20: 12; Prov. 20: 20; Prov 30: 17; Mark 7: 9-10<li>  Compare Judges 6:2-3 with Jdg. 13: 3-4,14:8-9 and Judges 18: 30-31 also II Sam 15: 10 with 2Sam18: 9,14 and identify the consequences of being disrespectful.<li> Describe how disrespectful attitudes are displayed in our contemporary churches
lessons.conclusion: Samson died prematurely because of his disrespect to the law of God concerning the Nazirite's vow. He ate from the dead carcass of a lion. (Judges 14: 8-9 Comp Lev 21: 1) while Absalom died prematurely because he disrespected his father. Parents should endeavour to model their children towards the path of respect through which they will position them to respond appropriately to God as they grow up.
lessons.foodForThougth: A disrespectful soul is a soul at risk.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov 30: 17 “The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà tí kò tọ̀ná tí a lè rí nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé (6).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye ohun tí ìwà àìgbọràn jẹ́<li>láti kọ́ àwọn Kristẹni nípa ìwúlò Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ láti lè borí ìwà àìgbọrán àti<li>láti ṣàfihàn àwọn ewu tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ jíjẹ́ ọmọ aláìgbọràn
lessons.ifaara: Ònì ni ọjọ́ ìsinmi Pẹ́ntíkọ́stì tí à ń ṣe ìràntí ọjọ́ tí Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ bà lé àwọn Aposteli ìgbààn<li> Láti jẹ́ aláígbọràn túmọ̀ sí kí ènìyàn hùwà àìgbọràn. Ó jẹ́ kíkọ̀ láti tẹ̀lé ìmọ̀ràn. Ó dàbí kí ènìyàn pinnu láti máa ṣe lòdì sí àṣẹ. Bíbélì ṣàfihàn ọmọ aláìgbọràn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ tí kì í gbọ́ràn sí òbí rẹ̀ lẹ́nu. Ẹ̀kọ́ wa ti òní yóò tọ́ka wa sí ọ̀kan nínú ìwà tí ó ń ṣàfihàn èyíkéyìí ọmọ Ọlọ́run tí kò ní Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ nínú ayé rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Láti inú ìfáàrà wa, túmọ̀ ṣíṣe àìgbọràn kí o sì tọ́ka sí àwọn ohun tí ó lè ṣokùnfà kí ọmọdé máa ṣàìgbọràn.<li>Ǹjẹ́ ó ṣe é ṣe kí Kristẹni ṣe àìgbọràn sí Ọlọ́run? Bí ó bá jẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, báwo ni ó ṣe jẹyọ nínú I Sam 3: 16-18.<li>Jíròrò lórí àgbékalẹ̀ Ìwé Mímọ́ nípasẹ̀ Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ nípa bí a ṣe lè mú ọmọ aláìgbọràn wá sí ọ̀nà Ọlọ́run. Esek.11: 19; Esek. 36: 27; 2 Tim.3: 14-16.<li>Kín ni àwọn ewu tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ṣíṣe àìgbọran sí Ọlọ́run? I Sam 2: 30-36;Owe 29: 1; Isa. 1: 19-20.
lessons.ipari: Olúkúlùkù ènìyàn gbọ́dọ̀ ní òye pé Ọlọ́run nìkan ṣoṣo ni ó ní ilé ayé ní ìkáwọ́, àti pé a gbọ́dọ̀ máa ṣe ohun gbogbo gẹ́gẹ́ bí àṣẹ Rẹ̀ nínú èyí tí a ní láti máa ṣe ìgbọ́ràn sí àwọn tí Ó fi ṣe olórí wa. Ṣùgbọ́n a kò le ṣe ìwọ̀nyí láì sí ìrànlọ́wọ́ Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́. Ẹ jẹ́ kí a fi ààyè gbà Á nínú ayé wa gẹ́gẹ́ bí ti ọjọ́ Pẹntikọsti, dájúdájú, a ó borí íwà àìgbọ̀ran.
lessons.funIronu: Bí a kò bá tọ́ aláìgbọ̀ran ọmọdé sọ́nà yóò di aláìgbọràn àgbàlagbà.
lessons.akosori: Isaiah 1: 19-20,"Bí ẹ̀yin bá fẹ́ tí ẹ sì gbọràn, ẹ̀yin ó jẹ ire ilẹ̀ náà: Ṣùgbọ́n bí ẹ̀yin bá kọ̀, tí ẹ sì ṣọ̀tẹ̀, a ó fi idà run yín: nítorí ẹnu Olúwa ni ó ti wí i"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative behaviours in Children (6)
lessons.aims: <li>to understand the concept of defiance,<li>to educate Christians on the need for the Holy Spirit in suppressing defiance and<li>to expose the consequences of being a defiant child
lessons.introduction: Today is Pentecost Sunday, in commemoration of the gift of the Holy Spirit on the early Apostles. To be defiant is to behave in a disobedient manner. It is the refusal to obey instructions. It is like a determined opposition against authority. The Bible text today describes reveals a defiant child as one that disobeys his parent. Our study today on defiant will open us to one of the traits of the absence of Holy Spirit in any child of God.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> From our Introduction, define defiance and enumerate factors that can bring about defiance in a child? <li> Can a Christian be defiant against God?  If yes, how in the context of I Sam 3: 16-18<li> Discuss the place of the scripture through the Holy Spirit in redeeming a defiant child in the way of God. Eze 11: 19; Eze 36: 27;  2Ti 3: 14-16. 4. What are the consequences of being defiant against God? I Sam 2: 30-36; Prov 29: 1; Isa 1: 19-20
lessons.conclusion: Everyone should understand that the only one in charge of the world is God, and that we must always do things according to His dictates which include obedience to those He has given charge over us. However, we cannot do all these without the help of the Holy Spirit. Let us allow it in our lives as on the day of Pentecost and surely defiance shall be suppressed.
lessons.foodForThougth: A defiant child without proper correction will grow up to be a defiant adult.
lessons.memoryVerse: Isaiah 1: 19 -20.  “If you are willing and obedient, you shall eat the good of the land; But if you refuse and rebel, you shall be devoured by the sword”; for the mouth of the LORD has spoken.”

lessons.akoko: ỌJỌ́ ÌSINMI MẸ́TALỌ́KAN ÀTI ỌJỌ́ ÀWỌN BÀBÁ.
lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ipa tí òbí n kó nínú ayé ọmọ (2).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> Láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lórí ohun tí Bíbélì n kọ́ni nípa ipa Bàbá oníwàbíỌlọ́run lórí ayé ọmọ rẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run fún ọjọ́ àwọn bàbá ti ọdún yìí. Kí Ọlọ́run kí ó máa bùkún àwọn bàbá wa láti lè máa jẹ́ okùnfà ipa rere nínú ayé àwọn ọmọ wa ní orúkọ Jesu. Ní ọgbọ̀n ọjọ́ oṣù kẹta (March 30), tí a ṣe ọjọ́ ìsinmi àwọn ìyá, a kọ́ nípa abala àkọ́kọ́ ti ẹ̀ka-àkòrí yìí. Lónìí, a, óò kọ́ nípa abala kejì. Nínú ibi-kíkà wa, a rí bí Ọba Dáfídì ṣe sọ̀rọ̀ ìdágbére fún Sólómónì ọmọkùnrin rẹ̀. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ bí ọ̀rọ̀ ìyànjú yìí ṣe tọ́ Solomoni sí ọ̀nà tí ó dára nínú ìṣèjọba rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Láti inú ibi-kíkà wa, ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ ìyànjú tí Dafidi fún Solomon<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wà ní 1Oba 3:4-5 ati  2 Kro.1:3, báwo ni o ṣe lè ṣàpèjúwe ipa tí Dafidi ní lórí Solomoni ọmọkùnrin rẹ̀?<li>Ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ nínú ìrírí rẹ, bí àwọn bàbá kan ṣe máa ń ṣi àwọn ọmọ wọn lọ́nà ní ìran wà yìí àti bí àwọn bàbá kan ṣe máa ń darí àwọn ọmọ wọn sí ipa ti Ọlọ́run.<li>Dárúkọ kí o sì ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ díẹ̀ lára ojúṣe bàbá oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run. Luke 11: 11; Efe.5: 28; Efe. 6: 4; Col 3:21.
lessons.ipari: Bàbá ni olórí ẹbí. Oriṣìíríṣìí àwọn bàbá ló wà lónìí ní àwùjọ wa; ṣùgbọ́n, bàbá oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run a máa ní ìfẹ́, a máa pèsè, a sì máa kọ́ àwọn ẹbí rẹ̀ ní ọ̀nà ti Ọlọ́run. Kí Ọlọ́run jọ̀wọ́ fún àwọn bàbá wa ní oore-ọ̀fẹ́ láti ṣe àwọn nǹkan wọ̀nyí ní orúkọ Jesu.
lessons.funIronu: Bàbá oníwà-bí-Ọlọ́run ni ó ń di bàbá rere.
lessons.akosori: Efe. 6: 4,"Ẹ̀yin baba, ẹ má ṣe mú àwọn ọmọ yín bínú, ṣùgbọ́n ẹ máa tọ́ wọn nínú ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìkìlọ̀ Olúwa."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: To study the biblical context of a godly father's impact on his child.
lessons.introduction: We thank God for this year's fathers' day. May God bless our fathers more and make them factors of positive impacts on our children in Jesus' name. On March 30, during mothering Sunday, we studied the first part of this sub-theme. Today, we shall study the second part. In our Bible text, we see King David's farewell speech to Solomon his son. Our study guides will expound how this admonition later tutored Solomon in the right way of governance.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> From our Text, analyse the admonitions of David to Solomon.<li> According to 1 King 3: 4-5 and 2 Chr 1: 3; how can you describe the impact of David on his son Solomon?<li> Analyse in your experience, how some fathers do mislead their children in our generation and also how some fathers are leading their children in godly paths.<li> Mention and analyse some of the responsibilities of a godly father. Luk 11: 11; Eph 5: 28; Eph 6: 4; Col 3:21.
lessons.conclusion: The father is the head of the family. There are various types of fathers today in our society; however, a godly father loves, provides and tutors his family in godly manner. May God grant all our fathers the grace to do these in Jesus' name.
lessons.foodForThougth: A godly man makes a goodly father.
lessons.memoryVerse: Eph 6: 4 “Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Àwọn ìwà tí ó lòdì tí a lè rí nínú ayé àwọn ọmọdé (7).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye nípa ohun tí jíjẹ́ aláìmoore túmọ̀ sí.<li>láti ṣàfihàn àwọn àmí jíjẹ́ aláìmoore nínú ayé wa àti ṣíṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ohun tí Bíbélì ń kọ́ wa nípa jíjẹ́ aláìmoore.<li>láti ní òye ànfààní tí ó wà nínú ìwà ìmoore àti láti fi í kọ̀ àwọn ọmọ wa.
lessons.ifaara: Jíjẹ́ aláìmoore túmọ̀ sí kíkùnà tàbí kíkọ̀ láti mọ rírì oore tí a rí gbà lọ́dọ̀ ẹlòmíràn. Ní kété tí a bá ti fún ọmọ tàbí àwọn ọmọ wa ní nǹkan; tí wọn kò bá tètè fi ẹ̀mí ìmoore hàn, a gbọ́dọ̀ mọ̀ wí pé ẹ̀mí àìmoore ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í farahàn nìyẹn. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, a lè rí bí olórí agbọ́tí ṣe gbàgbé Jósẹ́fù lẹ́yìn oore tí Josẹfu ṣe fún un àti ẹ̀bẹ̀ tí ó bẹ̀ ẹ́. Ó ṣe pàtàkì fún àwa gẹ́gẹ́ bí òbí láti tètè kíyèsí ìfarahàn ẹ̀mí àìmoore nínú ayé àwọn ọmọ wa kí a sì máa kìlọ̀ fún wọn nípa rẹ̀ láti ìgbà tí wọ́n bá ti wà ní kékeré.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe wa ní 2 Tim 3: 1-2, báwo ni o ṣe le túmọ̀ jíjẹ́ aláìmoore pàápàá nínú ayé ọmọdé?<li>Àwọn àmì wo ló máa ń farahàn láti fi ọmọ Ọlọ́run hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí aláìmoore? Deut. 8: 11-14;Owe 30: 11; Owe 30:13, Owe 30:15; Romu 1:21.<li>Kín ni àṣẹ tí Bíbélì pa fún wa nípa ìwà àìmoore? 1 Tesa. 5: 16-18; Efe.5: 20; Num. 14: 27-30; Heb.13: 5-6.<li>Báwo ni a ṣe lè kọ́ tí a sì ṣe lè tọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti ní ẹ̀mí ìmoore? Deut. 8: 11; Luke 17: 11-19; Efe.5:20.
lessons.ipari: Ìwà àìmoore jẹ́ ìwà tí kò bójúmu tí kò sì le mú wa gbádùn Ọlọ́run àti àwọn ènìyàn tí ó yí wa ká ní kíkún. Ẹ jẹ́ kí olúkúlúkù yẹ ara rẹ̀ wò bóyá a jẹ́ aláìmoore.
lessons.funIronu: Aláìmoore ọmọ dábí olè tí ó kó ni lẹ́rù lọ.
lessons.akosori: Gen.40: 23,"Ṣùgbọ́n olórí agbọ́ti kò rántí Jósẹ́fù, ó gbàgbé rẹ̀."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Traits of Negative Behaviours in Children (7)
lessons.aims: <li>to understand the concept of ungratefulness<li>to expose the signs of ungratefulness in our lives and consider biblical teachings on ungratefulness.<li>to understand the importance of the habit of gratefulness and to impart it on our children.
lessons.introduction: Being ungrateful means failure or refusal to acknowledge receipt of something good from another. The moment we give something to our child or children, and they cannot easily show gratitude, we should know that trait of ungratefulness is already building up. In our text today, we can see the butler forgot Joseph after the benevolence and plea of Joseph. It is very important for us as parents to quickly notice the trait of ungratefulness in our children and thus warn them against it at an early stage of their lives.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol> <li> In the context of 2Tim 3: 1-2, how best can you define ungratefulness especially in children?<li> What are the signs of being ungrateful as a child of God? Deut 8: 11-14; Prov 30: 11,13,15; Rom 1:21. <li> What is the Biblical injunction about ungrateful habit? 1Thess. 5: 16-18; Eph. 5: 20; Num.14: 27-30; Heb. 13: 5-6. <li> How can we teach and tutor children to be grateful? Deut 8: 11; Luke 17: 11-19; Eph 5:20.
lessons.conclusion: Ungrateful habit is a character flaw that will not allow us to enjoy God and people around us to the fullest. Let everyone examine him or herself to check whether we have the traits of ungratefulness.
lessons.foodForThougth: An ungrateful child is like a thief of virtues.
lessons.memoryVerse: Gen 40: 23 “Yet the chief butler did not remember Joseph but forgot him”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọdé ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (1).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye ìṣòtítọ́ àti láti jẹ́ kí ọmọ mọ ànfààní rẹ̀, àti<li>láti ṣàfihàn ohun tí yóò ná wa tàbí àwọn ewu tí ó wà nínú ìṣòtítọ́.
lessons.ifaara: Ìṣòtítọ̣́ túmọ̀ sí kíkọ̀ láti pa irọ́, jalè tàbí ṣe ẹ̀tàn ní ọ̀nàkọnà. Lára àwọn ìwà tí a lè rí nínú ayé ẹni tí ó ń sọ òtítọ́ ni ìwà títọ́, ìsòdodo, àìṣègbè àti ìdúróṣinṣin. Nínú ibi kíkà wa, Ọlọ́run dán àwọn ọmọ Rekabu wò nípasẹ̀ wòlíì Jeremiah láti mọ̀ bóyá wọ́n jẹ́ olóòótọ́ sí àṣẹ baba-ńlá wọn. Ènìyàn Ọlọ́run náà fún wọn ní wáìnì nínú ilé Olúwa láti mu, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n kọ̀ jálẹ̀ nítorí tí ó lòdì sí àṣẹ tí baba wọn, Jonadabu pa fún wọn. Ọlọ́run lo ìgbé ayé ìṣòtítọ́ wọn yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí àpẹẹrẹ fún àwọn àlùfáà Júdà.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Sọ ìtumọ̀ ìṣòtítọ́ kí o sì jíròrò lórí bí àwọn ọmọ Rekabu ti ṣe àfihàn rẹ̀ nínú ibi kíkà wa (Jer. 35: 5-10).<li>Kín ni ìdí tí o fi lérò pé ọmọdé nílò àti ní òye pàtàkì jíjẹ́ olóòótọ́ nínú ìgbé ayé wọn?Owe 21: 6; Jer.17: 11; Jer. 22:13.<li>Láti inú àwọn ibi kíkà wọ̀nyí, báwo ni a ṣe le fi ìwà òtítọ́ kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa? Lef. 19: 35-36; Deut. 25: 13; Sek.8: 16-17.<li>LoOwe tí ó wà níMatiu 21: 28-31, ṣe àpẹẹrẹ àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n máa ń ṣe lòdì sí ohun tí wọ́n sọ kí o sì tọ́ka sí àtubọ̀tán èyí nínú ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ọmọdé. Ṣe àfiwé pẹ̀lúOwe 12: 22;Ise.5: 3-5.
lessons.ipari: Ọlọ́run san èrè ìṣòtítọ́ àwọn ọmọ Rekabu fún wọn nípa gbígbà wọ́n kúrò lọ́wọ́ ìbínú àwọn ọ̀tá (Jer.35: 18-19). Ipá wa láti máa ṣòtítọ́ àti láti máa fi ìwà òtítọ́ hàn nínú ìgbé ayé wa ojoojúmọ́ yóò ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti mú ìwà ẹ̀tàn kúrò nínú ẹbí, nínú Ìjọ Ọlọ́run àti ní àwujọ lápapọ̀.
lessons.funIronu: Ìṣòtítọ́ lè má rọrùn ṣùgbọ́n ó ń mú ni rí ojúrere Ọlọ́run.
lessons.akosori: Owe 19: 1,"Tálákà tí n rìn nínú ìwà títọ́ rẹ̀, ó sàn ju ẹni tí ó n ṣe àrékérekè ní ètè rẹ̀ lọ tí ó sì n ṣe wèrè."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand honesty and impart its importance on a child and<li>to expose us to the cost or consequence of honesty.
lessons.introduction: Honesty simply means refusal to lie, steal, or deceive in any way. Character traits of one who is honest will include integrity, truthfulness, fairness and faithfulness. In our text, the honesty of the Rechabites as instructed by their grandfather was put to test by God through Jeremiah the prophet. They were given wine to drink in the Lord's house by the man of God, but they vehemently refused as it contradicts the instruction of their father, Jonadab. God used their honest lifestyle as a reference to the dishonest priests of Judah.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define Honesty and discuss how the Rechabites manifested it in our text (Jer 35: 5-10).<li> Why do you think a child needs to understand the importance of honesty in their livelihood? Pro 21: 6;  Jer 17: 11; Jer 22:13. <li> From the following passages, how can we impart children with honest virtues? Lev. 19: 35-36; De 25: 13; Zech. 8: 16-17.<li> Using the parable in Matt. 21: 28-31, give typical examples of people doing opposite of what they say and then point out the implication of that in children upbringing. Compare with Prov. 12: 22; Acts 5: 3-5.
lessons.conclusion: God rewarded the honesty of the Rechabites by shielding them from the enemies' wrath. (Jer 35: 18-19). Our ability to successfully practice and impart honesty in our day-to-day life will assist in removing deception in the family, the Church and the society at large.
lessons.foodForThougth: Honesty may be unfavourable; however, it attracts God's favour.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov. 19: 1 “Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips and is a fool”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọdé ní ìmọ tí ó tọ̀nà (2).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye ohun tí rírannilọ́wọ́ jẹ́ àti bí ó ti wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú Bíbélì, àti<li>láti jíròrò nípa àwọn ọ̀nà tí a le gbà rannilọ́wọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọdé àti gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ìjọ Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ifaara: Láti rannilọ́wọ́ túmọ̀ jẹ́ ìpè láti ṣe ìrànwọ́ ní ọ̀nàkọnà tí a bá lè gbà ṣe é, bíi ṣíṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìní tàbí àwọn aláìlera, bíbá àìní àwọn ènìyàn nípa ti ara àti nípa ti ẹ̀mí pàdé. Nínú ibi kíkà wa, Pọ́ọ̀lù Aposteli gbóríyìn fún Ìjọ Ọlọ́run ni Filippi ní ṣíṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún iṣẹ́ ìránṣẹ́ rẹ̀ àti ní títan ìhìnrere káàkir<li> Láti jẹ́ kí a mọ pé a nílò láti máa rannilọ́wọ́, àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò fihàn wá síwájú síi àwọn ìdí àti ọ̀nà láti máa ran ara wa lọ́wọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni rírannilọ́wọ́ ti yé ọ sí? Gbe ìdáhùn rẹ lẹ́sẹ̀ ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ibi kíkà wa lónìí.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bíMatiu 25: 34-40 àti Romu 15: 1-2, dárúkọ àwọn ọ̀nà tí a le gbà ran àwọn ọmọ wa àti Ìjọ Ọlọ́run lọ́wọ́.<li>Ka Ise 6: 1-5 àti Joh. 6: 9,11 kí o sì ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ pàtàkì àwọn ẹgbẹ́ tí ń ran ni lọ́wọ́ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé àti nínú Ìjọ kọ̀ọ̀kan.<li>Kín ni àgbékalẹ̀ Bíbélì nípa rírannilọ́wọ́, kí sì ni àtubọ̀tán kí Kristẹni má nìí ẹ̀mí ìrannilọ́wọ́?Ise 20: 35,Matiu 25: 41-46.
lessons.ipari: Ríran àwọn aláìní lọ́wọ́ máa ń mú kí ènìyàn ní ayọ̀ nínú ìbàṣepọ̀ ó sì ní èrè lọ́dọ̀ Ọlọ́run. Àwọn ọmọ tí a bá fi èyí kọ́ tí wọ́n sì ń tẹ̀lé irúfẹ́ àṣà bẹ́ẹ̀ yóò mú ayé àti Ìjọ wa dùn.
lessons.funIronu: Ṣé Kristẹni tòotọ́ tí ń ran àwọn aláìní lọ́wọ́ ni mo jẹ́?
lessons.akosori: Ise 20: 35 "Nínú ohun gbogbo ni mo fi àpẹẹrẹ fún yín pé, nípa ṣíṣe iṣẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀, ó yẹ kí ẹ máa ran àwọn aláílera lọ́wọ́ kí ẹ sì máa rántí ọ̀rọ̀ Jesu Olúwa, bí Òun fúnrarẹ̀ ti wí pé, Àti fúnni ó ní ìbùkún ju àti gbà lọ."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand Supportiveness and its biblical relevant and<li>to discuss the supportive ways at children and parish level.
lessons.introduction: To support is a call to help in whatever way possible, like caring for the needy or weak, providing material and spiritual needs. In our text, Apostle Paul extols the virtues of the Philippian's Church in their supportive manner towards his ministry and the spread of the gospel.  To further strengthen the need to help, our study guides shall expose us to more reasons and ways to support each other in Christendom.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is your understanding of supportiveness and substantiate your answer according to our text today.<li> According to Matt 25: 34-40 and Rom 15: 1-2 mention some of the ways we can be supportive to our children and in the Church.  <li> Read Acts 6: 1-5 and Joh 6: 9,11 and analyse the importance of support groups among children and at every parish. <li> What is the biblical injunction for supportiveness as well as the implication for lack of supportiveness in a Christian's life? Acts 20: 35; Matt. 25: 41-46.
lessons.conclusion: Supporting the needy provides a sense of belonging and it has reward from God. Children who are so taught and imbibe such culture will make our world and Parish a better place.
lessons.foodForThougth: Am I a true Christian that is supporting the needy?
lessons.memoryVerse: Acts 20: 35 “I have shown you in every way, by labouring like this, that you must support the weak. And remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that He said; It is more blessed to give than to receive.”`

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọdé ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (3).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye ohun tí ìwà títọ́ túmọ̀ sí, àti<li>làti jíròrò lórí pàtàkì ìwà títọ́ àti àǹfààní rẹ̀ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé àti Ìjọ Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ifaara: Ìwà títọ́ jẹyọ láti inú èdè Látin "integer"èyí tí ó túmọ̀ sí gbogbo tàbí kí nǹkan pé. Nítorí náà, ìwà títọ́ jẹ́ jíjẹ́ pípé nínú gbogbo ìwà àmúyẹ bí ìwà òtítọ́ àti àwọn ìwà tí ènìyàn ń hù ní gbogbo ìgbà. Jobu, ẹni tí a ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò rẹ̀ nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, jẹ́ ẹni tí ó yege nínú ìdánwò ìwà títọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ọlọ́run ṣe fi í yangàn níwájú Sátánì. Ní ojoojúmọ́ ni a ń fi ìwà ìdíbàjẹ́, ìrọ́ pípa àti àìṣòdodo dán ìwa títọ́ wa wò. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò ṣe àwàjinlẹ̀ orí ọ̀rọ̀ pàtàkì yìí síwájú síi
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàpèjúwe ìwà títọ́ ní ọ̀rọ̀ tìrẹ nípa lílo àpèjúwe tí Ọlọ́run ṣe nípa Jobu nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí.<li>Tọ́kasí kí o sì dárúkọ àwọn ìwà àmúyẹ ìwà títọ́ láti inú àwọn ẹsẹ ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run wọ̀nyí: Jobu 2: 3;Owe 4: 25-27; Fil.4:8.<li>Ẹnìkan wí fún ọmọ rẹ̀ pé òun kò sí nílé nígbà tí ó jẹ́ pé ńṣe ni ó ń sùn nínú ilé. Jíròrò lórí èyí ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú orí-ọ̀rọ̀ wa lónìí àti ipa tí èyí ní lórí irú ayé ọmọ bẹ́ẹ̀.<li>Báwo ni o ṣe lè lo àwọn ẹsẹ ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run wọ̀nyí láti gbin ìwà títọ́ sínú ayé àwọn ọmọ rẹ? Gen. 39: 7-9; Dan.1:5,8; Ise. 21: 8-9.<li>Kín ni ànfààni ìwà títọ́ fún ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kàn tàbí Ìjọ Ọlọ́run? Gen. 41: 39-41; Neh.7: 1-2; Jobu 42:10.
lessons.ipari: Ìwà títọ́ Kristẹni níbi iṣẹ́ tàbí níbikíbi kò ṣe é fi ojú fò dá gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti kún fún àwọn ìwà bíi àìṣẹ̀tán, òdodo, ìgbọràn, ìwà rere, òtítọ́, dídúró nínú òdodo àti dídúróṣinṣin láìyẹsẹ̀ nígbà ìdààmú. Bí a bá ṣe ń ṣe àwọn nǹkan wọ̀nyí sí náà ni a ó máa rí ojúrere lọ́dọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti lọ́dọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn tí ó wà ní àyíká wa.
lessons.funIronu: Ṣe ohun tí o wí kí o sì dúró lórí ohun tí o gbàgbọ́.
lessons.akosori: Jobu 2: 3 "Olúwa sì wí fún Satani pé, ìwọ ha kíyèsí Jobu ìránṣẹ́ mi pé, kò sí èkejì rẹ̀ ní ayé, ọkùnrin tí í ṣe olóòótọ́ tí ó sì dúróṣinṣin, ẹni tí ó bẹ̀rù Ọlọ́run tí ó sì kórìíra ìwà búburú, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni ó sì di ìwà títọ́ rẹ̀ mú ṣinṣin, bí ìwọ tilẹ̀ ti dẹ Mí sí i láti run ún láìnídìí."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand the concept of integrity and<li>to discuss the values of integrity and its benefits among children and the Church.
lessons.introduction: The word Integrity evolved from Latin adjective 'integer', meaning whole or complete. Therefore, Integrity is an inner sense of 'wholeness' deriving from qualities such as honesty and consistent character.  Job, the character in our text today, successfully passed the test of Integrity as he was made a reference personality by God before Satan. Our Integrity is put to test daily by a culture of corruption, falsehood and dishonesty. Our study guide will open us to more discoveries on this vital topic.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Describe Integrity in your own words using God's description of Job in today's text.<li> Identify and mention the attributes of Integrity from the following references: Job 2: 3; Prov. 4: 25-27; Phil. 4: 8.<li> Someone tells his child he is not at home when truly; he was sleeping inside the house. Discuss this in line with our topic today and the impact on such a child. <li> How will you apply the following bible passages to impart Integrity on your children? Gen. 39: 7-9; Dan. 1: 5,8; Acts 21: 8-9.5. What are the benefits for an individual or a Church with Integrity? Gen. 41: 39-41; Neh. 7: 1-2; Job 42:10.
lessons.conclusion: The Christian's Integrity in the workplace and anywhere cannot be overemphasized as they include: sincerity; loyalty; obedience; moral uprightness; honesty; steadfast commitment to righteousness; and maintaining consistency under pressure. The more we do these, the more we receive favour from God and people around us.
lessons.foodForThougth: Do what you say and act what you believe.
lessons.memoryVerse: Job 2: 3 “Then the Lord said to Satan, “Have considered My servant Job, that there is that there is none like him on earth, a blameless and upright man, one who fears God and shuns evil? And still he holds fast to his integrity, although you incited Me against him, to destroy him without cause.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọdé ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (4).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti jíròrò lórí ohun tí níní ìrètí túmọ̀ sí, àti<li>láti jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ bí a ti lè fi níní ìrètí kọ́ àwọn ọmọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwà Kristẹni
lessons.ifaara: Níní ìrètí túmọ̀ sí níní ìdánilójú nípa àṣeyọrí àtiIselógo ọjọ́ ọ̀la. Ó jẹ́ níní ẹ̀mí ìgboyà pé ohun gbogbo ń bọ̀ wá dára. Ibi kíkà wa lónìí ṣàfihàn àbájáde ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn Hébèrù nì nínú Ọlọ́run èyí tí wọ́n ní ìrètí nípa ìtúsílẹ̀ wọn. Ìrètí tí wọn ní láti gba ìtúsílẹ̀ wọn farahàn nínú gbígba ìtúsílẹ̀ pátápátá.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ní ìtọ́kasí ibi kíká wa lónìí, ṣàlàyé ohun tí níní ìrètí jẹ́ àti pé báwo ni o ṣe lè wàásù fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ Nàìjíríà nípa ìpèníjà ètò ọrọ̀-ajé tó wà lóde yìí?<li>Ní àwújọ tí ìgbọ̀jẹ̀gẹ́ ti gbòde kan yìí, báwo ni o ṣe lè fi níní ẹ̀mí ìrètí kọ́ àwọn ọmọ láàrin àwọn ìpèníjà náà? Ps 30: 5; Isa 43: 2; Fil.4: 13, 19; Heb.10:23.<li>Ka Jobu 2: 9-13 kí o sì ṣàlàyé àwọn okùnfà àti ìpèníjà tí ó lè ba níní ẹ̀mí ìrètí jẹ́ nínú ayé Kristẹn<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni, kín ni ó gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ àfojúsùn ìrétí wa nínú ìlànà Kristẹni yìí? Fil. 3: 20; Heb. 11: 15-16; Heb. 13:14.
lessons.ipari: Ìgbàgbọ́ ni ìpilẹ̀sẹ̀ àti àpáta tí a dúró lé gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni àti pé ìrètí ni ìgboyà àti ìrètí pé ìlérí Ọlọ́run yóò wá sí ìmúṣẹ. Níní ìrètí ni àpapọ̀ méjèèjì èyí tí ó ń mú ìdánilójú àti ayọ̀ ìrètí wa sí ìmúṣẹ.
lessons.funIronu: Kristẹni, dúró nínú ìrètí bí ìpèníjà ayé tilẹ̀ wà.
lessons.akosori: Heb.10: 23 "Ẹ jẹ́ kí a di ìjẹ́wọ́ ìrètí wa mú ṣinṣin ní àìṣiyèméjì; nítorí pé olóòótọ́ ni ẹni tí ó ṣe ìlérí."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to discuss the concept of optimism and <li>to enlighten on how to impart children with optimistic Christian values.
lessons.introduction: Optimism is hopefulness about future success and gloriousness. It is confidence that everything will turn out good. Our text today exposed us to the result of the Hebrews' faith in God which led to their optimism concerning their deliverance.  Their hope for deliverance was manifested in their total deliverance.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> In the context of our text, explain optimism and how you can minister to an average Nigerian Youth on the current economic challenges.<li> In a society where compromise seems to be the order of the day, how can you impart optimistic values in children on contemporary challenges? Ps. 30: 5; Isa 43:2; Phil 4: 13; Phil 4:19; Heb. 10: 23<li> Read Job 2: 9-13 and explain the factors and challenges that can destroy optimism in a Christian's life. <li> As Christians, what should be the focus of our optimism in Christendom?  Php 3: 20; Heb 11: 15-16; Heb 13:14.
lessons.conclusion: Faith is the foundation and rock on which we stand as Christians and hope is the confidence and expectation that God's promises will be fulfilled. Optimism is a combination of the two that turns conviction and enthusiasm of hope into reality.
lessons.foodForThougth: Christians, remain hopeful despite life challenges.
lessons.memoryVerse: Heb. 10: 23 “Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for He who promised is faithful.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (5).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye ohun tí ìbọ̀wọ̀fún jẹ́, àti<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a lè gbà fi ìwà rere yìí kọ́ àwọn ọmọ àti àwọn ọmọ ìjọ wa.
lessons.ifaara: Ìbọ̀wọ̀fún túmọ̀ sí bíbú ọlá fún ẹlòmíràn tàbí láti fi ààyè gba ìmọ̀lára, ìfẹ́ inú àti ẹ̀tọ́ tí ó tọ́ sí wọn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn. Ó túmọ̀ sí kí a rí i pé Ọlọ́run ni ó dá olúkúlùkù ó sì yẹ́ kí a ṣe sí wọ́n bí o ti yẹ. A le rí èyí bí ó ti hàn kedere nínú ibi kíkà wa níbi tí Jesu, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Júù kò ti gan obìnrin ara Samaria nì ẹni nítorí ìgbé ayé panṣàgà rẹ̀ tí kò le lọ sí ìdí kànga ní àkókò tí àwọn obìnrin ẹlẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ máa ń lọ. Jesu kò tàbùkù rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n Ó béèrè omi mímu lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò ṣàfihàn àbájáde ọ̀wọ̀ tí Jesu fún obìnrin yìí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Báwo ni ìbọ̀wọ̀fún ti yé ọ sí pàápàá gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jesu Kristi Olúwa ti ṣàfihàn rẹ̀?<li>Ṣàlàyé àbájàde bí Jesu ti ba obìnrin ará Samaria nì fọ̀wọ̀wérọ̀ pẹ̀lú ọ̀wọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà ní Johanu 4: 28-30.<li>Kín ni ohun tí Bíbélì paláṣẹ fún wa nípa bíbọ̀wọ̀ fún onírúurú ènìyàn? 1 Peteru 2: 13-18; 1 Peteru 3: 1; Peteru 5:1.<li>Báwo ni a ṣe le fi ìwà ìbọ̀wọ̀fún kọ́ àwọn ọmọ?Owe 17: 5; Owe 20: 20; Owe 23: 22; Owe 30:17.
lessons.ipari: Bíbọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn ẹlòmíràn ń ṣàfihàn bí ayé ènìyàn tí níyì tó lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí òbí àti olùkọ́, kíkọ́ àti títọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn ẹlòmíràn yóò mú kí àwùjọ àti Ìjọ wa dára kí ó sì dùn-ún wò.
lessons.funIronu: Bọ̀wọ̀ fún ni a ó sì bọ̀wọ̀ fún ọ.
lessons.akosori: Ẹ bọ̀wọ̀ fún gbogbo èníyàn. Ẹ́ fẹ́ àwọn ara. Ẹ bẹ̀rù Ọlọ́run. Ẹ bọ̀wọ̀ fún ọba."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand the concept of Respect along and<li>to discuss practical ways of imparting the virtue in children and Church members.
lessons.introduction: The concept of Respect is essentially to either admire another person or to have regard for the feelings, wishes, and rights as they are due as human being. It is to see that each person is God's creation and so deserves to be treated as we would like to be treated. The concept is clearly brought out in our text where Jesus, as a Jew without looking down on the Samaritan woman who perhaps based on her loose life could not go to the well at the regular time other women would go. Jesus never disregarded her, but requested from her, drinking water. Our study guide will expose us to the result of Jesus respect for this woman.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> How do you understand the concept of Respect especially as demonstrated by our Lord Jesus Christ in our text.<li> Explain the result of Jesus' respectful dialogue with the Samaritan woman according to Joh 4: 28-30.<li> What are the biblical injunctions concerning respect for various categories of people? 1 Pet. 2: 13-18; 1 Pet. 3: 1; 1 Pet. 5:1.<li>How can we impart the virtue of Respect to children? Prov. 17: 5; Prov. 20:20; Prov. 23: 22; Prov.30:17
lessons.conclusion: Respecting others demonstrates the value God places on life. As parents and teachers, teaching and training our children on how to respect others will give a better and pleasant  atmosphere to our society and Church community.
lessons.foodForThougth: Respect and you shall be respected.
lessons.memoryVerse: 1 Pet. 2: 17 “Honour all people. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà.
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ní òye nípa ohun tí pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ jẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bíbélì ṣe ṣàgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀, àti <li> láti ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò ipa tí pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ ń kó nínú ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ọmọ.
lessons.ifaara: Pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ jẹ́ fífẹ́ láti mọ̀ tàbí kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ sí i nípa àwọn onírúurú ohun tí ó fẹjú pàápàá nípa àbùdá àwọn ènìyàn. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Nikodemu, ọ̀kan nínú àwọn Farisí, àti ìjòyè nínú àwọn Júù tọ Jesu wá ní òru láti ní ìmọ̀ síi nípa Jesu. Pípòùngbẹ rẹ̀ láti ní ìmọ̀ rẹ̀ yìí ni ó yọrí sí ìfọ̀rọ̀wérọ̀ nípa àtúnbí nínú èyí tí Nikodemu fi ní ìmọ̀ síi nípa ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Túmọ̀ pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí.<li>Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú orí-ọ̀rọ̀ wa lónìí, báwo ni àwọn ẹsẹ wọ̀nyí nínú Johanu 3: 6, 8 ti yé ọ sí?<li>Kín ni pàtàkì pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ nínú ìdàgbàsókè wa nípa ti ẹ̀mí? Jíròrò ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú Eks 3: 1-10; Luke 19: 1-10.<li>Báwo ni àwọn òbí ṣe lè gba àwọn ọmọ wọn níyànjú kí wọn sì gbé agbára wọ̀ wọ́n kí wọ́n lè ní ẹ̀mí ìpòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ lọ́nà tí ó tọ́? Deut.29: 29;Owe 20: 2; Jak.1:5.
lessons.ipari: Pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ ni ó mú kí Nikodemu ṣàwárí àwọn ohun ìjìnlẹ̀ ti ẹ̀mí. Nítorí náà, pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ a máa mú kí àwọn ọmọdé wádìí nípa àwọn ohun tí ó yí wọn ká ní ọ̀nà tí ó yàtọ̀.
lessons.funIronu: Pípòùngbẹ fún ìmọ̀ ni yóò jẹ́ kí a mọ̀ bí ìmọ̀ ti ènìyàn yóò ti tò.
lessons.akosori: Owe 25: 2 "Ògo Ọlọ́run ni láti pa ọ̀ràn mọ́; ṣùgbọ́n ọlá àwọn ọba ni láti wádìí ọ̀ràn."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand Curiosity from biblical perspective and<li>to expatiate on the essence of curiosity in children development.
lessons.introduction: Curiosity is a disposition to want to know more or to learn more about a wide variety of things including personalities. In our text, Nicodemus, a Pharisee, and a ruler of the Jews went to Jesus by night in order to know more of Jesus. This curiosity led to the dialogue concerning the new birth through which Nicodemus was enlightened more concerning the kingdom of God..
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define Curiosity in the context of our text today.<li> In the context of our topic today, how do you understand the verses in Joh 3: 6,8?<li> What is the importance of Curiosity to our spiritual growth? Discuss in the context of Exod. 3: 1-10; Luke 19: 1-10.<li> How should parents encourage and empower children to cultivate a healthy sense of Curiosity? Deut. 29: 29; Prov. 25: 2; Jam 1:5.
lessons.conclusion: Curiosity enables Nicodemus discovered some spiritual mysteries. Therefore, curiosity enlightens children to explore the world around them with a new perspective.
lessons.foodForThougth: Curiosity determines the level of knowledge.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov. 25: 2 “It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà.
lessons.oriOro: Níní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni - ọ̀nà fún àṣeyọrí aláìlẹ́gbẹ́.
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti jíròrò lórí níní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni àti àwọn orísun rẹ̀, àti<li>láti tọ́kasí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a lè fi mú kí ó dàgbàsókè nítorí ìjọba ọ̀run.
lessons.ifaara: Ní ìlànà Kristẹni, níní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni túmọ̀ sí níní ìdánilójú nípa ìbáṣepọ̀ ènìyàn àti Ọlọ́run pẹ̀lú ìgboyà àti ìgbàgbọ́ pé ọjọ́ ọ̀la òun wà ní ìkáwọ́ Ọlọ́run. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Dafidi jẹ́ ọ̀dọ́mọkùnrin tí kò ní ìrírí ogun jíjà ṣùgbọ́n tí ó fi ìgbẹkẹ̀lé tí ó ní nínú ara rẹ̀ hàn nípa ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ nínú Ọlọ́run láti fi ìgboyà dojú ìjà kọ Goliati tí í ṣe àkíkanjú nínú ogun jíjà. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò tẹ̀síwájú láti tanmọ́lẹ̀ sí bí níní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni ṣe lè jẹ́ ohun èlò pàtàkì tí ó lè tún ayé àwọn ọmọ wa ṣe nígbà tí a bá fi í kọ́ wọn.
lessons.ibere: <li>Kín ni òye tìrẹ nípa níní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni àti pé báwo ni Dafidi ti ṣe àmúlò rẹ̀ nígbà tí ó bá Goliati jà? I Sam 17: 14-45<li>Níbo ni Dafidi ti rí ẹ̀mí ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara rẹ̀ àti pé báwo ni o ti ṣe le fi í kọ́ ọmọ? I Sam 17: 34-37; Ps27: 1-3; Jere.17: 7-8; Fil.4:13.<li>Dafidi tí ó kéré jùlọ nínú àwọn ọmọ Jese jẹ́ olùṣọ́-àgùtàn, níbi tí ó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ẹ̀mí ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara rẹ̀. Jíròrò lórí àwọn ohun tí a lè fi kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti lè ní ẹ̀mí ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara wọn pàápàá èyí tí ó bá máa ń ṣojo:Owe 3: 25-26; Sak.4:6,Sak.4:7,Sak.4:10; Mat.21: 21; Fil.4: 13; Heb.10: 35-36.<li>Báwo ni níní ẹ̀mí ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú ara ẹni ṣe lè jẹ́ ìrànwọ́ fún ìmúgbòòrò ìjọba Ọlọ́run? Isaiah 41:10,Isaiah 41:13; Mat.10:19,Mat.10:28;Ise. 4:31-32.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí olódodo ṣe láyà bíi kìnnìún, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni ẹni tí ìgbẹkẹ̀lé rẹ̀ dúró lórí ìgbàgbọ́ nínú Ọlọ́run. Nítorí náà, ọmọ tí ó bá ní ẹ̀mí ìgboyà jẹ́ ògo àwọn òbí rẹ̀, yóò sì lè borí ìpèníjà ayé.
lessons.funIronu: Onígboyà ènìyàn jẹ́ aṣẹ́gun.
lessons.akosori: Fil. 4: 13 "Èmí lè ṣe ohun gbogbo nínú Kristi ẹni tí n fi agbára fún mi"
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Self-Confidence - a tool for lifelong success
lessons.aims: <li>to discuss self-confidence and its sources and<li>to identify practical ways of developing it for the kingdom purpose.
lessons.introduction: In Christianity, confidence is an assurance of one's relationship with God with the boldness and conviction that one's destiny is secured in God. In our text, David, was a youth without previous experience in war but displayed self-confidence based on his faith in God by boldly engaging Goliath, a warlord in battle.  Our study guides will beam more light on how self-confidence can be a vital tool that can positively impact the lives of our children when they are so taught.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is your own understanding of self-confidence and how does David exhibit it in his encounter with Goliath? I Sam 17: 44-45<li> Where did David derive his self-confidence from and how do you teach that to a child? 1 Sam. 17: 34-37; Ps. 27: 1-3; Jer. 17: 7-8; Phil 4:13.<li> David, the youngest of Jesse's sons was made a shepherd where he developed his skill in self-confidence. Discuss the practical things we can put our children through to develop their self-confidence, especially the shy ones. Prov. 3: 25-26; Zech 4: 6,7,10; Mt 21: 21; Phil. 4: 13; Heb. 10: 35-36.<li> How can self-confidence help in expanding the kingdom of God? Isa 41: 10,13; Matt 10: 19,28; Acts 4: 31-32.
lessons.conclusion: As the righteous is as bold as the lion, so is the person whose confidence is based on his faith in God. Therefore, a child that is self-confident becomes a pride of his parents and can successfully face the challenges of life.
lessons.foodForThougth: The self-confident person is a victor.
lessons.memoryVerse: Phil. 4: 13 “I can do all things through Christ which strengthened me,”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (8).
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàlàyé ẹ̀mí ìfaradà Jesu àti bí ó ti ṣe pàtàkì fún àwọn òjíṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run, àti<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a lè gbà ran àwọn ọmọ lọ́wọ́ láti ní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà láti lè jogún ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
lessons.ifaara: .Ìfaradà jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti yípadà àti láti yẹ fún ipò titun tí ènìyàn bá ara rẹ̀. Ìfaradà pè fún kí ènìyàn gbé ìgbé ayé rẹ̀ láti kojú ìpèníjà tàbí ipò tí ó wà. Bákan náà ni ó pè fún kí ènìyàn ní ẹ̀mí ìtẹríba àti jíjọ̀wọ́ ìfẹ́ àti ọkàn ẹni fún Ọlọ́run àti ètò Rẹ̀. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Jesu Kristi Oluwa wa fi ara rẹ̀ ṣe àpẹẹrẹ nípa níní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà. Ó fi ògo Rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ lọ́run láti wá sí ayé ní àwòrán ènìyàn àti bí Ó tílẹ̀ jẹ́ aláìlẹ́ṣẹ̀, Ó kú gẹ́gẹ́ bí arúfin nítorí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wa. Àwọn ìbéèrè wa fún ìjíròrò yóò ṣàlàyé síwájú síi nípa bí a ti lè ní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà bíi Tirẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Báwo ni o ti ṣe lè ṣàlàyé ìfaradà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ ìránṣẹ́ Jesu lórílẹ̀ ayé?<li>Kín ni àwọn ìwà rere fún ìfaradà láti le polongo ìhìnrere?Matiu 3: 13-15; Romu 6: 13; 1Ko 9: 19-23.<li>Nínú ìrírí wa, báwo ni a ti ṣe le kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa láti ní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà ní àkókò ìpèníjà? Fil. 4: 11-13 sì fi ìyàtọ̀ hàn láàrin níní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà nínú ìwà rere àti wíwà ní ìrọra nínú ìwà búburú. 2 Ko  6:14.<li>Báwo ni a ti ṣe lè ní ẹ̀mí ìfaradà nínú ọ̀nà tí à ń gbà wàásù ìhìnrere láti lè jèrè ọkàn sí ìjọba Ọlọ́run?Matiu 9: 14-15; Luke 22: 35-36.
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Jesu ṣe fi tọkàntọkàn gbà láti gbé àwòrán ènìyàn wọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìfẹ́ àti ètò Baba Rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìtẹríba, ọmọ Ọlọ́run kọ̀ọ̀kan gbọdọ̀ máa ṣe ìgbọràn kí wọ́n sì máa fẹ́ láti ṣe ohun gbogbo ní ọ̀nà ti Ọlọ́run nínú ipòkípò tí wọ́n lè wà. Ṣùgbọ́n a ní láti kíyèsára láti mọ̀ pé ìfaradà nínú ìwà rere yàtọ̀ pátápátá sí wíwà ní ìrọra nínú ìwà búburú.
lessons.funIronu: Òhun tí Ọlọ́run ń béèrè lọ́wọ́ wa ni jíjọ̀wọ́ ara wa fún ètò Ọlọ́run.
lessons.akosori: Romu 6: 13 "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni kí ẹ̀yin kí ó má ṣe jọ̀wọ́ àwọn ẹ̀yà ara yín lọ́wọ́ fún ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bí ohun èlò àìṣòdodo; ṣùgbọ́n ẹ jọ̀wọ́ ara yín lọ́wọ́ fún Ọlọ́run, bí alààyè kúrò nínú òkú, àti àwọn ẹ̀yà ara yín bí ohun èlò òdodo fún Ọlọ́run."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to explain the adaptability of Jesus and its importance for gospel ministers and<li>to discuss practical ways to help children adapt for the kingdom's fortune.
lessons.introduction: Adaptability is the ability to change and fit into a new situation. Adaptability often requires living above circumstances and conditions. It also entails humility and yielding your will and mind to God and His plan. In our text today, our Lord Jesus Christ displays a good example in adaptability. He left his heavenly glory to come to this world in human nature and as innocent as he is, to die as a criminal for our sin. Our study guide will further explain how we can adapt like him.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> How best can you explain adaptability according to Jesus' mission on earth?<li> What are the virtues for adaptability for the propagation of the gospel?  Matt 3: 13-15; Rom. 6: 13; 1 Cor. 9: 19-23.<li> Practically, how can we teach our children to adapt to challenging situations? Phil. 4: 11-13 and differentiate between adaptability in godliness and complacence in ungodliness. 2 Cor 6:14.<li> How well can we adapt our evangelism style to effectively enhance the kingdom fortunes? Matt:9: 14-15; Luke 22: 35-36
lessons.conclusion: Like Jesus willingly accepted to be refashioned according to His Father's will and plan in humility, every child of God must be obedient and willing to do things in God's way no matter the situation. However, we must be very cautious to know that adaptability in godliness is totally different from complacence in ungodliness.
lessons.foodForThougth: Divine demands require your yielding to God's plan.
lessons.memoryVerse: Rom. 6: 13 “Neither yield your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God; as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments unto God”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (9)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> láti ní òye ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ọgbọ́n àtinúdá gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bíbélì ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀ <li> láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a le fi mú ọgbọ́n àtinúdá dàgbà nínú ọmọ, àti <li> láti jíròrò pàtàkì ọgbọ́n àtinúdá sí Ọlọ́run, ènìyàn àti Ìjọ.
lessons.ifaara: Ọlọ́run ni Olùpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ọgbọ́n àtinúdá nítorí Òun ni ó dá ohun gbogbo tí ń bẹ ní ayé àti ọ̀run. Nítorí náà, yálà o jẹ́ akunlélọ́dà, aránṣọ, ayàwòrán, olórin, abbl. gbogbo wa ni a ní ọgbọ́n àtinúdá nínú wa, níwọ̀n ìgbà tí a dá wa ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run. Lára ọgbọ́n àtinúdá ni níní ìṣípayá, pípòùngbẹ láti ní ìmọ̀, níní àròjinlẹ̀, ṣíṣe iṣẹ́ ìwádìí, ṣíṣe iṣẹ́ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára, ṣíṣe àfiyèsí, ṣíṣètò nǹkan bí ó ti tọ́, ètò ìbára-ẹni-sọ̀rọ̀, abbl. Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Ọlọ́run pe Basaleli àti Oholiabu tí wọ́n jẹ́ oníṣẹ́ ọwọ́ nípa fífi ẹ̀mí ọgbọ́n, òye àti ìmọ̀ Rẹ̀ kún wọn nípa onírúurú iṣẹ́ ọnà.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Sọ ìtumọ̀ ọgbọ́n àtinúdá kí o sì tọ́kasí àwọn ènìyàn tí a mẹ́nubà nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí àti orísun ọgbọ́n wọn. Ekso.35: 30-31.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bíbélì ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀, báwo ni o ṣe lè fi dá àwọn ènìyàn lójú pé Ọlọ́run ni Ẹlẹ́dàá ohun gbogbo àti Orísun gbogbo ọgbọ́n ìṣẹ̀dá. Jobu 5: 8-9; Ps. 139: 14; Jak.1: 6-7.<li>Dárúkọ ọgbọ́n àtinúdá nínú Ekso. 35: 32-35, báwo sì ni àwọn òbí ṣe lè gba àwọn ọmọ wọn níyànjú láti ṣe àmúlò ọgbọ́n yìí ní àkókò tí kò sí iṣẹ́ yìí? Ps 8: 1-2; Ps 104:24; Isa.8:18.<li>Báwo ni ọgbọ́n inú ṣe le jẹ́ ohun èlò pàtàkì fún ìwàásù ìhìnrere àti iṣẹ́ ìránṣẹ́? Ps 68: 4; Ps 107: 15-16;Ise 16: 25-33; Romu 12: 6-8.
lessons.ipari: Ọgbọ́n inú àti ọ̀nà ìṣẹ̀dá jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí ó dára tí ó sì rẹwà láti fi ògo fún iṣẹ́ ìyanu Ọlọ́run. Nítorí náà, Ọlọ́run ti ró wa ní agbára Ó sì ti rú wa sókè láti lo ẹ̀bùn oore-ọ̀fẹ́ Rẹ̀ fún ìmúgbòòrò Ìjọba Rẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ ayé.
lessons.funIronu: Àyé tí kò ní ọgbọ́n àtinúdá kò níláárí.
lessons.akosori: Eks 35: 35 "Ó sì fi ọgbọ́n inú kún wọn, láti ṣe onírúurú iṣẹ́, ti alágbẹ̀dẹ, àti ti ọ̀nà, àti tí agunnà, ní aṣọ aláro, àti ní elése-alùkò, àti ní ọ̀gbọ̀ dáradára, àti tí ahunṣọ, àti àwọn ẹni tí n ṣe iṣẹ́kíṣẹ́ àti ti àwọn ẹni tí n húmọ̀ iṣẹ́ ọ̀nà."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to understand the root of creativity from biblical context <li>to discuss ways of developing creative skills in a child and<li>to discuss the importance of Creativity to God, humanity, and the Church
lessons.introduction: Creativity is rooted in God because He is the creator of all things on earth and in heaven. So, whether you are a painter, seamstress, designer, musician, etc, we all have some level of creativity in us, since we are made in the image of God. Creative skills involve open-mindedness, curiosity, ability to brainstorm, experimentation, networking, observation, organization, communication etc. In our text, God called and made Bezalel and Aholiab artisans by imparting them with His Spirit of wisdom, understanding and knowledge in all manners of workmanship.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define creativity and identify the personalities in our text and the source of their creative skills. Exod 35: 30-31.<li> From biblical context, how can you prove that God is the ultimate creator and the source of all creativity? Job 5: 8-9; Ps. 139: 14; Jam 1: 6-7.<li> Mention the creative skills in Exod 35: 32-35 and how can parents encourage their children to develop such skills in a situation of lack of employment opportunities? Ps. 8: 1-2; Ps. 104: 24; Isa 8:18.<li> How can creativity be a vital tool for evangelism and mission? Ps. 68: 4; Ps. 107: 15-16; Acts 16: 25-33; Rom 12: 6-8.
lessons.conclusion: Creativity and the creative process are good and beautiful ways of glorifying the wonders of God. Therefore, the Lord equips and inspires us to use His gracious gifts for His kingdom expansion on earth.
lessons.foodForThougth: Life without creativity is valueless
lessons.memoryVerse: Exod. 35: 35 “He has filled them with skill to do all manner of work of the engraver and the designer and the tapestry maker, in blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine linen, and of the weaver - those who do every work and those who design artistic works.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (10)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li> láti sọ ohun tí ìgboyà jẹ́, àti<li> láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a lè gbà gbin ẹ̀mí ìgboyà sínú àwọn ọmọ ní    àwùjọ tí ètò ààbò ti mẹ́hẹ yìí.
lessons.ifaara: Ìgboyà jẹ́ agbára tàbí ẹ̀mí tí yóò mú kí ènìyàn kojú ewú tàbí ìṣòro láì fòyà. Irúfẹ́ ẹ̀mí yìí ni Peteru ṣàfihàn rẹ̀ nígbá tí ó rí Jesu tí Ó ń rìn lórí omi òkun gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti rí i nínú ibi kíkà wa tí ó sì bi Jesu léèrè pé ṣe kí òun máa bọ̀ wá sọ́dọ̀ Rẹ̀ nípa rírìn lórí òkun. Jesu wí fún un kí ó wá, ó sì bọ́ sínú òmi ó sì ń rìn lórí òkun. Ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí ó ń wò bí ìjì ṣe ń fẹ́ ní àyíká rẹ̀, ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí rì. Àwọn ibere wa yóò tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ síwájú si nípa bí àwọn ọmọ àti Kristẹni ṣe le ni ẹ̀mí ìgboyà nínú aye tí ó ń ri ènìyàn tí ó sì kún fún ìjì yìí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Túmọ̀ ìgboyà bí ó ṣe wà nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí kí o sì ṣàlàyé ìdí tí Peteru ṣe le rìn lórí omi àti ìdí tí ó fi bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí rì.<li>Kíkùnà nínú ìdánwò jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan láti má ṣe jẹ́ kí ọmọdé ní ìtẹ̀síwájú. Dárúkọ àwọn ọ̀nà mìíràn láti ṣe ìdíwọ́ fún ìtẹ̀síwájú ènìyàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bíbélì ti tọ́ka rẹ̀, dárúkọ àwọn ọ̀nà láti gbin ẹ̀mí ìgboyà sínú ayé irúfẹ́ ọmọ bẹ́ẹ̀. Jos.1: 5-9; Ps23: 1-4; Romu 8: 28; Fil.4:13.<li>Àwọn ọmọdé sábà máa ń dojúkọ ìpèníjà bí ìfìyájẹni láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn akẹgbẹ́ẹ wọn ní ilé-ìwé, àìsí ààbò, ìjínigbé lójú ọ̀nà àbbl, irúfẹ́ ọ̀nà wo ni òbí tàbí alágbàtọ́ lè gbà láti gbin ẹ̀mí ìgboyà sínú ayé ọmọ láti dojúkọ àwọn ìpènijà tí ó yí wa ká? Deut 31: 6; Ps 27: 1-3; Isa.43: 1-4; 2Tim 1:7.<li>Ní ṣíṣé àgbéyẹ̀wò àwọn ewu tí Ìjọ Ọlọ́run ń kojú, jíròrò lórí bí ìgboyà ṣe lè jẹ́ ohun èlò tí ó dára fún wíwàásù ìhìnrere gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹn. Deut. 3: 16-26; Deut. 6:16-26; Matiu 28:20.
lessons.ipari: Níní ìmọ̀ nípa ìwàláàyè Ọlọ́run nínú ayé ẹni yóò fún wa ní ìgboyà nípa ìgbàgbọ́ láti kojú àwọn ìpènijà. Nítorí náà, nígbà tí a bá gbẹ́kẹ̀lé agbára Ọlọ́run, àwọn ìlérí àti ọ̀rọ̀ Rẹ̀, a ní ìdánilójú kíkún nípa ìṣẹ́gun tí ń borí ẹ̀rù ní òpin gbogbo ìpèníjà.
lessons.funIronu: Ìgboyà pẹ̀lú ìgbàgbọ́ nínú Ọlọ́run a máa borí ẹ̀rù.
lessons.akosori: Deut. 31: 6 "Ẹ ṣe gírí kí ẹ sì mú àyà le, ẹ má ṣe bẹ̀rù, ẹ má sì ṣe fòyà wọn, nítorí pé OLÚWA Ọlọ́run rẹ Òun ni ó n bá ọ lọ, Òun kì yóò fi ọ́ sílẹ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni kì yóò kọ̀ ọ́."
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to define courage and <li>to discuss the method to use in imparting Courage to kids in daunting insecurity situations
lessons.introduction: Courage is the ability or quality of the spirit that enables one to face danger or pain without showing fear. It was this kind of quality that Peter displayed when he found out in our text that Jesus was walking on the sea and asked Jesus if he could come to him by walking on the sea. Jesus encouraged him to come, and he jumped into the waters and started walking on the sea. However, when he started looking at the wind blowing around him, he started sinking. Our study guides will beam searchlight into how children and Christians can be spiritually imparted with courage in a sinking and stormy world.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define courage according to our text and explain why Peter was able to walk on the sea and why he started sinking on the sea.<li> Failure in examinations is one way to discourage a child in progressive moves. Mention some other means of discouragement and from biblical points of view; give possible methods to impart courage in such a child. Josh. 1: 5-9; Ps. 23: 1-4; Rom 8: 28; Phil 4:13. <li> Children are always confronted with challenges like bullies at school, insecurities, kidnappers on the road etc, what method should a parent or guardian adopt to impart courage in a child in the face of such challenges around us? Deut. 31: 6; Psa 27: 1-3; Isa. 43: 1-4; 2Tim. 1:7.<li> Considering the current threats on the Church, discuss how courage can be a good tool for evangelization in Christendom.  Dan. 3: 16-26;  Dan. 6: 16-26; Matt. 28:20.
lessons.conclusion: Having experiential knowledge of God's presence in one's life will produce Courage fuelled by faith to face challenges. So, when we trust in God's power, promises and His word; we have full assurance of victory that overcome fear and at the end of every challenge.
lessons.foodForThougth: Courage with faith in God overcomes fear.
lessons.memoryVerse: Deut. 31: 6 “Be strong and of a good courage, do not fear nor be afraid of them' for the Lord your God, He is the One who goes with you. He will not leave you nor forsake you.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Kíkọ́ àwọn ọmọ ní ìmọ̀ tí ó tọ̀nà (11)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lórí sùúrù nípasẹ̀ àwọn àpẹẹrẹ kan nínú Bíbélì, àti<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí ó wúlò láti fún àwọn ọmọ ní ẹ̀kọ́ sùúrú
lessons.ifaara: Sùúrù ni ipá tàbí ìwà rere láti fi ara dà ìpèníjà, ìdádúró, tàbí ìfiduni láì bínú. Nínú sùúrù, oò ní láti bínú. Nínú ibi kíkà wa, Abrahamu àti Sarah ní láti dúró fún ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n kí wọn tó ní Isákì ọmọ ìlérí. Ìrírí wọn jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ ìwà-rere sùúrù fún àwọn òbí àti àwọn ọmọ ti ìran wa.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Báwo ni sùúrù ti yé ọ sí bí ó ti wà nínú ibi kíkà wa? Báwo sì ni o ti lè sọ èyí fún àwọn ọmọ?<li>Tí a bá kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lára àpẹẹrẹ sùúrù Ọlọ́run pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ Israẹli nínú Deut. 29: 2-5, báwo ni a ṣe lè ṣàmúlò ìwà-rere yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí òbí àti ọmọ nínú ìgbé ayé Kristẹni wa? Oniw. 7: 8; Luk 21: 19; Rom 12: 12; 2Tim 2:24.<li>Báwo ni ó ṣe yẹ kí àwọn òbí fi ìwà-rere yìí kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn nípasẹ̀ 'dídá ìgbádùn ẹni dúró’, 'gbígbìn àti kíkórè’ abbl;.? Sek. 8: 12; Heb. 6: 12; Jak. 1: 3-4<li>Àní bí Jósẹ́fù ṣe gba èrè fún sùúrù rẹ̀ fún ìmúṣẹ àwọn àlá rẹ̀ ní Gen. 37: 5, Gen. 37:9-10; Gen. 45: 4-7, kín ni àwọn èrè mìíràn tí ó wà fún Sùúrù fún Ìjọ àti ọlọ́danni? Ps.40: 1; Isa 33: 2; Ekun 3: 25; Luk 2: 25;Ise 1: 4; Ise 2: 1-2.
lessons.ipari: Nípasẹ̀ ìbáṣepọ̀ wa gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan pẹ̀lú Ẹ̀mí Mímọ́ ni a fi lè gba ìwà-rere Sùúrù. Àní gẹ́gẹ́ bí Abrahamu, Sarah, Josẹfu ti ní ìmúṣẹ ìlérí Ọlọ́run nípasẹ̀ sùúrù, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni gbogbo onígbàgbọ́ nínú Kristi tí ó fi sùúrù dúró de ìpadàbọ̀ Jesu Kristi yóò jogún Ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Sùúrù ṣe pàtàkì fún ìmúṣẹ àwọn ìlérí Ọlọ́run
lessons.akosori: Heb. 6: 12 “ki ẹ mase di onilọra, ṣugbọn alafarawe awọn ti wọn ti ipa ìgbàgbọ́ ati sùúrù jogún àwọn ìlerí”
lessons.theme: The Reign of God: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to teach Patience through some Biblical examples and <li>to discuss some practical ways of imparting Patience into children
lessons.introduction: Patience is the capacity or virtue to tolerate challenges, delays, or denial without getting upset. In patience, you don't lose your temper. In our text, Abraham and Sarah had to wait for twenty-five years before having the promised child, Isaac. Their experience is a virtuous example of Patience for both parents and children of our generation.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> How do you understand Patience in the context of our text? And how do you relay same to children?<li> Learning from God's example of His Patience with the Israelites in Deut. 29: 2-5, how should we apply this virtue as parents and children in our Christian lives? Eccl 7: 8;Luk 21: 19; Rom 12: 12; 2Tim 2:24.<li> How should parents impart this important virtue to children through 'delayed gratification', 'sowing and harvesting' etc.? Zech. 8: 12; Heb. 6: 12; Jam. 1: 3-4<li> Just as Joseph was rewarded for his patience for the manifestation of his leadership dreams in Gen. 37: 5, Gen. 37:9-10; Gen. 45: 4-7, what are other benefits of Patience to the Church and individuals? Ps. 40: 1; Isa 33: 2;  Lam 3: 25; Luk 2: 25; Acts 1: 4; Acts 2: 1-2.
lessons.conclusion: We can only receive the virtue of Patience through our individual relationship with the Holy Spirit. Just like Abraham, Sarah, Joseph had the fulfilment of God's promises through patience, so shall all believers in Christ Jesus who patently wait for His second coming, inherit the kingdom of God.
lessons.foodForThougth: Patience is important for fulfilment of God's promises
lessons.memoryVerse: Heb. 6: 12 “That you do not become sluggish but imitate those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ìbáwí Ọmọ (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol><li>láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lórí èrò Bíbélì lórí ìbáwí àti àwọn èrè rẹ̀, àti<li>láti ṣàyẹ̀wò ipa tí àibániwí [ìkẹ́ àkẹ́jù] ní lórí ọmọ àti àwùjọ
lessons.ifaara: Bíbá Ọmọ́dé wí ni a lè pè ní ààlà tí a pa, tàbí àgbékalẹ̀ àwọn òbí láti ṣèrànwọ́ tó fẹsẹ̀rinlẹ̀ fún àwọn ọmọ wọn láti ní àmúyẹ nínú ìgbé ayé ìdunnú gidi  Nínú ibi kíkà wa lónìí, Wòlíì Eli kò bínú sí àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ ó sì gbọ̀jẹ́gẹ̀ fún wọn nínú ìwà ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wọn. Bíbélì rọ àwọn òbí láti kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn láti bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn òfin ìwà, kí wọ́n sì ṣàmúlò ìjìyà láti ṣàtúnṣe ìwà àìgbọràn [Owe 19: 18; Owe 13: 24; Owe 22: 15]. Nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí, a ó ṣàyẹ̀wò àwọn àǹfààní bíbá ọmọ wí àti àtubọ̀tán àì ní ìbáwí nítorí kíkẹ́ ọmọ ní àkẹ́jù lórí ọmọ àti àwùjọ.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni Bíbá Ọmọ wí àti ipa rẹ̀ nínú àwọn ẹsẹ Bíbélì wọ̀nyí? Gen. 39: 6-10; Jer. 35: 3-7; Daniel 1: 8; Daniel 1:11-15; Heberu 11: 24-25.<li>Ka I Sam 2: 13-17; I Sam 2:22-24. Ǹjẹ́ ó bójúmu fún Eli láti dúró di ìgbà tí ó tó darúgbó, tí àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ sì ti tójú bọ́ kí ó tó gbìyànjú láti bá wọn wí? Jíròrò.<li>Jíròrò lórí àwọn ìwà tí kò léwu tó bẹ́ẹ̀ ti àwọn àgbà tí ó lè léwu fún ọjọ́ iwájú ọmọ tí ó bá ṣíjú sí wọn.<li>Báwo ni a ṣe lè fi ẹsẹ̀ ìbáwí ọmọ múlẹ̀ láì sí ìnira nínú ilé, nínú Ìjọ àti ní àwùjọ? Deut. 6: 6-7; Owe 29: 17; Efe. 6: 4, Col 3:21.
lessons.ipari: A máa ń sábà gbàgbé pé ìbáwí ọmọ wà fún kíkọ́ni, kì í ṣe gbogbo ìgbà ni ó wà fún ìfìyàjẹ wọ́n. Àwọn ọmọ ni àgùtàn Olúwa, àpẹẹrẹ àwọn òbí ni ó sì le bọ́ wọn dáradára. Ọmọ tí ó jẹ́ Kristẹni ni a gbọ́dọ̀ mú dàgbà pẹ̀lú èrò ọkàn pé àwọn ni èso rere àti ọmọ ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Pẹ̀lú ẹ̀bẹ̀ tàbí ìfipámú, ìbáwí ọmọ ṣe kókó.
lessons.akosori: Owe 29: 17 “Tọ́ ọmọ rẹ, yóò sì fun ọ ni ìsinmi; yóò sì fi inú-dídùn sí ọ ní ọkàn”.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to study the Biblical idea of Child Discipline and its rewards and<li>to examine the effects of lack of discipline [overindulgence] on the Child and the society
lessons.introduction: Child discipline may be described as the boundary set, or structure put in place by parents to effectively help their children fit into the real world with happiness. In our text today, Prophet Eli was inoffensive to his children and overindulged them in their sinful manners. The Bible enjoins parents to train their children to obey ethical rules, sometimes using punishment to correct disobedience [Prov. 19: 18; Prov. 13: 24; Prov. 22: 15]. In today's study, we shall examine the benefits of child discipline and consequences of lack of it through overindulgence on the child and the society.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is Child discipline and its effects in the following passages? Genesis 39: 6-10; Jeremiah 35: 3-7; Daniel 1: 8; Daniel 1:11-15; Hebrews 11: 24-25. <li> Read 1 Samuel 2: 13-17; 1 Samuel 2:22-24. Was it appropriate for Eli to have waited until when he became old, and his children became adults before trying to correct them? Discuss. <li> Discuss apparently inoffensive adult routines that may harm a child's future if exposed to them.<li> How can we enforce child discipline seamlessly at home, in the Church and in the Society? Deut. 6: 6-7; Prov 29: 17; Eph 6: 4, Col 3:21.
lessons.conclusion: We often forget that child discipline really means to teach, not always to punish them. Children are the Lord's lambs and parental examples will go a long way in feeding them. The Christian child should be raised with the mind-set that these are good seeds and children of the Kingdom.
lessons.foodForThougth: Persuasion or Coercion, Child discipline is crucial.
lessons.memoryVerse: Prov 29: 17 “Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ìbáwí Ọmọ (2)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kọ́ nípa ète àtòkèwá tí ó wà lẹ́yìn ìnira Kristẹni<li>láti kọ́ bí a ṣe lè lo ìfiduni láti gbin ìwà-rere ìbáwí sínú àwọn ọmọ wa.
lessons.ifaara: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọkùnrin, gbajú-gbajà Oniw Ìjọ Elétò nì, Ọ̀mọ̀wé W. E. Sangster lọ sí ìpàgọ́ kan. Kò ní owó lọ́wọ́ mọ́, ó sì fi ìwé ìránṣẹ́ sí bàbá rẹ̀ went to a, ó ń béèrè owó s<li> Kò rí èsì gbà. Àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ fi í ṣe ẹlẹ́yà pé bàbá rẹ̀ kò fẹ́ràn rẹ̀. Sangster wi pé, “Mo mọ̀ pé ẹni tí a fẹ́ràn ni mí, ó kàn jẹ́ pé n kò mọ ìdí tí bàbá mi kò fi fèsì. Nígbà tí mo bá délé, ó dá mi lójú pé yóò fúnra rẹ̀ sọ fún m<li>” Nínú ilé, bàbá rẹ̀ wí pé òun fẹ́ fi owó ránṣẹ́ sí í ṣùgbọ́n òun rò pé ọmọ òun kò bìkítà fún ìtọ́jú owó bí ó ti yẹ, ó sì ní láti mọ iyì rẹ̀. Nínú ibi tí a kà nínú Bíbélì, a rí bí Ọlọ́run ti dárí àwọn ọmọ Israeli la ìnira kọjá tí ó sì kọ̀ fún wọn láti gba through ọ̀nà ìrọ̀rùn. Ibere wa yóò là ojú wa si bí a ti lè ṣe àmúlò irú ìbáwí kan náà láti tọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Láti inú ìtàn ìfáàrà, báwo ni o ti lè ṣàlàyé ìbáwí nípa ìfiduni?<li>Kín ni ìdí tí Ọlọ́run fi mú àwọn ènìyàn Rẹ̀ gba ọ̀nà tí ó jìn tí ó sì nira? Eks 13: 17; Num 14: 1-4; Deut. 8: 2-3.<li>Ka Heb 12: 5-11 kí o sì ṣàlàyé ohun tí ó ṣègbè lẹ́yìn ìbáwí àtòkèwá òbí.<li>Ní àtúpalẹ̀ tìrẹ, dábàá àwọn ọ̀nà tí a fi lè bá ọmọ wí nípasẹ̀ ìfidun<li>
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí òǹfà irin láàrin oko irin, àwọn ọmọ wà nínú ewu, wọ́n sì lè mú àwọn ohun tí à ń ṣe ní àyíká wọn. Ojúṣe àwọn òbí ni láti fi àwọn ohun kan/ẹgbẹ́ du àwọn ọmọ wọn láti dáàbò bò wọ́n lọ́wọ́ ipa búburú. Wọ́n lè má tètè gbà pé kí a fi ohun tí wọ́n gbàgbọ́ pé apá wa ká dù wọn, ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí ó bá yá, yóò yé wọn, wọn á sì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ wá fún fífún wọn ní ìbáwí ní àkókò tí ó tọ́.
lessons.funIronu: Ifiduni ìgbà díẹ̀ máa ń mú ìmoore tí ó wà títí wá
lessons.akosori: Deut 8: 3 “O si rẹ̀ ọ silẹ, o si fi ebi pa ọ, o si fi manna bọ́ ọ, ti iwọ kò mọ̀, bẹ̃ni awọn baba rẹ kò mọ̀; ki o le mu ọ mọ̀ pe enia kò ti ipa onjẹ nikan wà lãye, bikoṣe nipa gbogbo ọ̀rọ ti o ti ẹnu OLUWA jade li enia wà lãye.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to study the divine intention behind Christian hardships <li>to learn how we may apply denials to inculcate the virtue of discipline in our children
lessons.introduction: As a boy, the famous Methodist Preacher, Dr W. E. Sangster went to a camp. He soon ran out of money, sent a telegram to his father asking for more. He got no reply. His friends mocked him that his father didn't love him. Sangster said, “I know I am loved, only I don't know why my father did not reply. When I get home, I'm sure he will tell me himself”. At home, his father said he was tempted to send more money, but felt his son was not treating money with sufficient care and needed to learn its value. In our Bible text, we can see how God guides the Israelites' paths through hardship and denying them of pleasure route. Our study Guides will open our eyes to how we may apply same discipline to guide our children.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> From the story in the introduction, how would you explain discipline through denials? <li> Why did God lead His people along a long arduous route? Exod 13: 17; Num 14: 1-4; Deut. 8: 2-3.<li> Read Hebrews 12: 5-11 and explain the reasons behind divine parental discipline.<li> In your own analysis, suggest ways to discipline our children through denials.
lessons.conclusion: Like magnet in a field of iron, children are so vulnerable and could readily pick up activities around them. Parents are required to deny the children certain things/associations as insulation against bad influences. They may not immediately agree that they should be denied what they believe we can afford, but with time, they will understand and thank us for applying timely discipline at the right time.
lessons.foodForThougth: Momentary denials can breed enduring appreciations.
lessons.memoryVerse: Deut 8: 3 “He humbled you, causing you to hunger, and then feeding you with manna to teach you that man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol><li>Láti kọ́ ohun tí Bíbélì wí lórí ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí, àti<li>Láti ṣàfihàn iyì tí Ọlọ́run fi fún ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí
lessons.ifaara: Orí ọ̀rọ̀ wa lónìí dabi ìtẹ̀síwájú ẹ̀kọ́ kejì ti ọjọ́ kejìlá oṣù kìn-ín-ní ọdún 2025 tí ó ṣàlàyé ìtumọ̀ tí Bíbélì fún ọmọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn tí ó wà láàrin ìgbà ìlóyún (ọmọ inú) àti ìgbà ìbàlágà. Síwájú síi, ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí wà ní àárín ipele ìlóyún (nínú ilé ọmọ) àti bíbí ní àkókò ìbímọ. Àwọn ibi kíkà wá gbóríyìn fún iyì tí Ọlọ́run fi sórí ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí ó sì fi ìdánilójú síi pé ohun gbogbo tí Ọlọ́run dá ni ó dára tí ó sì rẹwà, àti ènìyàn ní àwòrán ara ati jíjọ Rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li> Láti inú àwọn ibi kíkà wọ̀nyí, jíròrò lórí ojú tí ìwé mímọ́ fi wo ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí.  Ps. 22: 9; Ps. 71: 6; Job 31:15.<li> Nínú ìmọ́lẹ̀ Gen 25: 21-23; Ps 127:3; Jer. 1: 5; Gal. 1: 15 jíròrò lórí bí Ọlọ́run  ti ka ọlẹ̀ sí iyebíye tó.<li>  Kín ni ìwòye rẹ lórí ọlẹ̀ (oyún)? Ṣé ẹ̀jẹ̀ lásán ni àbí ènìyàn?<li>  Jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà tí a fi ń ṣe àṣìlò àwọn ọmọ tí a kò tí ì bí ní ìran wa pàápàá láti  ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn aboyún.
lessons.ipari: Olúwa Olódùmarè fún ọmọ tí a kò tí ì bí níIsepàtàkì tí ó ga. Nítorí náà a gbọ́dọ̀ kíyèsára bí a ó ti tọ́jú wọn; a kò gbọdọ̀ bù iyì wọn kù kí a má báà rí ìbínú Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ǹjẹ́ mò ń bá iyì ẹ̀dá Ọlọ́run jẹ́?
lessons.akosori: Gen 25: 23: “OLUWA si wi fun u pe, orilẹ-ède meji ni mbẹ ninu rẹ, irú enia meji ni yio yà lati inu rẹ: awọn enia kan yio le jù ekeji lọ; ẹgbọ́n ni yio si ma sìn aburo."
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to study the concept of an unborn child in biblical context and<li>to expound the value God places on an unborn child.
lessons.introduction: Our topic today is like a continuation of study 2 of January 12 ,2025 that explained the biblical meaning of a child as a human being between the stages of conception (Baby in the womb) and puberty. Moreover, an unborn child is a human being between the stages of conception (in the womb) and delivery at birth. Our texts extol the values God placed on the unborn child and clarify that everything God created was good and beautiful, including man in His own image and in His likeness.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> From the following passages, discuss scriptural view of the unborn child? Ps 22: 9; Ps. 71: 6; Job 31:15.<li> In the light of Gen 25: 21-23; Psalm 127: 3; Jer. 1: 5; Gal. 1: 15 discuss the value God placed on the unborn child.<li> What is your view of the foetus? Is it ordinary blood or a human? <li> Discuss ways through which unborn children are being abused in our generation especially by pregnant women.
lessons.conclusion: : The Lord Almighty places great importance on every unborn child (foetus). Therefore, we must be careful of how we care for them; never to disvalue them in other to avoid the wrath of God.
lessons.foodForThougth: Am I disvaluing God's creation?
lessons.memoryVerse: Gen 25: 23: “And the LORD said to her: "Two nations are in your womb, Two peoples shall be separated from your body; One people shall be stronger than the other, And the older shall serve the younger."

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí 2
lessons.oriOro: Ìlòkulò ọmọ tí a kò ti i bí: Oyún Ṣíṣẹ́
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>lati jíròrò nípa oyún ṣíṣẹ́ bí o ti níí ṣe pẹ̀lú àṣà, ọ̀làjú àti àwọn okùnfà mìíràn, àti<li>láti ṣe àyẹ̀wò lórí ìṣẹ́yún lójú ìwòye ti Bíbélì gẹ́gẹ́bí onígbàgbọ́ nínú Kristi
lessons.ifaara: Orí ọ̀rọ̀ wa lónìí jẹ́ ìtẹ̀síwájú ẹ̀kọ́ ọjọ́ ìsinmi tó kọjá; pé ọmọ ti a kò bí ni ọmọ inú oyún (ọmọ tí ń dàgbà) láarin àkókò tí ó wà nínú oyún (nínú inú) àti àkókò tí a bí <li> Oyún ṣíṣẹ́ túmọ̀ sí fífi òpin sí oyún nípa pípa ọmọ inú oyún tàbí ẹyin inú oyún (ọmọ tí ó ń dàgbà nínú oyún). Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, kò sí ìtọ́kasí Bibeli pàtó nípa oyún ṣíṣẹ́; ṣùgbọ́n Bíbélì ṣàpèjúwe dídá ènìyàn “ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run” (Gen. 1: 27); tí a sì dá a dáradára (Ps.139: 13-14) Yàtọ̀ sí ìyẹn, àwọn ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ wa lónìí fi hàn pé Ọlọ́run fi ààlà, (“ohun ti a ni lati ṣe” àti “ohun tí a kò gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe”) lélẹ̀ fún eniyan tí Ó dá. Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn òfin ni pe a kó gbọ́dọ̀ ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ sílẹ̀ (Eks. 20: 13; Deut. 5: 17; Gen. 37: 22).  Ẹkọ́ yìí yóò ràn wá lọ́wọ́ láti ní òye àti láti mọ àwọn òfin Ọlọ́run, ní pàtàkì ní ti ìlòkulò ọmọ tí a kò tíì bí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé òye tí o ní nípa “oyún ṣíṣẹ́ àti oyún” ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìfáàrà pẹ̀lú ìtọ́kasí Gen. 37: 22b àti Eks. 20:13.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àṣà ìbílẹ̀ rẹ, jíròrò àwọn ìdí kan tí a fi ń ṣẹ oyún àti èrò rẹ nípa fífi àyè gba oyún ṣíṣẹ́ nítori ìlera (ìlera ìyá) àti nítorí ìfipábánilòpọ̀. Àwọn ìdí náà tọ́nà bi?<li>Ta ni ó yẹ láti dálẹ́bi ìṣẹ́yún; ọmọ ínú oyún tàbí aláboyún?<li>Nípa iwọ́ṣọ ti kò bójú mu àti ìbákẹ́gbẹ́pọ̀ tí kò tọ́, ní ìwòye Bíbélì, jíròrò àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ àti ìmọ̀ràn tí a gbọ́dọ̀ tẹ̀lé gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni láti yẹra fún oyún tí a kò fẹ́ ní pàtàkì nípasẹ̀ ìfipábánilòpọ̀. 1Ko 5: 9; 1Ko 6: 14-17.
lessons.ipari: Bí a ṣe ń mú ẹ̀kọ́ yìí wá sí ìdánudúró, ṣé o mọ̀ pé ohun ti àwọn ènìyàn kan ń bàjẹ́ nípasẹ̀ oyún ṣíṣẹ́ ni àwọn kan bíi Hannah ń wá kiri? Ó ṣeni láàánú pé, ohun tí àwọn kan pè ní “ẹ̀jẹ̀ lásán” ni yóò di èniyàn. Báwo ni ìbá ti rí kání pé a ṣẹ́ oyún Isaaki, Debora, Esteri, Samueli, Dafidi àti àwọn ènìyàn ńlá mìíràn nínú Bibeli?... Nítorí náà, nígbà tí a bá ṣẹ́ oyún, àyànmọ́ yóò parun. Bí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́, A gbọ́dọ̀ gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti dènà oyún tí a kò fẹ́, pàápàá àwọn ìgbèsẹ́ láti dènà ìfipábánilòpọ̀.
lessons.funIronu: Kín ni o rò pé ọmọ ti o ṣẹ́yún rẹ yẹn ì bá ti dà…?
lessons.akosori: Gen 37: 22b: “Má ṣe ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ sílẹ̀.”
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.topic: Abuse of the unborn child: Abortion
lessons.aims: <li>to discuss the concept of abortion in the context of practices based on culture, exposure and circumstances and<li>to evaluate the issue of abortion from biblical point of view as believers in Christ.
lessons.introduction: Our topic today is a continuation of last Sunday's study; that the unborn child is the foetus (developing child) between the stages of conception (in the womb) and delivery. Abortion simply means the termination of a pregnancy by destroying the embryo or foetus (developing child in the womb). Though, there is no explicit biblical reference regarding abortion; but the Bible describes the creation of humans “in the image of God” (Gen. 1: 27); and beautifully created (Psa 139: 13-14) Moreover, our texts today reveal that God sets a bound, (“do” and “don'ts”) for the man He created. One of the rules is that we must not shed blood (Ex. 20: 13; Deut. 5: 17; Gen. 37: 22).  This study will help us to understand and to be conscious of the commandments of God, particularly as it regards the abuse of the unborn child.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain what you understand by “abortion and foetus” in the context of the introduction with references to Gen 37: 22b and Exod 20:13.<li> According to your cultural background, discuss some reasons why pregnancies are terminated and your opinion about permitting abortion on health ground (health of the mother) and because of rape? Are they justifiable?<li> Who is to be blamed in abortion; the baby in the womb or the abortionist?  <li> Considering indecent dressings and unholy relationships, discuss biblical steps and godly advice we must take as Christians to avoid unwanted pregnancies especially through rape. 1 Cor 5: 9; 2 Cor 6: 14-17.
