lessons.conclusion: As we round up this study, do you know that what some people are destroying through abortion is what some people like Hannah are desperately looking for? Unfortunately, what some people call “ordinary blood” eventually develops to human being. Imagine if the foetus of Isaac, Deborah, Esther, Samuel, David and other great people in the Bible were aborted?... Therefore, when pregnancies are terminated, destinies are destroyed. However, preventive measures must be taken against unwanted pregnancy especially measures against being a victim of rape.
lessons.foodForThougth: What could that aborted child have become…..?
lessons.memoryVerse: Gen. 37: 22b: “Shed no blood…”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lílo ọmọdé ní ìlòkulò (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kọ ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀,<li>láti ṣàlàyé ohun ti Ọlọ́run sọ lórí ìlòkulò àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀, àti<li>láti ní òye pàtàkì ìbáṣepọ̀ rere pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilé wa.
lessons.ifaara: Ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ nínú ilé jẹ́ ẹnìkan (ọkùnrin tàbí obìnrin) tí ó ń ṣiṣẹ tàbí ń gbé pẹ̀lú ẹbí fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ àwọn iṣẹ́ inú ilé wa. Àwọn kan wà nínú àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ yìí tí òbí wọn jẹ́ tálákà, nígbà tí àwọn mìíràn nínú wọn kò ní òbí rárá, tí wọ́n sì nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́. Ẹsẹ Bíbélì wa lónìí jẹ́ kí á mọ èrò Ọlọ́run lórí àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ínú ilé wa wọ̀nyí. Ọwọ́ wo ni a fi mú àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ wọ̀nyí, ìhà wo ló yẹ kí Kristẹni kọ sí ìbágbépọ̀ pẹ̀lú wọn, kí sì ni àṣẹ Ọlọ́run nípa wọn? Ìwọ̀nyí àti àwọn àlàyé mìíràn tí ó jọ mọ́ ọn ni a óò máa ṣàlàyé nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ta ni ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ inú ilé? Kí sì ni ìdí tí ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn fi ń ṣe irú iṣẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀?<li>Nínú Ọ̀rọ̀ Deut. 15: 7-10; báwo ni àwọn kan ṣe ń lo ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ wọn ní ìlòkulò tàbí báwo a ṣe ń ṣe sí wọn? Ẹ̀kọ́ wo ni o rí kọ́ láti inú ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín Námánì, ìyàwó rẹ̀ àti ìránṣẹ́bìnrin náà nínú 2Oba 5: 2-5.<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Lef 19: 13; Deut. 24: 14-15; 1 Tim 5: 18, báwo ló ṣe yẹ ká máa ṣe sí àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilé wa gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni?<li>Jíròrò bí Ọlọ́run ṣe korò ojú sí ìlòkulò àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilé wa. Eks 21: 20; Jer 22: 13; Jak 5: 4
lessons.ipari: Àwọn ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilé kì í ṣe ẹni ifibú; Àwọn òbí kan ló bí wọn bi a ṣe bí àwọn olúwa tàbí àwọn olówó wọn; ìgbé ayé tó dára kì í ṣe èèwọ̀ fún wọn, a kò sì gbọdọ̀ rí wọn bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni, dípò bẹ́ẹ̀, a gbọ́dọ̀ ní ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú wọn kí a sì yẹ́ wọn sí, kí a má baà rí ìdájọ́ Ọlọ́run.
lessons.funIronu: Ránti pé ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilé rẹ jẹ́ ọmọ ẹlòmíràn!
lessons.akosori: Deuteronomi 24: 14 BM - “Iwọ kò gbọ́dọ̀ ni alágbàṣe kan lara ti iṣe talakà ati alaini, iba ṣe ninu awọn arakunrin rẹ, tabi ninu awọn alejò rẹ ti mbẹ ni ilẹ rẹ nínú ibode rẹ”.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to study the concept of house-help, <li>to expound God's stand on the abuse of house-helps and <li>to open our eyes to the importance of godly relationship with our house-helps.
lessons.introduction: A house-help is someone (male or female) that is employed or living with a family for the primary duty of assisting in our domestic activities. Some house-helps have parents or parents that are so impoverished, while some of them are totally orphans who need help. Our Bible text today reveals to us the stand of God on these helpers in our house. How do we treat these helpers, what is the Christian standard in relating with them and what is God's command concerning them? These and other pertaining points shall be expounded in our study guide today.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Who is a house-help? And why do many of them engage in such work?<li> In the Context of Deut 15: 7-10; how do some people abuse or treat their house-helps? What lessons do you learn from the relationship between Naaman, his wife and the maid in 2 Kings 5: 2-5. <li> According to Lev 19: 13; Deut 24: 14-15; 1Tim 5: 18, how are we expected to treat our house-helps as Christians?<li> Discuss God's displeasure over maltreatment of house-helps. Exo 21: 20; Jer 22: 13; Jas 5: 4
lessons.conclusion: House-helps are not accursed human beings; they are born by parents like their masters or mistresses; they are not taboos to good livelihood and we as Christians should never treat them like that, instead, we must relate with them with social respect in other to avoid God's judgment.
lessons.foodForThougth: Remember! Your house-help is another person's child!
lessons.memoryVerse: Deut 24: 14 “Thou shalt not oppress a hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brethren, or of thy sojourners that are in thy land within thy gates.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lílo ọmọde nilokulò (2)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti pe àkíyèsi wa sí bí ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà-àìtọ́ ṣe gbòde kan,<li>láti ṣe ìwádìí okùnfà ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àitọ́ lóde òní<li>jíròrò àwọn ọ̀nà láti dènà rẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: Ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́na àìtọ́ ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú fífi ipá bánilòpọ̀ (tí à ń pè ní ìfipábánilòpọ̀). Nígbà mìíràn, àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ni à ń tànjẹ pẹ̀lú máàkì ìdánwò, ìpèse iṣẹ́, ìrànlọ́wọ́ owó, àwọn àwòrán, àwọn ìwé ìròyìn, àwọn fíìmù pẹ̀lú àwòrán oníhòòhò àti àwọn ìwúrí mìíràn. Ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà, tí agbára ẹnìkan bá borí èkejì, á lo àǹfààní agbára rẹ̀. Ní àwọn ọ̀nà mìíràn, wọn á fi ìjákulẹ̀ halẹ̀ mọ́ àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé láti lè bá wọn lòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́. Ẹ̀kọ́ wa ti òní ṣàfihàn bi Amnoni ṣe tan ìbátan rẹ̀ jẹ.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́, kí o sì mẹ́nu ba àwọn ohun tí ó lè ṣe okùnfà rẹ̀ ní àwùjọ wa.<li>Jíròrò lórí àpẹẹrẹ ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́ láti inú àwọn àyọkà wọ̀nyí: Gen. 34: 1-2; 2 Sam. 13: 11-14.<li>Sọ láti inú àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ti òde òní, báwo ni wọn ṣe ń ní ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé, àwọn ìránṣẹ́bìnrin nínú ilé, àwọn aláṣẹ ní ibi iṣẹ́ àti pàápàá àwọn ìbátan.<li>Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ òde òní àti àwọn ìdájọ́ lóri àwọn ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́ àti gẹ́gẹ́ bí 2 Sam. 13: 28-29 ti wí; Kín ni àwọn àtubọ̀tán fún àwọn tó lọ́wọ́ nínú ibalòpọ lọ́nà àìtọ́?
lessons.ipari: Nígbà míì, ohun ti áwọn èèyàn ń pè ní “ìfẹ́” máa ń jẹ́ “ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́”, tí wọ́n bá sì ti tẹ́ ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́rùn, wọ́n á sá kúrò. Nítorí náà, a gbọ́dọ̀ pa ọkàn wa mọ́ kúrò lọ́wọ́ ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ àti ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́. Àwọn Kristẹni ni a nírètí láti gbé ìgbé ayé tí ó tọ́ kí wọn má ṣe ní ìbálòpọ̀ lọ́nà àìtọ́ dípò bẹ́ẹ̀, kí a ta kò ó nínú ọ̀rọ̀, ìwà àti àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ wa.
lessons.funIronu: Ṣe ìfẹ́ tàbí ìfẹ́kúfẹ́ẹ̀ ni ó ń darí mi?
lessons.akosori: Gen 34: 2 “Nigbati Ṣekemu, ọmọ Hamori, ara Hiffi, ọmọ alade ilu na ri i, o mú u, o si wọle tọ̀ ọ, o si bà a jẹ́”.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to create awareness regarding the ugly trend of sexual abuse,<li>to torchlight the various contemporary templates for sexual abuses and <li>discuss means of guarding against it.
lessons.introduction: Sexual abuse has to do with having carnal knowledge of someone by force (otherwise called rape). Occasionally, young people are lured with marks in examination, job appointments, financial assistance, pictures, magazines, movies including pornographic contents and other incentives. At other times, one person overpowers the other, taking advantage of his or her strength. In other circumstances, students are threatened with failure in exams in other to abuse them sexually. Our text today reveals how Amnon manipulated his cousin.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What is sexual abuse and mention some factors that can lead to it in our society. <li> Discuss examples of sexual abuse from the following passages: Gen. 34: 1-2; 2 Sam. 13: 11-14.<li> Narrate from contemporary incidences how students, housemaids, subordinates in workplace and even relations are abused sexually.<li> In line with contemporary stories and judgments on sexual abuses and according to 2 Sam. 13: 28-29; what are the consequences for culprits of sexual abuse?
lessons.conclusion: At times, what people call “love” is actually “lust” and once they satisfy their lust, they get out of the way. We must therefore guard our hearts against lust and sexual abuse. Christians are expected to live a decent life and not engage in any form of sexual abuse instead, discourage it in our speech, manners and relationships.
lessons.foodForThougth: Am I driven by love or lust?
lessons.memoryVerse: Gen 34: 2 “And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her and lay with her, and violated her”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lílo ọmọdé Nílòkulò (3)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàfihàn fifi ìbálòpọ̀ àwọn ọmọde pa owó lòdì sí òfin<li>láti kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nipa àwọn okùnfà fún ìwà ti kò bófin mu yìí, àti<li>láti jíròrò lórí pàtàki ààbò fún àwọn ọmọde kúró lọ́wọ́ àwọn tí ó ń lo ọmọdé ní ìlòkulò ní ìran wa.
lessons.ifaara: Ọmọ tí wọ́n ń lo fún iṣòwò ìbálòpọ̀ jẹ́ ọmọ tí wọ́n tàn láti kópa, tàbí tí ó gbà láti lọ́wọ́ sí, tàbí tí wọ́n fún ní owó, aṣọ, ilé, ẹrù tàbí ìtọ́jú láti le bá a ni ìbálòpọ̀. Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé òtítọ́ ni pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ló ń gbé irúfẹ́ ìgbé ayé yìí nítorí ìnira tàbí àwọn ìdojúkọ mìíràn; ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ló bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbé ìgbé aye yìí nítorí pé ko si ìtọ́jú tó péye lati ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn òbí, bí ó ti wù kí ó rí, Ọlọ́run kórìíra irú ìwà yìí, ó sì léwu fún ẹ̀mí ọmọdé náà. Ìbéèrè náà ni pé, àkókò wo ni wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbé irúfẹ́ ìgbé ayé yìí? Ó yẹ kí èyí jẹ wá lógún kí ó sì rú ìtara sókè nínú wa láti dáàbò bo àwọn ọmọdé wa.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni òye rẹ nípa fífi ìbálòpọ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ṣòwò?<li>Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ inú Lev. 19: 29, kín ni o lè sọ pé ó jẹ́ okùnfà fífi ìbálòpọ̀ àwọn ọmọdé ṣòwò ní ìran wa?<li>Jíròrò lórí ohun tí Ọlọ́run sọ nípa ìwà yìí ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ wọ̀nyí: Lef. 19: 29; Deut. 23: 17-18<li>Báwo la ṣe lè gba àwọn ọmọ wa lọ́wọ́ éwu yìí? Jíròrò nínú ọ̀rọ̀ inú Owe 19:18.
lessons.ipari: Àwọn òbí kan ló bí àwọn ọmọdébìnrin tí wọ́n ń lò nílòkulò yìí, títí kan àwọn òbí tó jẹ́ Kristẹn<li> Nítorí náà, ẹ jẹ́ kí a fi àyè sílẹ̀ láti kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wa ní ìwà-bí-Ọlọ́run kí a sì tún fi iṣẹ́ tó dára àti ìgbé ayé rere lé wọn lọ́wọ́ kí a ba lè gbà wọ́n lọ́wọ́ àwọn afàwọ̀rajà ènìyàn ní ayé òde òní.
lessons.funIronu: Kọ́ àwọn ọmọbìnrin rẹ ní ọ̀nà Ọlọ́run kí wọ́n lè yẹra fún iṣẹ́ tí kò bójúmu.
lessons.akosori: Lev 19: 29 “Máṣe bà ọmọ rẹ obinrin jẹ́, lati mu u ṣe àgbere; ki ilẹ na ki o má ba di ilẹ àgbere, ati ki ilẹ na má ba kún fun ìwabuburu.”
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to expose Commercial Sexual Exploitation of Children (CSEC) as an illegal trade <li>to study the factors for this illegality and<li>to discuss the importance of protecting children against human scavengers of children in our generation.
lessons.introduction: A commercial sexually exploited child is one who is lured to engage, agrees to engage in, or offers to engage in sexual conduct in exchange for money, clothing, shelter, goods or care. Whereas it is true that many went into this lifestyle as a result of hardship or other challenges; many resorted into this lifestyle because of poor parental care; whichever way, this practice is abhorrence to God and dangerous to the life of the child. The question now is at what point in their lives did they delve into this lifestyle? This should raise worry and curiosity in our hearts and a passion to safeguard our young children.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by commercial sexual exploitation of children?<li> In the context of Lev 19: 29, what can you say are the reasons behind the act of commercial exploitation of children in our generation? <li> Discuss God's injunction over this attitude in the light of the following scriptures: Lev. 19: 29; Deut. 23: 17-18<li> How can we save our children from this dangerous situation? Discuss in the context of Prov 19:18.
lessons.conclusion: The little girls being sexually exploited are people's children, including Christian parents. Therefore, let us devote more time in training our children in godly manners and also inculcate the habit of dignified profession and livelihood in other to save them from human scavengers in our contemporary world.
lessons.foodForThougth: Disciple your daughters in godly manner to avoid unholy profession.
lessons.memoryVerse: Lev. 19: 29 “'Do not prostitute your daughter, to cause her to be a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry, and the land become full of wickedness”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lilò ọmọdé nilokulò (4)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàlàyé ìtumọ̀ fífi ọmọ ṣòwò ẹrú,<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ohun tí ó lè ṣe okùnfà fífí ọmọ ṣòwò ẹrú<li>ìdí tí àwọn Kristẹni kò gbọdọ̀ fi lọ́wọ́ nínú irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: Ìwà fifi ọmọde ṣòwò ẹrú wáyé nígbà tí a bá tan àwọn ọmọdé àti àwọn ọ̀dọ́ jẹ, tí a fi ipá tàbí ète mú wọn lọ kúrò ní ilé wọn, tí a sì kó wọn jáde lati lò wọ́n ní ìlòkulò, tí a fi ipá mú wọn láti ṣiṣẹ́ fún àǹfààní olúwa wọn, tàbí láti tà wọn. Èyí wáyé ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà, fún èrè àìtọ́. Jósẹ́fù ọmọ Jákọ́bù jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ ìwà búburú fífi ọmọdé ṣòwò ẹrú. Ó ṣeni láàánú pé, fífi ọmọ ṣòwò ẹrú ṣi wà ní ìran wa, lára ​​àwọn tó ń ṣe iṣẹ́ búburú yìí náà sì wà nínu ìjọ. Kí ló ṣe okùnfà èyí, kín ni ìwòye Bibeli lórí èyí? Ẹ jẹ́ kí a tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìlànà ẹ̀kọ́ wa fún ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àlàyé.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni òye rẹ nípa "fifi ọmọde ṣòwò ẹrú"?<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Gen. 37: 25-28: Sọ ìdí tí àwọn arákùnrin Jósẹ́fù fi tà á, kí o sì ṣalaye rẹ̀.<li>Jíròrò ìdí tí àwọn èniyàn fi ń lọ́wọ́ nínú fífi àwọn ọmọdé ṣòwò lónìí. Ǹjẹ́ àwọn ìdí náà jẹ́ èyí tí ó tọ́ bi?<li>Kín ni ojú ìwòye àti ìdájọ́ Ọlọ́run nípa fifi àwọn ọmọdé ṣòwò? Eks 21: 16; Matt. 18: 5-6.
lessons.ipari: Gbogbo ọmọ ti a bí sí ayé yìí ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí òmìnira. Kò sí ẹni tí a bí láti jẹ́ ẹrú ẹlòmíràn. Fífi ọmọdé ṣòwò ẹrú ń fa ìbínú Ọlọ́run, àwọn Kristẹni sì gbọdọ̀ máa wàásù ki wọn sì máa ta kò ó nígbà gbogbo.
lessons.funIronu: Okòwò tòótọ́ ṣe pàtàkì!
lessons.akosori: Eks 21: 16 “Ẹnikẹ́ni tí ó bá jí eniyan gbé, tí ó sì tà á, tabi tí wọ́n bá rí i lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀, pípa ni a óo pa á.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to explain the meaning of child-trafficking, <li>to discuss factors that can lead to child trafficking and <li>why believers must not participate in such act.
lessons.introduction: Child-trafficking is when children and young people are tricked, forced or persuaded to leave their homes and are moved out and exploited, forced to work for the advantage of the master, or sold. In most cases, it is done for fraudulent benefits. Joseph the son of Jacob is a typical illustration of the evil of child-trafficking. Sadly, there are still cases of child trafficking even in our generation, and some of the perpetrators are in church. What are the factors for this and the biblical standpoint? Let us continue in our study guides for more exposition.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by “child trafficking”? <li> According to Gen. 37: 25-28: Identify and discuss reasons why Joseph's brothers sold him.<li> Discuss reasons why people get involved in child trafficking today. Are those reasons justifiable?<li> What is God's view and verdict about child trafficking? Exod 21: 16; Matt. 18: 5-6.
lessons.conclusion: Every child born into this world has the right to liberty. Nobody was born to be the slave of another. Child trafficking is incurring the wrath of God and Christians should continuously preach and act against it.
lessons.foodForThougth: Legit business counts!
lessons.memoryVerse: Exod 21: 16 "He who kidnaps a man and sells him, or if he is found in his hand, shall surely be put to death".

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lilò ọmọdé nilokulò (5)
lessons.erongba: <li>lati ṣe iwadi Ìwà jíju Ọmọ Sókè-sódò<li>lati ṣàfihàn ìdájọ́ Ọlọ́run lórí irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀, àti<li>láti jíròrò lórí àwọn ọ̀nà ti a le gba lati dẹ́kun irú àwọn iṣé bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àwùjọ wa.
lessons.ifaara: Ìwà jíju ọmọ sókè-sódò jẹ́ ìpalára fún ọpọlọ, èyí tí ó maa ń wáyé nígbà tí a bá fi ìbínú mi ọmọdé tàbí ọmọ kékeré jìgìjìgì. Ìwà jíju ọmọ sókè-sódò máa ń wáyé nígbà tí òbí tàbí alábòójútó kan ń mì ọmọ tàbí ọmọ kékeré nítorí ìrunú tàbí ìbínú - nítorí ọmọ náà kò dákẹ́ ẹkún sísun. Èyí lè fa ìpalára fún ọpọlọ tàbí fa ikú ọmọ náà. Ọlọ́run lòdì sí ìlòkulò ọmọde lọ́nàkọnà. Ẹ̀kọ́ yìí yóò fi ìwà búburú yìí hàn, yóò sì pe gbogbo Kristẹni tòótọ́ láti yàgò fún irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni òye rẹ nípa "Ìwà mimi Ọmọ jìgìjìgì"tàbí jíju ọmọ sókè-sódò? Sọ ìriírí kan ti o ti rí.<li>Àwọn ọ̀nà mìíràn wo ni wọ́n fi ń lo àwọn ọmọdé nilokulo èyí tí o kà sí ìwà búburú?<li>Láti inú àwọn ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ wọ̀nyí, jíròrò lórí àṣẹ Ọlọ́run àti ìwòye Ìwé Mímọ́ nípa àwọn ọmọdé: Gen 21: 14-19; Ps.127: 3; Efe. 6:4.<li>Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn òbí tó dá wà nínú ìran wa yìí tí wọ́n ń fìyà jẹ àwọn ọmọ wọn nítorí ìpòrúurù. Báwo ni o ṣe lè gba irú àwọn òbí bẹ́ẹ̀ nímọ̀ràn nínú ọ̀rọ̀ inú Ps.127: 3?
lessons.ipari: Nígbà tí Bíbélì sọ pé a dá ènìyàn ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run, kìí ṣe pé àwọn ọmọ jẹ́ ara ìṣẹ̀dá náà nìkan, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n tún jẹ́ ogún Ọlọ́run pẹ̀lú. A gbọ́dọ̀ máa bi ara wa léèrè nígbà tí a bá ń fi ìkanra ìrunú mọ́ ọmọde; ta ni ó ṣẹ̀ mí, ọmọ tàbí ìyá tàbí bàbá? Nítorí náà, a kò gbọ́dọ̀ pa ìṣẹ̀dá àti ogún Ọlọ́run run nítorí ohunkóhun.
lessons.funIronu: Tani ó ṣẹ̀ mí, ọmọ tàbí ìyá tàbí bàbá?
lessons.akosori: Ps.127: 3 “Kiyesi i, àwọn ọmọ ni ìní Olúwa: ọmọ inú si li ère rẹ̀.”
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to study the concept of shaken baby syndrome,<li>to expose God's injunction on such attitude and<li>to discuss means of discouraging such acts in our society.
lessons.introduction: Shaken baby syndrome is a type of brain injury that happens when a baby or young child is shaken violently. Shaken baby syndrome usually occurs when a parent or caregiver severely shakes a baby or toddler due to frustration or anger - often because the child won't stop crying. This could cause brain damage or even death of the child. God is against any form of mistreatment of the child for whatever reason. This study is to expose this evil and call on every true Christian to abhor such practice.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by “shaken baby syndrome”? Narrate an experience you have witnessed.<li> Which other ways are children mishandled that you considered wicked?<li> From the following passages, discuss God's injunction and the Scriptural stand on children: Gen 21: 14-19; Psa 127: 3; Eph. 6:4.<li> There are many single parents in our generation who are maltreating their own children because of frustration. How would you advice such parents in the context of Psalm 127: 3?
lessons.conclusion: When the Bible said that human beings are created in the image of God, children are not only part of that creation, but also a heritage of God. We must always ask ourselves at the point of transferring of anger to any child; who offends me, the child or the mother or the father? Therefore, we must never under any guise destroy the creation and heritage of God.
lessons.foodForThougth: Who offends me, the child or the mother or the father?
lessons.memoryVerse: Psa 127: 3 “Behold, children are a heritage from the LORD, The fruit of the womb is a reward”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lilò ọmọdé nilokulò (6)
lessons.oriOro: Bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí Àìkàsí
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti sọ ìtumọ̀ bi Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí àìkàsí pẹ̀lú àgbékalẹ̀ bíbélì, àti<li>láti dẹ́kun bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí àìkàsí.
lessons.ifaara: Bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí àìkàsí níí ṣe pẹ̀lú ìlòkulò tàbí àìbìkítà èyí tí o wáyé nípasẹ̀ ohun èlò fún àwọn ọmọdé ní ilé iṣẹ́ ìjọba tàbí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni, àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn, àwọn ilé ìtọ́jú àti bẹ́ẹ̀bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ. Láyé òde òní, àṣà kí àwọn olùkọ́ máa fi ipá bá àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lòpọ̀ nítorí máàkì, tàbí kí wọ́n béèrè fún ìbálòpọ̀ kí wọ́n tó lè jẹ́ kí wọn ó yege, ti wá gbilẹ̀ gan-an. Pẹ̀lúpẹ̀lù, a gbọ́ àwọn ìròyin bí àwọn dókítà ṣe ń lo àǹfààní láti bá àwọn aláìsàn wọn ní ìbálòpọ̀ àti irúfẹ́ àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀. Èyí tí ó burú jùlọ ni bí àwọn òbí kan ti ń gbé ọmọ wọn sọnù si ẹ̀bá pópónà tàbí inú gọ́tà, lẹ́yìn ti wọ́n bí ọmọ náà tán. Kò yẹ kí a bá àwọn àṣà yìí lọ́wọ́ ẹni tó pé ara rẹ ní àwòrán Ọlọ́run (Efe. 5: 3).
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Kín ni òye rẹ nípa bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí àìkàsí àwọn ọmọdé gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìfáàrà wa lónìí?<li>Báwo ni o ṣe lè ṣàlàyé ìwà Hagari nínú Gen 21: 15-16 ní àfiwé pẹ̀lú ìwà ìyá Mose nínú Eks 2: 2-4. Ǹjẹ́ ìyàtọ̀ èyíkéyìí wà bí? Tí ó bá wà, ṣàlàyé ìyàtọ̀ láàárín àwọn ìtàn méjèèjì.<li>Sọ ìrírí tàbí ìtàn kan nípa bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí àìkàsí ọmọdé, kí o sì jíròrò àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ láti dẹ́kun àwọn ìwà wọ̀nyí. Matt. 5:16.<li>Láti inú àwọn ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ wọ̀nyí, kín ni Ọlọ́run sọ nípa àwọn ìlòkulò wọ̀nyí? Gen 21: 17-19; Isa 1: 16; Luke 11: 11-12; Jakobu 1: 27
lessons.ipari: Kò yẹ kí Kristẹni tó ní ẹ̀rí ọkàn tó yè kooro ó lọ́wọ́ nínú àwọn nǹkan kan tó jẹ mọ́ ìwà ọ̀daràn, bí Ilé-iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe ìlòkulò tàbí pipa àwọn ọmọdé lára. Ó ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ pé kí gbogbo àwọn tí a gbé sí ipò ó bọ̀wọ̀ fún irú ipò àti ìpè wọn láìsí ìlòkulò, àti pé a kò gbọdọ̀ kọ àwọn ọmọ tí a fi fún wa sílẹ̀ tàbí kí a pa wọ́n tì.
lessons.funIronu: Ta ni ó mọ ọjọ́ ọ̀la ọmọ tí a lò nílòkulò yẹn?
lessons.akosori: Gen 21: 18 “Dide, gbé ọmọdekunrin na, ki o si dì i mu; nitori ti emi o sọ ọ di orílẹ̀-èdè ńlá.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li>to define institutional abuse or neglect in biblical context and <li>to discourage every form of institutional abuse or neglect.
lessons.introduction: Institutional abuse or neglect has to do with the abuse or neglect which occurs in any facility for children in public or private institutions, hospitals, care homes and so on. In our days, the practice of lecturers molesting students for marks, or demanding for sex before passing them, has become very rampant. Also, we hear stories of doctors taking advantage of their patients sexually and other similar occurrences. Worst of all these are cases of mothers abandoning their children after birth on the roadside or inside gutter ways. These trends are not supposed to be associated with one who claims to be an image of God (Eph. 5: 3)
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> What do you understand by institutional abuse or neglect according to our introduction today?<li> How will you describe the attitude of Haggar in Gen 21: 15-16 compare with the attitude of Moses' mother in Exod 2: 2-4. Is there any difference? If there are, explain the difference between the two stories.<li> Mention an experience or share the story of an Institutional abuse or child neglect and discuss practical steps that can be taken to guard against these acts. Matt. 5:16.<li> From the following passages, what is God's position about these abuses? Gen 21: 17-19; Isa 1: 16; Luk 11: 11-12; James 1:27.
lessons.conclusion: A Christian with a living conscience is not expected to be associated with certain criminal activities, like the case institutional abuse or child neglect. It is very important that every person placed in position should respect such position and their calling without abusing it under any guise and children given to us must never be abandoned or neglected for danger.
lessons.foodForThougth: Who knows the future of that abused child?
lessons.memoryVerse: Gen 21: 18 "Arise, lift up the child and hold him with your hand, for I will make him a great nation."

lessons.akoko: ỌJỌ́ ÌSNIMI TÍ Ó ṢÁÁJÚ ADFẸNTI
lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: Lilò ọmọdé nilokulò (7)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ni òye nípa bíba àwọn ọmọdé lọ́kàn jẹ́,<li>láti fi wé bíba àgbàlagbà lọ́kàn jẹ́, àti<li>láti jíròrò bí a ṣe lè dẹ́kun rẹ̀.
lessons.ifaara: Ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́ ni ìhùwàsí nínú èyí tí aṣebi náà ń gàn, tẹ́ńbẹ́lú, tí ó sì ń gbin ìbẹ̀rù sínú ọmọdé tàbí àgbàlagbà. Ó tún túmọ̀ sí ṣíṣi àǹfààní lò. Àwọn ọmọ Élì ṣi àǹfààní tí Ọlọ́run fún wọn lò. Ó ṣeni láàánú pé Élì fúnra rẹ̀ kò kọbi ara sí àwọn ìwà ìkà tí àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ ń hù sí ìjọ Ọlọ́run; nítorí náà ni ó ṣe ìpalára fún ọkàn Ọlọ́run. Ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́ ni àwọn àtúbọ̀tán ni ayé yìí àti ní ayérayé. Ẹ jẹ́ kí á tẹ̀síwájú láti jíròrò lórí àwọn wọ̀nyí.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Sọ ìtumọ̀ ìbánílọ́kànjẹ́ kí o sọ àwọn àpẹẹrẹ tí ó dájú láti inú ìrírí rẹ lórí bí a ti ṣe ìpalara fún èrò inú ọkàn àwọn ọmọdé.<li>Láti inú ẹ̀kọ́ kíka lónìí (I Sam 2: 12-17), sọ irú ìwà ìlòkulò àwọn ọmọ Elì lórí àwọn ènìyàn ìjọ àti ìhà tí Ọlọ́run kọ sí i nínú I Sam 2: 30-34.<li>Sọ nípa irú ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ nínú Ise 6: 1 kí o sì fi èyí wé àwọn ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́ ti òde òní láàárín àwọn aṣáájú òṣèlú àti àwọn aráàlú. Báwo la ṣe lè fòpin sí èyí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀gá àgbà tàbí òṣìṣẹ́ Ìjọba ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ọ̀rọ̀ inú Ise 6: 2-7 àti ní pàtàkì nínú àwọn Ìjọba ìbílẹ̀?<li>Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni, ibo la ti lè rí ìrànwọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n bá bà wá lọ́kàn jẹ́? Ps. 13; Ps. 25; Ps. 37. Ka àwọn Saamu wọ̀nyí ní ilé àti nígbàkúùgbà tí o bá ní ìbànújẹ́ ní èrò ọkàn tìrẹ.
lessons.ipari: A kò gbọdọ̀ ba àwọn ènìyàn lọ́kàn jẹ́. Èyí lè já sí ìbànújẹ́. Lékè gbogbo rẹ̀, a kò gbọdọ̀ ṣi àánú Ọlọ́run lò, kí ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àwọn ọmọ Eli má baà ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa. Kàkà bẹ́ẹ̀, kí a máa bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn ẹlòmíran, irúfẹ́ ẹni yóò wu kí wọ́n jẹ́.
lessons.funIronu: Èrò ọkàn àwọn ènìyàn ṣe pàtàki sí Ọlọ́run! Má ṣe fọwọ́ kàn án!
lessons.akosori: Ise 6: 1 “Ǹjẹ́ lí ọjọ́ wọnni, nigbati iye àwọn ọmọ-ẹ̀hìn npọ̀ si i, ikùn-sinu wà ninu awọn Hellene si awọn Heberu, nitoriti a nṣe igbagbé àwọn opó wọn ni ipinfunni ojojumọ́.
lessons.theme: Children and the Kingdom of God
lessons.aims: <li> to understand the concept of emotional abuse of children,<li>to relate it with adult emotional abuses and<li>to discuss how to curtail it.
lessons.introduction: Emotional abuse is a pattern of behaviour in which the perpetrator insults, humiliates and generally instils fear in a child or an individual adult. It also means abuse of a privilege. Eli's sons abused the privilege given to them by God. Unfortunately, Eli himself did not pay attention to the emotional abuses inflicted on God's congregation by his sons; thereby wounding the heart of God. Emotional abuse has consequences both here and in eternity. Let's go on to discuss these.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define emotional abuse and give concrete examples from your experience on how children are emotionally abused.<li> From the Bible passage today (I Sam 2: 12-17), simply narrate the nature of the abuse by the sons of Eli on the congregation and God's attitude towards the actions in I Sam 2: 30-34.<li> Discuss the nature of such emotional abuse in Acts 6: 1 and compare this with our contemporary emotional abuses between our political leaders and the citizens. How can we curb this as a principal officer or Government official in the context of Acts 6: 2-7 and especially in local Government affairs?<li> As Christians, where can we find succour when emotionally abused? Psalm 13; Psalm 25; Psalm 37. Read these Psalms at home and whenever you are emotionally abused.
lessons.conclusion: We must not toil with people's emotions. This can lead to frustration. Above all, we must not take the mercies of God for granted so that the fate of Eli's sons will not be our potion, instead, let us continuously respect the personality of others irrespective of who they are.
lessons.foodForThougth: People's emotion is germane to God! Don't toil with it!
lessons.memoryVerse: Acts 6: 1 “Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, there arose a complaint against the Hebrews by the Hellenists, because their widows were neglected in the daily distribution”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: ​​Gbígba ìhìnrere bí ọmọdé (1)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàlàyé irú ìṣọ̀kan tí a ri láàrin àwọn ọmọdé,<li>láti ṣàfihàn àwọn àǹfààní ìṣọ̀kan Kristẹni dípò ìyapa, àti<li>láti fihàn pé ìyapa kò bá ẹ̀sìn Kristẹni mu.
lessons.ifaara: Ìṣọ̀kan láàrin àwọn ọmọdé túmọ̀ sí dídúró bí ọ̀kan láìbìkítà àwọn ìyàtọ̀ àti ohunkóhun. Lára àwọn ọmọ ọdún mkjọ sí mẹ́rìnlá, ìṣọ̀kan sábà máa ń wá pẹ̀lú àti láàrin ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan láàrin ọjọ́ orí náà. Ìṣọ̀kan máa ń wà nípa gbígbà àti mímọ rírì ènìyàn kọ̀ọ̀kan àti ìlọ́wọ́sí wọn. Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Kristẹni, a gbọ́dọ̀ yàgò fún ìyàpa nínú títan ìhìnrere náà kalẹ̀. Jíjẹ́ ọ̀kan gẹ́gẹ́ bi Kristẹni ń fún wa ní okun nínú ìtànkálẹ̀ ìhìnrere. Ní ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan, àwọn ènìyàn lè jẹ́ aláìlágbára kí wọn sì kùnà, ṣùgbọ́n àpapọ̀ ń mú agbára wá.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ni ọ̀rọ̀ tìrẹ, ṣàlàyé tàbí ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ ìṣọ̀kan láarin àwọn ọmọdé kí o sì sọ àwọn àpẹẹrẹ.<li>Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ inú Ps.133, kí ló yẹ kí ó jẹ́ ìṣọ̀kan láàárín àwọn Kristẹni? Fi wé 1Ko 12: 12-13, 1Ko 12:22-27; Efe 4: 1-3.<li>Sọ àwọn àǹfààní tí ìjọ ń gbádùn nípasẹ̀ ìṣọ̀kan nínú Ise 2: 42-47.<li>Farabalẹ̀ ṣàyẹ̀wò Ise 15: 36-40; Gal 5: 13-15 - Kí o sì jíròrò lórí àwọn okùnfà àti àwọn ewu ti ó wà nínú èdè-àìyedè nínú ara Kristi
lessons.ipari: Ìṣọ̀kan nínú ìjọ kò túmọ̀ sí pé àwọn ènìyàn kò lè sọ onírúurú èrò wọn tó lè yàtọ̀ síra lórí àwọn ọ̀ràn kan; ṣùgbọ́n wí pé olúkúlùkù gbọ́dọ̀ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ara wọn. Ẹ máa gba ara yín mọ́ra láì wo ìyàtọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́, ẹ̀yà tàbí orílẹ̀-èdè, ipò ọrọ̀ ajé àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ. Ìṣọ̀kan yìí ń fi ijọ Ọlọ́run hàn fún ayé bí àwòkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ rere, ó sì ń fa ìdàgbàsókè ti ẹ̀mí àti ti ara.
lessons.funIronu: Ilé tí ó yapa sí ara rẹ̀ ko lè dúró.
lessons.akosori: Efe 4: 3 “Ki ẹ si maa làkàkà lati pa ìṣọ̀kan Ẹ̀mi mọ́ ni idìpọ̀ àláfia.
lessons.theme: Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Accepting the gospel like a child (1)
lessons.aims: <li>to expound the type of unity found among children,<li>to highlight advantages of Christian unity over disunity and<li>to demonstrate that disunity is not compatible with Christianity.
lessons.introduction: Unity among Children means to stay as one regardless of the differences and the circumstance. Among age group: 8-14 years, there is always unity and harmony with and among individuals in the group. Unity continues by accepting and appreciating each person and his or her contribution.  As Christians we must shun disparity in propagating the gospel. Being united as Christians gives us strength in the propagation of the gospel. Individually, people can be weak and prone to failure, but togetherness brings power.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> In your own words, explain or analyse unity among children and give examples.<li> In the concept of Psalm 133 what should be the harmony amongst Christians? Compare with 1 Cor. 12: 12-13, 1 Cor. 12:22-27; Eph 4: 1-3.<li> Enumerate the benefits the church enjoys as a result unity in Acts 2: 42-47. <li> Carefully examine Acts 15: 36-40; Gal 5: 13-15 and discuss the causes and demerits of disagreements in the body of Christ.
lessons.conclusion: Unity in a church does not in any way mean that people cannot express their different opinions on issues; but that members consciously cooperate with one another. Consciously accommodate one another despite differences in education, tribe or nationality, economic status etc, etc. This unity gives the world a positive image of the church, fosters both spiritual numerical and material growth.
lessons.foodForThougth: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
lessons.memoryVerse: Eph 4: 3 “Endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: ​​Gbígba ihinrere bi ọmọde (2)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàfihàn ìwà òtítọ́ nínú àwọn ọmọde,<li>láti ṣàfihàn pé ṣíṣe àbọ̀-òtítọ́ tàbí àìṣòtítọ́ rárá jẹ́ ẹ̀ṣẹ̀, àti<li>pé Ọlọ́run kórìíra àwọn òpùrọ́.
lessons.ifaara: Arákùnrin Kristẹni kan kò fẹ́ rí aládùúgbò rẹ̀ kan tí ó jẹ ní gbèsè. Nítorí náà, ó sọ fún ọmọ rẹ̀ ọmọ ọdún márùn-ún pé kí ó sọ fún aládùúgbò rẹ̀ pé òun (baba) kò sí nílé. Nígbà tí aládùúgbò náà dé nígbẹ̀yìn-gbẹ́yín, ó pàdé ọmọ náà tó sọ fún un pé bàbá òun sọ pé kí òun sọ fún un pé òun kò sí nílé. Nígbà tí a bèèrè bóyá ó mọ ibi tí bàbá rẹ̀ lọ, ọmọ kékeré náà dáhùn pé bàbá òun dùbúlẹ̀ lórí ibùsùn. Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ó tú àṣírí irọ́ bàbá rẹ̀ láìmọ̀. Èyí jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ ìwà òtítọ́ àwọn ọmọdé. Wọn kò mọ bí a ṣe lè purọ́ tàbí tannijẹ. Ẹ̀kọ́ wa tòní ń pe àkíyèsí wa sí òtítọ́ pé Jósẹ́fù kò darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ìwà búburú ti àwọn arákùnrin rẹ̀, níbi tí ó ti ń sọ àṣírí wọn fún baba rẹ̀ nígbà gbogbo.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé ohun tí òtítọ́ jẹ́ ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìwà àwọn ọmọdé, kí o sì ṣàyẹ̀wò ohun tí kò tọ̀nà nínú ìwà ti arákùnrin Kristẹni hù nínú ìfáàrà ókè yìí?<li>Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú  ìwà àwọn arákùnrin Jósẹ́fù nínu Gen. 37: 31-33, báwo ni o ṣe lè ṣe àtúpalẹ̀ ìwà òtítọ́ Jósẹ́fù nínú Gen. 37: 2?<li>Ṣàlàyé ìwà àwọn tọkọtaya Kristẹni àkọ́kọ́ nínú Ise 5: 1-9 àti ìdájọ́ Ọlọ́run lórí ohun tí wọ́n ṣe.<li>Kí ló yẹ kí ó jẹ́ ìwà Kristẹni níwájú Ọlọ́run? Ps.15: 1-2; Ps 51: 6; John 8: 32; Àti àtúbọ̀tán fún gbogbo àwọn òpùrọ́? Ise 21: 8.
lessons.ipari: Òótọ́ jẹ́ ìwà rere, nígbà tí irọ́ pípa jẹ́ ẹ́ṣẹ̀ àti áìwà-bí-Ọlọ́run. Bíbélì ṣàfihàn ohun tí Ọlọ́run sọ àti ìdájọ́ rẹ̀ sórí àwọn Kristẹni tó ń sọ òtítọ́ àti àwọn tó ń purọ́ tí wọ́n sì ń tan àwọn ẹlòmíràn jẹ. Nítorí náà, ó yẹ kí á máa gbé òtítọ́ ró nígbà gbogbo gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ti ọmọdé.
lessons.funIronu: Òtítọ́ lọba ìwà.
lessons.akosori: Johanu. 8: 32 “Ẹ ó si mọ̀ otitọ, otitọ yio si sọ nyin di omnira.
lessons.theme: Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Accepting the gospel like a child (2)
lessons.aims: <li>to expose the truthful nature in children,<li>to highlight the fact that telling half-truth or outright untruthfulness is sinfulness and that<li>that God hates liars.
lessons.introduction: A certain Christian man did not want to see his neighbour whom he owed some money. So, he told his five-year-old son to tell the neighbour that he (the father) was not at home. When the neighbour eventually came, he met the child who told him that his father said he should tell him that he is not at home. When asked if he knew where his dad went, the young child replied that his father was lying on the bed. Thus, he unknowingly exposed his father's lie. This is an example of the truthful nature of children. They don't know how to lie or deceive. Our Text today draws our attention to the fact that Joseph never joins the evil practices of his brethren as he always exposes them to his father.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Define truth in the children context and analyse what was wrong in the actions of the Christian father in the introduction above?<li> In the context of Joseph's brothers' behaviour in Gen 37: 31-33, how will you analyse Joseph's truthfulness in Gen 37: 2?<li> Describe the attitude of an early Christian couple in Acts 5: 1-9 and God's judgment on their action.<li> What should be the Christian's standard in God's presence? Ps. 15: 1-2;51: 6; Joh 8: 32; And the consequence for all liars? Rev. 21:8.
lessons.conclusion: Truthfulness is a godly virtue, while telling of lies is sinful and ungodly. The Bible is clear on what God says and his judgment on Christians who tell the truth and those who lie and deceive others. Therefore, we should always uphold the truth as little children.
lessons.foodForThougth: Truthfulness is the main element of character.
lessons.memoryVerse: Jn. 8: 32 “Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: ​​Gbígba ìhìnrere bí ọmọdé (3)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti ṣàfihàn àgbékalẹ̀ Bíbélì nípa ìṣòótọ́ àti pàtàkì rẹ̀ nínú ìsìn Kristẹni, àti<li>láti ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ àwọn ìhùwàsí tí ó ń fa àìṣòtítọ́.
lessons.ifaara: Ǹjẹ́ o ti ṣàkíyèsí pé àwọn ọmọdé a máa sáré láti pàdé ẹnikẹ́ni ti wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ àti ẹni tí wọn bá mọ̀? Wọ́n a rọ̀ mọ́ ẹni náà, nígbà tí ẹni náà bá fẹ́ lọ, wọ́n á bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí sunkún. Èyí ni ìṣòótọ́ tí a ní láti ní sí Ọlọ́run gẹ́gẹ́ bi Kristẹn<li> Ìṣòótọ́ ń fa ọkàn sí ìbáṣepọ̀ àti ìṣọ̀kan tó lágbára. Èyí ló bí ìṣòtítọ́ tọkàntọkàn pẹ̀lú ìfọkànsìn aláìlẹ́gbẹ́.  Ìwòye Bíbélì nípa ìṣòótọ́  jẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ pọ́nńbélé. Èyí túmọ̀ sí pé a jọ̀wọ́ gbogbo ẹ̀dá wa fun ẹnìkan (Jos 24: 15). Irú ìṣòtítọ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ ni a fihàn wá làtọ̀runwá àti nípasẹ̀ ènìyàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti fún wa nínú àwọn òfin méjì àkọ́kọ́: “Ki iwọ ki o si fi gbogbo àyà rẹ, ati gbogbo ọkàn rẹ, ati gbogbo iyè rẹ, ati gbogbo agbara rẹ, fẹ Oluwa Ọlọrun rẹ” ati “Fẹ ọmọnikeji rẹ bi ara rẹ ” (Mark 12: 30-31).
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Sọ àpẹẹrẹ ìwà ìṣòótọ́ ọmọdé, kí o sì sọ̀rọ̀ lórí Mark 12: 30-31 ní ìbámu sí ìṣòtítọ́ sí Ọlọ́run àti ènìyàn.<li>Ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ ìṣòtítọ́ Rutu nínú Rut 1: 11-17 àti Maria Magdaleni nínú Joh. 20: 1, 10-17. Báwo ni wọ́n ti ṣe ìṣòtítọ́ sí ènìyàn àti sí Kristi?<li>Sọ nípa ìwà àwọn Kristẹni kan tó jẹ́ aláìṣòótọ́ sí Ọlọ́run ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ohun tí ó wà nínú Jos  24: 15-16; Rom. 1: 21-32 àti    1Ko 6: 14-16.<li>Kín ni èrè fun ìṣòtítọ́ sí Kristi gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti wà nínú Ifihan 2: 26-28, Ifi 3: 4-5, Ifi 3:11-13)?
lessons.ipari: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ lẹ̀yìn Jésù, a gbọ́dọ̀ fi ìṣòtítọ́ àti ìfọkànsìn wa hàn nípa ṣíṣe ìgbọràn sí àṣẹ Rẹ̀ pé: “Bi ẹnikẹni ba fẹ tọ̀ mi lẹhin, ki o sẹ ara rẹ̀, ki o si gbé agbelebu rẹ̀, ki o si mã tọ̀ mi lẹhin.” (Mark 8: 34). Nínú ìbáṣepọ̀ wa pẹ̀lú ara wa, a pè wá sí ìṣòótọ́ bíi ti Màríà Magdalénì.
lessons.funIronu: Ìṣòótọ́ jẹ́ ìpinnu àti ìfiyèdénú.
lessons.akosori: Mark 12: 30-31 - “Ki ìwọ ki o si fi gbogbo àyà rẹ, àti gbogbo ọkàn rẹ, ati gbogbo iyè rẹ, ati gbogbo agbara rẹ, fẹ́ Oluwa Ọlọ́run rẹ: èyí li òfin èkíní.  Èkejì si dàbí rẹ̀, Fẹ́ ọmọnìkejì rẹ bí ara rẹ. Ko si si òfin miran, ti o tóbi jù wọnyi lọ.”
lessons.theme: Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Accepting the gospel like a child (3)
lessons.aims: <li>to highlight the biblical concept of loyalty and its importance in Christianity and<li>to analyse behaviours that build disloyalty.
lessons.introduction: Have you ever noticed that children will always run to meet anyone they love and are so familiar with? They cling to the person and when the person tries to leave, they start crying. This is the loyalty we are to have towards God as Christians. The word loyalty brings to mind a powerful sense of belonging and solidarity. With it comes the idea of wholehearted fidelity coupled with unswerving devotion and duty.  The Biblical concept of loyalty is purely relational. This means our whole being is thoroughly committed to someone (Joshua 24: 15). Such loyalty is expressed to us in both the divine and the human realms as given to us in the first two commandments: “Love the Lord your God with all you soul, and with all your mind and with all your strength”, and “Love your neighbour as yourself” (Mark 12: 30-31).
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Give an example of a child's loyalty and then expatiate on Mark 12: 30-31 in the context of loyalty to God and man.<li> Analyse the loyalty of Ruth in Ruth 1: 11-17 and Mary Magdalene in Joh 20: 1,Joh 20:10-17. In what ways do they express loyalty to human and Christ? <li> Mention some Christians' behaviour that amount to disloyalty to God according to Josh. 24: 15-16; Rom. 1: 21-32 and 2 Cor. 6: 14-16.<li> What is the reward for loyalty to Christ according to Rev. 2: 26-28, Rev.3: 4-5, Rev.3:11-13)?
lessons.conclusion: As Jesus' disciples, we must demonstrate our loyalty and self-sacrificing allegiance by obeying His command that: “If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me” (Mark 8: 34). In our relationship with one another, we are called to steadfast loyalty like Mary Magdalene.
lessons.foodForThougth: Loyalty is a decision and a resolution of the soul.
lessons.memoryVerse: Mark 12: 30-31 “Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, and with all your mind and with all your strength, The second is this “Love your neighbour as yourself”. There is no commandment greater than these”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: ​​Gbígba Ìhìnrere bí Ọmọdé (4)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti jíròrò nípa ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé, àti<li>pé gbogbo àwọn ọmọ Ọlọ́run tòótọ́ gbọ́dọ̀ làkàkà láti gbe ìwà bí Kristi yìí wọ̀.
lessons.ifaara: Àwọn ọmọdé máa ń ní ìgbẹ́kẹ̀lé sí òbí wọn tàbí àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn àgbàlagbà láti gbé wọn, láti pọ̀n wọ́n tàbí fà wọ́n  lọ́wọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń rìn papọ̀. Wọn kò díbọ́n pé àwọ́n lè ṣe nǹkan fúnra wọn. Ìdí nìyí tí àwọn ọmọdé fi máa ń sọ pé: gbé mi, gbé mi pọ̀n, fún mi, wẹ̀ mí, wọ aṣọ mi fún mi abbl. Wọn kò lè dá ṣe ohunkóhun. Nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wa lónìí, Kristi ṣe àfihàn ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ Rẹ̀ nípa jíjọ̀wọ́ ara sílẹ̀ fún ìfẹ́ Ọlọ́run láti wá sí ayé yìí fún iṣẹ́ ìràpadà. Láti jẹ́ onírẹ̀lẹ̀. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kristẹni a ní láti mọ̀ bí a ti jẹ́ aláìlera tó, bí a ti ṣe jẹ́ aláìlágbára tó láti yí ipa ọ̀nà ìgbé ayé wa padà nípa agbára ti àwa tikarawa. Ó jẹ́ láti tọrọ àforíjì Ọlọ́run àti láti gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé E fún ìtọ́sọ́nà Rẹ̀.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ṣàlàyé ohun tí ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ túmọ̀ sí ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọdé àti ìfáàrà àti ẹ̀kọ́ kíkà wa. Filp 2: 8<li>Àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ wo la lè rí kọ́ nínú ìgbé ayé àwọn ọmọdé, tí a sì lè ṣàmúlo nínú gbogbo ìbáṣepọ̀ wa pẹ̀lú Ọlọ́run?<li>Ka Mat 18: 3-4; 1 Pet 5: 5-6 kí o sì jíròrò ìdí tí ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ fi jẹ́ ìwà tí ó yẹ ìjọba Ọlọ́run.<li>Kín ni èrè fún ìgbé-ayé onírẹ̀lẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bi Mat. 18: 4; Fil 2: 8-11; Col 2: 3
lessons.ipari: Bí a ṣe ń fojú sọ́nà fún ayẹyẹ Kérésìmesì, a gbọ́dọ̀ kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti inú ìbí onírẹ̀lẹ̀ àti ìgbé ayé Olúwa wa Jésù Krístì, kí a sì fi gbogbo ìgbéraga ìmọtara-ẹni-nìkan sílẹ̀, gbogbo àrankàn, àti gbogbo ẹ̀tàn, àti àgàbàgebè, àti ìlara, àti gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ búburú, ki a kọ́, kí a sì ṣàmúlò ìwà-rere bíi ti Kristi , èyí ti a mọ̀ sí ìrẹ̀lẹ̀.
lessons.funIronu: Ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ jẹ́ ìwà bí Kristi; ìgbéraga ní ìmọtara-ẹnì-nìkan.
lessons.akosori: Mat. 18: 4 "Nitorina ẹnikẹni ti o ba rẹ̀ ara rẹ̀ silẹ bi ọmọ kekere yi, on na ni yio pọ̀ju ni ìjọba ọ̀run."
lessons.theme: Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Accepting the gospel like a Child (4)
lessons.aims: <li>to discuss the concept of humility among children and<li>that all true children of God must endeavour to develop this Christ-like character.
lessons.introduction: Children are always dependent on their parent or their older siblings to carry them, to back them or shoulder them while they are going together. They don't pretend to be able to do things themselves. That is why children will always say: carry me, back me, give me, bath me, wear my cloth for me etc. They are total dependents. In our text today, Christ demonstrated his humility by submitting to God's will to come into this world for the work of redemption. To be humble as Christians is to realize how weak we are, how helpless we are in changing the course of our lives by our own power. It is to ask God for His forgiveness and to trust Him for His guidance.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> Explain what humility means within the context of children and our introduction and text. Phil 2: 8<li> What useful lessons on humility can we learn from the life of children and that can be applied in all our relationships with God?  <li> Read Matt 18: 3-4; 1 Pet 5: 5-6 and discuss why humility is a virtue towards God's kingdom.<li> What are the rewards for humble livelihood according to Matt 18: 4; Phil 2: 8-11; Col 2:3.
lessons.conclusion: As we look forward to celebrating Christmas, we must learn from the humble birth and livelihood of our Lord Jesus Christ and lay aside all selfish pride, all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speaking, in other to cultivate and practice this Christ-like virtue known as humility.
lessons.foodForThougth: Humility is Christ-like; pride is selfish.
lessons.memoryVerse: Matt. 18: 4 “Therefore, whoever humbles himself like a child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven”.

lessons.akori: Jíjọba Ọlọ́run: Àwọn ọmọ àti Ìjọba Ọlọ́run
lessons.ekaAkori: ​​Gbigba ìhinrere bi Ọmọdé (5)
lessons.erongba: <ol> <li>láti kọ́ nípa ìfẹ́ tó wà láàrin àwọn ọmọdé, àti<li>láti ṣe àfihàn ọ̀nà tí a le gbà láti ṣàmúlò ìfẹ́ Kristẹn
lessons.ifaara: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn ìwà àwọn ọmọdé ni ìfẹ́ láarin ara wọn, débi pé, ó rọrùn fún wọn lati tètè parí ìjà láàrin ara wọn. Ọmọdé kan sọ fún ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ̀ nígbà kan  pé "wòó, màmá mi sọ pé n kò gbọdọ̀ wá sí ilé yín mọ́ o". Ìyàlẹ́nu ló jẹ́ pé wọ́n tẹ̀síwájú láti máa ṣeré papọ̀. Ìfẹ́ Kristẹni ni à ń fihàn sí àwọn ẹlòmíràn, kì í ṣe sí àwa tìkarawa. Irú ìfẹ́ yìí jẹ́ ojúlówó láàrin àwọn ọmọdé, ṣùgbọ́n a kò gbọdọ̀ fi í pe ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ nítorí ìfẹ́ jẹ́ ìfara-ẹni-jìn nígbà tí ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ iṣẹ́ ìmọ-tara-ẹni-nìkan láti gba èrè padà.
lessons.ibere: <ol> <li>Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìfáàrà wa, ṣàlàyé ìfẹ́ láàrin àwọn ọmọdé kí o sì fi àpẹẹrẹ ṣe àlàyé ìyàtọ̀ láàrin ìfẹ́ àti ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ pàápàá láàrin àwọn ọ̀dọ́ wa.<li>Kín ni àwọn àmúyẹ ìfẹ́ Kristẹni ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú 1Ko 13: 4-8?<li>Báwo ni Ọlọ́run ṣe fi ìfẹ́ Rẹ̀ hàn sí aráyé? John 3: 16; Rom 5: 8; 1 John 4:9. Báwo ni a ṣe lè fi ìfẹ́ wa hàn sí Ọlọrun? Lk 10: 27; Joh 14:15,Joh 14:21,Joh 14:23<li>Jíròrò lórí àwọn ìpilẹ̀ ìfẹ́ Kristẹni ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú 1Ko 13: 1-3 kí o sì mẹ́nu ba díẹ̀ lára àwọn àyè tí a ti ní láti fi ìfẹ́ Kristẹni hàn nínú Ìjọ wa?
lessons.ipari: Bí a ṣe ń ṣe ayẹyẹ Kérésìmesì, àkókò yìí yẹ kí ó máa rán wa létí nígbà gbogbo nípa ìfẹ́ Ọlọ́run ní fifi ọmọ bíbí Rẹ̀ kanṣoṣo fún wa gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀bùn ìràpadà fún gbogbo ènìyàn. Nítorí náà, ẹ jẹ́ ki á máa fi ìfẹ́ tòótọ́ hàn nígbà gbogbo nínúIse àti ìwà wa nípa fífi ara wa fún iṣẹ́ ìsìn àwọn ẹlòmíràn, kì í ṣe nípa ìmọ̀lára lásán.
lessons.funIronu: Ìfẹ́ Kristẹni kìí ṣe onímọtara-ẹni-nìkan bí kò ṣe fífi ara ẹni fúnni
lessons.akosori: 1 Joh.  3: 18, “Ẹnyin ọmọ mi, ẹ máṣe jẹ ki a fi ọrọ tabi ahọn fẹran, bikoṣe ni iṣe ati li otitọ.”
lessons.theme: Reign of God: Children and The Kingdom of God
lessons.subTheme: Accepting the gospel like a Child (5)
lessons.aims: <li>to teach the concept of love among children and<li>to highlight practical working of Christian love.
lessons.introduction: One of the basic characters in children is love among themselves to the extent that, they easily and quickly settle quarrels among themselves. A child once said to her friend “see, my mummy said I should not come to your house again o”. Surprisingly, they continued playing together. Christian love is directed outward towards others, not inwards towards us. This kind of love is natural to children but must never be confused with lust because love is selfless sacrifice while lust is selfish service in search for return.
lessons.studyGuide: <ol><li> In the context of our Introduction, explain love among children and explain with examples the difference between love and lust especially among our youths.<li> What are the main characteristics of Christian love according to 1Cor.13: 4-8?<li> How did God demonstrated His love towards mankind? Joh 3: 16; Ro 5: 8; 1Jo 4:9. And how can we express our love towards Him? Lu 10: 27; Joh 14: 15, Joh 14:21, Joh 14:23<li> Discuss the fundamentals of Christian love according to 1Cor 13: 1-3 and mention some areas where we need to show Christian love in our parish Church?
lessons.conclusion: As we celebrate Christmas, the season should always remind us of God's love in sending His only begotten son as gift of redemption for all mankind. Therefore, let us continuously show real love in our actions and attitudes by giving ourselves to the service of others and not ordinary feeling.
lessons.foodForThougth: Christian Love is not self-seeking but self-giving.
lessons.memoryVerse: 1 Jn. 3: 18, “Dear friends let us not love with words or tongue but with actions and truth.”
